Displacement: On 20 March 2021, in Aungpan town (Kalaw Township, Taunggyi District, Shan State), about 70% of the total population in the town reportedly has fled after a violent crackdown against protesters on 19 March by the Myanmar military and police forces. Aungpan town has about 30,000 population.

Property destruction: On 20 March 2021, in Dagon Myothit (east) township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), the security forces (assumed to be the Myanmar military and police) arrived and destroyed CCTV and shops. Similar incidents also happened in some other parts of Yangon.

On 20 March 2021, in Kawlin town (Kawlin Township, Katha District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military and police raided the Kawlin Railway Station compound and fired gunshots. Three people (government railway workers) were arrested.
On 20 March 2021, in Yangon (Yangon city), the security forces (assumed to be the Myanmar military and police) arrested a 13-year-old child and an adult at 8:19 PM night.
Security measures: On 20 March 2021, in Hlaingthayar township (Yangon (North) District, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military entered and searched the Htee Hlaing Shin housing complex.

On 20 March 2021, in Hpakant town (Hpakant Township, Mohnyin District, Kachin State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a daughter of a NLD member of Pyithu Parliament representing Hpakant township.

On 21 March 2021, in Pyinmana town, Pyinmana Township (Det Khi Na district, Nay Pyi Taw Region), a freelance journalist was arrested after he went to a police station to retrieve his laptop and vehicle which were confiscated by police after a crackdown on an anti-coup demonstration on 20 March. He was later charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code on 23 March.

Security measures: On 21 March 2021, in Monywa town (Monywa Township, Monywa District, Sagaing Region), security forces (assumed to be military and police) conducted a raid on a housing complex, and searched through every room including the office of Myanmar Computer Professionals Association, where people who had participated in protests were allegedly hiding. No arrests were made.

Displacement: Around 21 March 2021 (between 18 - 24 March), in Sun Long village tract in (Hsipaw Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), more than 300 villagers - from five villages in Sun Long village tract - including children, sick people and pregnant women fled due to the ongoing clashes between the RCSS and TNLA.

On 21 March 2021, in Hlaingthayar township (Yangon (North) District, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military stopped a car with staff from the Thukha Kar Yi Charity, a humanitarian organization. The organization chairperson and 3 staff were arrested.

Non-violent activity: On 21 March 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), locals including health workers organized people-less protests - reportedly in more than one locations - against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement

Movement of forces: Around 22 March 2021 (as reported), the Myanmar military deployed several troops at villages such as Ei Hei, Noet Naw War, Nyaung Kone, Ta Dar U and Ka Saw Lawka Ki in Hpa-an township (Hpa-an District, Kayin State).

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 22 March 2021, in Dawbon town (Dawbon Township, Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), a fire broke out at the Nwe Aye ward administration office. The cause of the fire was not known. This comes amid increasingly common arson attacks against ward administration offices.

Non-violent activity: On 22 March 2021, in Mindat town, Mindat township (Mindat district, Chin State), locals put up posters in a square in front of a market in a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup.

Non-violent activity: On 22 March 2021, on the Myanmar-China border in Muse township (Muse district, Shan state), locals hung banners with slogans in a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 22 March 2021, at a cemetery in Nyaungdon town (Nyaungdon Township, Maubin District, Ayeyarwady Region), locals held a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

SOURCE: Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 22 March 2021, in Dawei town, Dawei township (Dawei district, Tanintharyi Region), military and police forces arrested around 50 people in relation to the incident on 21 March, where two soldiers were allegedly beaten to death following a confrontation. It was reported that a 2-year-old child was taken away as well.

Arrests: On 22 March 2021, in between Hlegu township in Yangon region and Waw township in Bago region (coded as Hlegu) (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), security forces (assumed to be the Myanmar military and police) arrested 14 people, including 11 NLD members from Thanlyin, South Dagon, Thingangyun and Hlaingthayar townships in Yangon Region. Security forces accused them of attempting to get trained on making explosive devices from an unspecified ethnic armed group.

Other: On 22 March 2021, in Chanayethazan township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), military and police forces interrupted a funeral ceremony for a 16-year-old boy who was killed by security forces during a night raid in the township on 21 March 2021. They took away the body of the slain boy.

Arrests: On 22 March 2021, in Seik Gyi village (Hinthada township, Hinthada district, Ayeyarwady region), about 20 Myanmar police officers arrested a man after checking his Facebook account. He was a person with disabilities and was also a former TV producer at Mizzima media. He left his job at Mizzima within a week after the coup and participated in protests while he was in Yangon before returning to his village.

On 22 March 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), seven young men were arrested by the police. It was reported that they were part of the neighbourhood night watch team that had been patrolling the neighbourhood to provide security. They were off-duty when they were arrested at home.

On 22 March 2021, in Nwei Nyo Chaung village (Pathein township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady Region), 41 Rohingya (including 32 women, 3 children, six men) were arrested by police after the boat they were on broad capsized. They were then detained at a COVID-19 patient care centre in Thea Kone village tract.

Displacement: Around 22 March 2021 (as reported), in Hpapun township (Hpapun District, Kayin State), about 1,000 villagers from Lel Mu Pa Law and Hi Ko villages fled due to recent fighting between the Myanmar military and KNU in the area.

Non-violent activity: On 23 March 2021, in Myeik town, Myeik township (Myeik District, Tanintharyi Region), a people-less protest using barbie dolls was held against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 23 March 2021, in Pabedan township (Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), a people-less protest was held against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.
On 23 March 2021, in Pathein town (Pathein township, Pathein District, Ayeyarwady region), the Myanmar military and police arrested a chairman of Human Rights Watch and Defence (HRWD).

Arrests: On 23 March 2021, in Pyapon town (Pyapon Township, Pyapon District, Ayeyarwady Region), the Myanmar military and police raided shops in a market and seized slingshot and related accessories. The security forces also ordered shop owners not to sell slingshots. During the raid, one civilian was also arrested.

Arrests: On 23 March 2021, in Kyon Ku village (Pyapon Township, Pyapon District, Ayeyarwady Region), about 30 military and police searched a house and arrested a civilian. Some properties were also looted.

On 23 March 2021, at Yatada Thiri ward in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan State), the Myanmar military and police entered to award and arrested five civilians, including a worker at a motorcycle repair shop, a retired teacher and a 5-year-old child. Residents of the ward participated in recent anti-coup protests.

Property destruction: On 23 March 2021, in Patheingyi town (Patheingyi Township, Mandalay District, Mandalay Region), more than 10 unknown assailants destroyed the DENKO petrol station cashier counter door and fired at the station with a molitov cocktail. The fire was extinguished with fire extinguishers. The owner of DENKO patrol stations has close ties to the Myanmar military.

Movement of forces: On 23 March 2021, in Nyaunglebin district (Bago region), the Myanmar military sent troops with 16 military trucks, along with rations with 9 military trucks. Five military trucks were headed to Kyaukkyi township.

SOURCE: Kachin News Group; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 24 March 2021, in Nyein Chan Thar Yar village, Lone Khin village tract, Hpakant township (Mohnyin District, Kachin State), about 50 military soldiers (from the 33rd Brigade) and police officers raided the house of two NLD members and arrested them. Protest placards and billboards were also found at one of their homes and confiscated by security forces.

Arrests: On 24 March 2021, in Pathein town (Pathein township, Pathein District, Ayeyarwady region), more than 100 Myanmar military and police raided a house and arrested a man in his 60s. He was arrested after security forces could not find his son.

On 24 March 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), military and police forces conducted a raid in Kyauk Myaung ward and made arrests. The exact number of arrests was not confirmed. This happened while markets and shops were closed across Yangon and across Myanmar as part of the 'silent strike' to protest against the Myanmar military coup.

On 24 March 2021, in Hopong Township (Taunggyi district, Shan State), military and police forces conducted a night raid in the sub-office of a local media outlet Kanbawza Tai News as well as the private residences of two staff members and arrested four people, including the editor-in-charge, a publisher, a news reporter and a security guard. It was reported that the news outlet had been targeted despite not being issued any charges or warnings.

On 24 March 2021, in Wea Gyi Wa village, Einme township (Myaungmya district, Ayeyarwady Region), two military vehicles arrived at the village and arrested two villagers. The reason for their arrests was not clear, but it was reported that there were rumours that they were involved in making homemade weapons. A villager heard gunshots as the soldiers entered the village.
On 24 March 2021, in Aung Chan Thar ward, Khin-U town, Khin-U township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), at night, police arrested 14 volunteer night guards.

SOURCE: Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: Strikes: On 24 March 2021, people across Myanmar held a 'silent strike' against the Myanmar military coup, with many businesses closed and people staying home. The movement was also to honour the victims who had lost their lives during the resistance against the Myanmar coup that began on 1 February. Location coded as Nay Pyi Taw.

SOURCE: Network Media Group; Kachin News Group
NOTES: Movement of forces: Around 25 March 2021 (as reported), around Laiza where the KIA headquarters is located, in Waingmaw Township (Myitkyina District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military allegedly increased troop deployment. After the KIA attacked the Myanmar military base on 11 March, the fighting has been intensified in Kachin State.

Non-violent activity: On 25 March 2021, in Tangyan town (Tangyan Township, Lashio District, Shan State), a people-less protest was held against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 25 March 2021, in Namhkan town (Namhkan Township, Muse District, Shan State), a people-less protest was held against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 25 March 2021, in Pathein town (Pathein township, Pathein District, Ayeyarwady region), locals held a people-less protest and lined up umbrellas with protest slogans against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Security measures: On 25 March 2021, in Namhkan township (Muse District, Shan State), the Myanmar military raided houses of IDPs who had left their villages such as Awe Law and Man San following a clash between the Myanmar military and a combined force of TNLA and MNDAA on 25 March. During the clash, more than 300 villagers fled.

On 25 March 2021, in Penwegon town, Kyauktaga township (Bago District, Bago Region), military soldiers arrived at a resident's house and demanded to see the son. While the mother stated that the son was not at home, they arrested her instead. It was reported that both of them as well as her husband had been charged under Section 505 (a) of the Penal Code but it was not reported why they had been charged.

Looting: On 25 March 2021, in Gangaw Township, Gangaw District, Magway Region, the Myanmar military arrived at and raided four villages - Pyar village, Shone Shi village, Kan village and Kan Thar village. They searched houses in the village with the help of a local guide. Two villagers were arrested during the raid in Kan village. In Kan Thar village, Myanmar military looted money and other valuable things. They also searched houses of health workers who joined the civil disobedience movement.

Property destruction: On 25 March 2021, on a road towards Nam Man village in Mongngawt sub-township (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), unknown assailants set 10 shops on fire at night. Those 10 shops were owned by four different people. Before the incident, the RCSS and TNLA clashed in Kyaukme township two days ago.

Arrests: On 25 March 2021, in Thuwunna ward in Thingangyun township (Yangon (East) District, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military and police raided a charity office and arrested four people. The Myanmar military also looted pots and pans, cups and plates from the office.
On 25 March 2021, in Phyu town (Phyu Township, Taungoo District, Bago Region), the son of a NLD parliamentarian was arrested by police. The exact reason for the arrest was not reported.

On 25 March 2021, in Yankin township (Yangon-East District, Yangon region), military and police forces raided some rooms in a housing estate and arrested some government staff who were on strike in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 26 March 2021, in Hlaing township (Yangon-West District, Yangon region), engineers held a people-less protest by placing helmets on the streets against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 26 March 2021, in Aunglan town, Aunglan township (Thayet District, Magway region), people held a people-less protest at a cemetery against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 26 March 2021, in Chanayethazan township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), people hung medical white coats in front of University of Medicine, Mandalay in a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 26 March 2021, in Kengtung town, Kengtung township (Kengtung district, Shan State), residents held a people-less housewives protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 26 March 2021, in Lashio town (Lashio Township, Lashio District, Shan State), young people held a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 26 March 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), doctors' white coats were hung at the entrance of a medical clinic as part of a people-less protest to mourn the death of those who had been killed during anti-coup demonstrations.

SOURCE: Channel News Asia; Radio Free Asia; Myanmar Now
NOTES: Property destruction: On 26 March 2021, in Bahan township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), an unidentified group of at least three men carried out an arson attack by hurling Molotov cocktails at the NLD party headquarters. The office's doors, furniture and a water pump were destroyed.

On 26 March 2021, in Minbu town, Minbu Township (Minbu district, Magway Region), a freelance journalist associated with Magway Post was summoned to Minbu police station where he was detained and immediately transferred to Magway Prison. It was reported that he was charged under Section 505 (a) of the Penal Code.

SOURCE: Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma; Irrawaddy
NOTES: On 26 March 2021, in Monywa town (Monywa Township, Monywa District, Sagaing Region), in the early morning, security forces (assumed to be police and military) broke into houses, kicked down doors and arrested about 15 men. They were reportedly looking for a man by name but arrested his wife and son instead after they failed to find him. They also arrested 6-7 men sitting at a teashop, including the owner and employee. The reason for the arrests was not reported. In total, 20 people were reportedly arrested. They were reportedly released at the same time at 1pm. As well, they arrested about 30 people living around Sarkyin Cemetery where the bodies of two police officers were found on 25 March. Myanmar military and police demanded a ransom of Ks.500,000 to 5,000,000 for each arrestee.

On 26 March 2021, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan State), military and police forces entered neighbourhoods in the town. They fired tear gas, and also fired either rubber bullets or live rounds in private homes, and threw rocks at houses. Two civilians were arrested.
On 26 March 2021, in Magway town (Magway Township, Magway District, Magway Region), the Myanmar police arrested a Magway Post journalist. He was sent to Magway Prison.

On 26 March 2021, in Myeik town (Myeik Township, Myeik District, Tanintharyi Region), military and police forces arrested a woman who publicly stated that she would help the injured in Myeik. It was reported that security forces also took away some 100,000 kyats from her house and she has since been charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code for defamation.

Change to armed group: On 26 March 2021, in Mandalay region, the Yadanarbon Urban Revolutionary Front (YURF) was formed with the aim to perform clearance operations of military informants and attack security posts.

Arrests: On 26 March 2021, in Hpa-an town (Hpa-an Township, Hpa-an District, Kayin State), the Myanmar police arrested a Kayin traditional boxing trainer along with some of trainees. They were arrested after the police found them carrying sand bags on 25 March.

SOURCE: Myanmar Labour News; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: Property destruction: On 27 March 2021, in Dagon Myothit (Seikkan) township (Yangon (east) district, Yangon Region), the security forces (assumed to be the Myanmar military and police) destroyed more than 20 cars. They also destroyed makeshift roadblocks with a bulldozer. The incident reportedly happened after ward-94 administration office near Yuzana Housing was burned.

SOURCE: Thit Htoo Lwin; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: Property destruction: On 27 March 2021, on 116 (A) street located between 117 street and 56/57 street in Pyigyitagon township (Mandalay District, Mandalay region), more than 50 houses were set on fire. Similarly, a ward administration office was also burned down at the corner of 90 street. It was not known who was responsible for setting the fire.

On 27 March 2021, in Kawlin town (Kawlin Township, Katha District, Sagaing Region), the son of an NLD secretary of Kawlin township was arrested by security forces (assumed to be military and police). He is currently being held under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code. It was reported that three other people - including an under-16 boy - were arrested along with him.

On 27 March 2021, in Ah Sin village in Ye Township (Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) fired gunshots and arrested 24 fishermen. The village is home to many migrant workers.

On 27 March 2021, at Yan Aung ward in Tachileik town (Tachileik Township, Tachileik District, Shan State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) raided houses in the neighbourhood. They arrested a woman for live streaming while they were raiding houses.
Change to armed group: On 27 March 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), the Generation Z Power (GZP-Mandalay (Mandalay)) was formed to fight against the Myanmar military.

Change to armed group: On 27 March 2021, in Mandalay region, the Hta-Naung Task Force (HTF) was formed to fight against the military with guerrilla tactics. The HTF is based in middle Burma covering 8 townships including Pyawbwe and Yamethin. Location coded as Mandalay.

Property destruction: On 27 March 2021, in Chanmyathazi town, Chanmyathazi township (Mandalay District, Mandalay Region), an unknown assailant set an unused Kanthayar Police Station on fire. The source didn't report who set the fire. Police officers who were based at Kanthayar Police Station were transferred to Aung Pin Lay Police Station on 1 February.

On 27 March 2021, in Hlaing township (Yangon-west District, Yangon Region), a woman who got out of her house did not return home. Later, her parents were informed that she was arrested and was in Insein prison.

On 28 March 2021, in Myit Chay in Pakokku township (Pakokku District, Magway region), the Myanmar military arrived at ward-8 and arrested four youth. This happened one day after a fight broke out on the streets between local youths and USDP members.

On 28 March 2021, in Ywar Thar Yar village (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay Region), the military arrested the mother and brother of a government employee who was on strike in support of the civil disobedience movement. It was reported that the detainee had not been able to contact their family.

SOURCE: Karen Information Center News; Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Now; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: Displacement: On 28 March 2021, in Hpapun township (Hpapun District, Kayin State), following the Myanmar military airstrike targeting the KNU brigade-5, more than 10,000 civilians fled. Out of more than 10,000 civilians, more than 3,000 people crossed the border to Thailand. However, the Thai Government returned those people to Hpapun township on 29 March.

SOURCE: Irrawaddy; Democratic Voice of Burma; Thit Htoo Lwin
NOTES: Property destruction: On 28 March 2021, at Pyigyitagon township (Mandalay District, Mandalay region), an unknown assailant on a motorcycle set a house on fire. The fire spread to more than 80 hours nearby. Firefighters and residents attempted to extinguish the fire, but Myanmar military and police fired warning shots to stop them from extinguishing the fire promptly. The fire displaced about 100 civilians.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2016-); NLD: National League for Democracy
SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Now
NOTES: On 28 March 2021, in Pyin Oo Lwin town (Pyin Oo Lwin Township, Pyin Oo Lwin District, Mandalay Region), an NLD parliamentarian and his wife (a civil servant) were arrested, assumed by the military junta (coded as military and police forces). It was reported that other family members were also arrested, but this has yet to be verified. The military junta had previously issued an arrest warrant for the parliamentarian under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.

On 28 March 2021, in Ye town (Ye Township, Mawlamyine District, Mon State), at night, the Myanmar military and police arrested a car workshop owner while he was watching a TV Livestream. Security forces also fired four rounds of gunshots before the arrest was made.

On 28 March 2021, in Shauk Taw village (Pwintbyu township, Minbu district, Magway Region), security forces (assumed to be military and police) raided a restaurant and arrested the owner's 15 year old son. The arrest came a day after another man was shot and killed in Pwintbyu township (event coded separately).

On 28 March 2021, in Ah Sin village in Ye Township (Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested 2 villagers allegedly for violating the night curfew order.

Displacement: On 28 March 2021, near Pang Long village in Namtu township (Kyaukme District, Shan State), following clashes between RCSS and a combined force of TNLA and SSPP with heavy weapons, more than 600 villagers fled to neighbouring villages.

On 28 March 2021, in Lashio town, Lashio township (Lashio district, Shan State), a woman was arrested at her home after military and police forces found safety helmets in her home, which reportedly belonged to their children who were studying in engineering school. She was later released on 29 March.

Non-violent activity: On 29 March 2021, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), people lined up placards on a street in a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.
Security measures: On 29 March 2021, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan State), military troops occupied a school near Nyaung Pin Thar Ward.

On 29 March 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East District, Yangon region), military and armed police forces entered different streets in Kyauk Maung ward and began firing either rubber bullets or live rounds. It was reported that some arrests were made, but the exact number was not confirmed.
On 29 March 2021, in Salin and Sin Phyu Kyun, Minbu township, Magway (Magway Township, Magway Region), security forces raided homes and arrested five people. DVB reported.

On 29 March 2021, in Tamu town (Tamu township, Tamu district, Sagaing region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a security guard (a Gurkha man) at a construction site. His whereabouts are still unknown.

Other: On 29 March 2021, in Aungpan Town (Kalaw Township, Taunggyi District, Shan State), military and police forces reportedly smashed the gate and broke into a crematorium. It was reported that security forces cremated at least seven bodies, believed to be bodies of protesters killed by security forces during an anti-coup protest in Taunggyi.

On 30 March 2021, in Pathein town (Pathein township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady region), men in plainclothes (assumed to be military and police forces) stormed a photo studio and arrested the shop owner and three other employees, allegedly for helping protesters print anti-coup placards and banners.

On 30 March 2021, in Maubin town (Maubin township, Maubin District, Ayeyarwady Region), the Myanmar military and police raided the Karuna Social Service office. One of its members was arrested. The office was also destroyed. The organization stopped their operation following the raid.

On 30 March 2021, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), an NLD member was arrested at his home (assumed to be by military and police forces). His whereabouts remain unknown as of 31 March 2021.
On 30 March 2021, in Thaketa Township (Yangon Region), security forces arrested some street vendors and 10 passers by for no reason.

Property destruction: On 30 March 2021, in Hpapun town (Hpapun Township, Hpapun District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military indiscriminately fired around the town and destroyed bridges in the town with fire. Several residents fled out of fear.

On 30 March 2021, in Bahan Township (Yangon (East) District, Yangon Region), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a man. Security forces accused him of opening gunfire at the American Center on 27 March.

SOURCE: Eleven Media Group; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: Non-violent activity: On 30 March 2021, in Thaketa township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), a people-less protest was staged by throwing garbage on streets against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

On 31 March 2021, in Lashio town, Lashio township (Lashio district, Shan-North state), the military forces arrested a woman from Ward 9 instead of her husband who was targeted but not home at the time of arrest. The wife was given a 3-year prison sentence on July 16.
Around 31 March 2021 (week of), in Insein township (Yangon (north) District, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military occupied No.3 Basic Education for HIgh School as their base camp.

Non-violent activity: On 31 March 2021, in Thegon Township (Pyay District, Bago Region), youths lined up placards on trees in a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 31 March 2021, in Dagon Myothit (North) (Yangon-East District, Yangon region), people lined up candles and inflated condoms in a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-)
NOTES: On 31 March 2021, in Ywar Thar Yar village, Shwe Myin Tin village track (Pathein Township, Ayeyarwady Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested 8 NLD members, including three elected Members of Parliament who were hiding in the village.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-); Police Forces of Myanmar (2021-)
SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Irrawaddy
NOTES: On 31 March 2021, in Shwe Myin Tin village, Pathein township (Pathein district, Ayeyarwady Region), military forces fired about 10 shots in the village before arresting nine men - including three NLD lawmakers, five NLD members, and one striking police office (in support of the civil disobedience movement) - who were hiding in the backyard behind a glass factory. The three NLD lawmakers had been in hiding since the coup and were charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.

Property destruction: On 31 March 2021, in Maubin town (Maubin Township, Maubin District, Ayeyarwady Region), a couple linked to the military and police forces came with swords and raided the office of a charity group Karuna Social Welfare Organization. Military and police forces also came to the scene. They destroyed properties in the office and a boy at the office was slapped on his cheek. It was reported that the organization had announced that it would not provide medical or funeral assistance to families of the military junta.
On 31 March 2021, in Thaketa Township, Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), military and police forces fired shots and made arrests in the township.

Movement of forces: On 31 March 2021, in Kale town, Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing Region), three military helicopters carrying soldiers and military equipment and weapons landed at Kale Airport at around 2pm.

Other: On 31 March 2021, the Committee Representing Pyidaungsu Hluttaw (CRPH) - committee representing ousted lawmakers elected in the 2020 elections - declared the abolition of the 2008 Constitution. The Committee stated that the Constitution has been invalidated following the coup d'etat staged on 1 February, which is in violation of the provisions of the 2008 Constitution. On the same day, the Committee announced the Federal Democracy Charter to serve as a roadmap to achieving a federal democracy union and the drafting of a new constitution. The CRPH also announced that the caretaker ministers and Vice President Mahn Win Khaing Than will continue to lead the country until a national unity government is formed. Location coded as Nay Pyi Taw.
On 31 March 2021, in Yangon City (Yangon Region), military and police forces fired shots and made arrests in several locations in the evening.

ACTOR1: KIO/KIA: Kachin Independence Organization/Kachin Independence Army
SOURCE: Irrawaddy; Myanmar Now; Network Media Group
NOTES: Property destruction: On 1 April 2021, in La Bang Kauk village in Hpakant township (Mohnyin District, Kachin State), the KIA set the Yuzana Sugar Factory on fire. The KIA also fired at the factory, which was reported to be closely linked to the military. Villagers claimed that Myanmar military and people militia soldiers were typically present to guard the factory but was not on site at the time of the incident. The land on which the factory stands was originally owned by Kachin people but it was seized by the factory in 2006.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-); Women (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 1 April 2021, in Myitkyina town (Myitkyina township, Myitkyina District, Kachin State), an NLD parliamentarian (elected in the 2020 elections) was arrested by three men working for the State Administration Council (coded as military and police forces). She was arrested during a meeting with the Lisu Literary and Cultural Committee.

On 1 April 2021, in Mawlamyine town, Mawlamyine township (Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the former chairperson of Mawlamyine University Students' Union was arrested at home by military and police forces. It was reported that at least 40 members of security forces were deployed for the arrest. The former chairperson has reportedly been protesting daily against the military coup.

Displacement: Around 1 April 2021 (between 30 March - 2 April), in Gangaw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), more than 10,000 villagers from five villages, including Hnam Kha, South Khim Yam, North Khim Yam, Thalin and Hanthawaddy fled to the forests, following clashes between local villagers and military forces.

On 1 April 2021, in Lashio town (Lashio Township, Lashio District, Shan State), three people were arrested by a local governor and military soldiers after banners used in anti-coup protests were found in their homes. It was reported that a car was also damaged a mobile phone was arrested.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Nikkei Asian Review
NOTES: Property destruction: On 1 April 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon Region), a fire broke out in two supermarkets - Ruby Mart and Gandamar Wholesale Shopping Center - run by a military-linked conglomerate for reasons unknown. All floors of the Ruby Mart building were badly damaged. An official from the fire department stated that he could not comment on the cause of the fire. Local observers believed that the fire may have been a deliberate arson attack, possibly by security forces looking for additional reasons to further crack down on anti-coup protesters. They noted that the fire broke out simultaneously at around 1-2am when the city was under a military-imposed curfew, and that one of the malls was located in a highly secure area controlled by security forces.

Change to armed group: On 1 April 2021, in Nyaungdon township (Maubin district, Ayeyarwady region), the Nyaungdon People Defense's Force was founded. The Nyaungdon PDF reported on December 1 that they previously did 13 attacks targeting military businesses and supporters including bombing MyTel telecom tower in Tu Chaung and Ohn Pin Su villages.

On 2 April 2021, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North district, Yangon Region), two women were arrested by the police after they were interviewed by the CNN correspondent and news team who were visiting at the 10 Mile market. Three others - including two women - who were taking photographs at the scene were also taken away. One of them was reportedly taken to an interrogation center in Shwepyithar township.

Property destruction: On 2 April 2021, in Bahan township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), the house of the interim Union Minister of the Committee Representing Pyidaungsu Hluttaw (committee representing ousted lawmakers elected in the 2020 elections) was set on fire for reasons unknown. No one was at home when the fire broke out.

On 2 April 2021, in Bago town, Bago township (Bago district, Bago Region), a doctor-cum-leader of a free medical clinic was arrested by the police and detained at the Bago General Administration Department office. The reason for his arrest was not known.
Displacement: Around 2 April 2021 (as reported), in Namtu township (Kyaukme district, Shan State), more than 1,000 villagers have fled fighting between the TNLA and the RCSS.

ACTOR1: RCSS/SSA-S: Restoration Council of Shan State/Shan State Army-South
NOTES: Movement of forces: On 2 April 2021, in Pang Long village (coded as Pang Long Ywar Ma) (Namtu Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), the RCSS took up position inside the village. The TNLA and SSPP also reportedly took up position on the outskirts of the village.

Displacement: Around 2 April 2021 (as reported), in Puta-O district, Kachin State), nearly 200 striking government staff (in support of the civil disobedience movement) from Puta-O, Nawngmun, Machanbaw have fled and gone into hiding in the forest and mountains, as the authorities have been conducting door-to-door raids to arrest striking government staff.
On 2 April 2021, in Insein (Insein Township, Yangon Region), security forces arrested nine people who spoked to Clarissa Ward, the CNN journalist in Myanmar.

On 2 April 2021, in Dagon Myothit (Seikkan) (Dagon Myothit (Seikkan) Township, Yangon Region), security forces arrested a group of young people, almost all of them planned to be a part of a defense group. The new ward administrator informed the police in advance.

Property destruction: On 3 April 2021, in Tamu town (Tamu township, Tamu district, Sagaing region), some locals reportedly burned a bridge connecting Tamu and Nang Phalong, and two security outposts (assumed to be the Myanmar police outpost). The locals also blocked the fire brigade office with sandbags and seized it.

Security measures: On 3 April 2021, in Tamu (Tamu Township, Sagain Region), security forces raided a house and store. The store owner was reportedly a member of the NLD party.

On 3 April 2021, in Mayangone township (Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), police and military forces stormed a doctor's home and arrested an orthopaedic surgeon (also a professor at University of Medicine, Yangon). He had reportedly been involved in the civil disobedience movement and had been providing medical treatment to those injured during anti-coup protests.
Security measures: On 3 April 2021, Hakha (Hakha Township, Chin State), security forces raided a news outlet based in Hakha and confiscated items.
On 3 April 2021, in Mohnyin (Mohnyin Township, Kachin State), security forces arrested five youth from a neighbourhood.

On 3 April 2021, in Lashio town (Lashio Township, Lashio District, Shan State), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested three residents from ward-5, ward-6 and ward-7. Three people were arrested for their involvement in the previous anti-coup protest.
On 3 April 2021, in Mandalay Township (Mandalay Region), security frorces arrested a motorcyclist.

Displacement: Around 4 April 2021 (week of), in Kani and Yinmarbin townships in Yinmarbin District (Sagaing Region), about 1,000 villagers from villages located around Alongtaw Kassapa National Park fled as the Myanmar military raided villages.

On 4 April 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay Township, Pyay District, Bago Region), security forces (assumed to be military and police forces) raided the office of an association providing free funeral services. The chairperson of the association was arrested. Humanitarian and charity organizations providing volunteer rescue services or funeral services have been targeted by security forces since the coup, possibly for providing free services to anti-coup demonstrators.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Labour News; Myanmar Now
