The reason for the arrests was not reported. A comedian was also taken away by police and military forces in two military vehicles in the morning from his home on 166 Street.

Security measures: On 6 April 2021, in Pyapon township (Pyapon District, Ayeyarwady Region), about 30 police and soldiers raided the home of a lawyer. The lawyer was reported to be one of six lawyers who have been supporting cases involving detained anti-coup protesters.

On 6 April 2021, in Za Yat Kwin village (Thabeikkyin township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), military and police forces raided the village and searched every house. At least five people - reported to be active members of anti-coup movement - were arrested.

On 6 April 2021, in Khin-U township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), military and police forces entered Kan Thit village and raided and searched through the house of a man who was killed by security forces during an anti-coup protest earlier on 25 March. Security forces then fired near Gway Kone village. A 20-year-old man was then taken away by security forces as he was entering a restaurant. It was reported that the shop was then smashed up by security forces, who also took away 1.1 million kyats from the restaurant owner's daughter.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-)
NOTES: On 6 April 2021, in Mawlamyinegyun township (Labutta District, Ayeyarwady Region), an NLD parliamentarian and his uncle were arrested by security forces while in hiding in a village. It was reported that a military regime informant reported on his whereabouts.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-)
NOTES: On 6 April 2021, in Kyaukpadaung township (Nyaung-U district, Mandalay Region), an NLD executive member-cum-parliamentarian was arrested by military and police forces after he briefly returned to his own residence.
On 6 April 2021, in Kengtung (Kengtung Township, Shan State), security forces arrested two youths for no reason.

On 6 April 2021, at Thar Wut Hti Nay Pyi Taw Council area, the security forces (assumed to be the military or police) arrested three friends of Ko Kyaw Ko Ko who is a member of the General Strike Committee (GSC). The security forces arrested three of them as they can't arrest Ko Kyaw Ko Ko himself. The whereabouts of three arrested people were not known yet.

Movement of forces: On 7 April 2021, in Pein Pyit (Upper) village (Mogoke Township, Pyin Oo Lwin District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military deployed troops in the village. Two soldiers stayed at each house in the village without the villagers' consent. More troops also reportedly arrived in the village on 8 April.

On 7 April 2021, near Pyin Oo Lwin town (Pyin Oo Lwin township, Pyin Oo Lwin District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military and police raided Asia Ahlinn Yaung Foundation (AHYF), and arrested a driver and a medical doctor from Yangon who visited the foundation. The security forces also searched the medical care centre and student accommodation and looted some money from students. The AHYF has been provided free healthcare service and education for underprivileged people for about more than 10 years.
On 7 April 2021, in Thabeikkyin (Thabeikkyin Township, Mandalay Region), security forces arrested up to 13 people.
On 7 April 2021, in Madaya (Madaya Township, Mandalay Region), more than 100 policemen stormed Lundaung village and arrested about 10 local villagers.
On 7 April 2021, in Pathein (Pathein Township, Ayeyarwady Region), military and police forces arrested an artist while raiding his house.
On 7 April 2021, in Mogoke (Mogoke Township, Mandalay Region), security forces arrested a former governor and four civilians.
On 7 April 2021, in Dagon Myothit (South) (Dagon Myothit (South) Township, Yangon Region), military and police forces arrested around 100 people.

On 7 April 2021, in Puta-O (Puta-O Township, Kachin State), military and police forces arrested a dentist who put up a sign announcing he would treat anyone who participate in the civil disobedience movement for free.

Displacement: On 7 April 2021, in Man Li village (Namtu Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), several hundreds of villagers from Man Li, Hkaing Mun, Tar Kay and Kun San Lat fled their villages due to the fighting between the RCSS and a combined force of SSPP and TNLA.

On 7 April 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) raided a house at night. They fired a warning shot and arrested two men.
Security measures: On 7 April 2021, in Mogoke (Mogoke Township, Mandalay Region), security forces raided a house and took away three mobile phones.

Property destruction: On 7 April 2021, in Yangon City (Yangon Region), a series of small explosions using handmade sound bombs or fireworks (reportedly meant to create noise and cause minimal damage) occurred at least seven locations in the city - including at government buildings, a military hospital and a shopping mall. A fire also broke out in a Chinese-owned garment factory. While the cause of the fire was not clear, there had been separate cases of fire at other Chinese-owned factories in the city. No casualties reported.

Security measures: On 8 April 2021, in Pathein town (Pathein Township, Pathein District, Ayeyarwady Region), the Myanmar military and police raided and searched two Christian Churches and a Mosque. But no one was reportedly arrested.

On 8 April 2021, in Dagon Myothit (North) (Yangon-East District, Yangon region), on the day after a lawsuit was filed against outspoken film actors under a penal code of 505 (A), the Myanmar military and police arrested one of the most outspoken film actors at his house.

Property destruction: Around 8 April 2021 (as reported), in Maubin town (Maubin township, Maubin District, Ayeyarwady region), the ward administration seized and destroyed PSI satellite dishes under the direction of the General Administration Department. The satelite dishes enable locals to receive news about anti-coup protests. Similarly, incidents were also reportedly happened in other townships in the Ayeyarwady region.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 8 April 2021, in Dagon Myothit (east) township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), at night, an unknown assailant reportedly set the Ward No-2 Administration Office on fire.

On 8 April 2021, in Hpa-an town, Hpa-an township (Hpa-an District, Kayin State), a female paediatrician who runs a paediatric clinic in Ward 1 was arrested by plain clothed police officers. While the reason for her arrest was not reported, it was believed to be linked to the fact that the paediatrician had put up a sign outside of her clinic stating that she would refuse to provide services to those who are not supporting the civil disobedience movement.

On 8 April 2021, in Botahtaung township (Yangon-East, Yangon region), the co-founder and an employee of independent news outlet Mizzima were arrested by the military junta (coded as military and police). They were taken to the Yay Kyi Ai military interrogation centre in Insein Township. Mizzima later issued a statement clarifying that the co-founder had already resigned in February after the coup due to poor health. Location coded and assumed to be in Yangon Region. The co-founder was released on 18 October.

Non-violent activity: On 8 April 2021, in Pyin Oo Lwin town (Pyin Oo Lwin Township, Pyin Oo Lwin District, Mandalay Region), locals held a people-less 'Shoe Strike campaign' in honour of heroes killed by security forces in a recent crackdown against the Anti-coup protesters and in protest against the Myanmar military coup.

Non-violent activity: On 8 April 2021, in Lashio town (Lashio township, Lashio District, Shan State), locals held a people-less 'Shoe Strike campaign' in honour of heroes killed by security forces in a recent crackdown against the Anti-coup protesters and in protest against the Myanmar military coup.

Non-violent activity: On 8 April 2021, in Dala township (Yangon (south) district, Yangon region), locals held a people-less ghost protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 8 April 2021, in Muse town (Muse Township, Muse District, Shan State), locals held a people-less 'Shoe Strike campaign' in honour of heroes killed by security forces in a recent crackdown against the Anti-coup protesters and in protest against the Myanmar military coup.

Non-violent activity: On 8 April 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), locals held a people-less 'Shoe Strike campaign' in honour of heroes killed by security forces in a recent crackdown against the Anti-coup protesters and in protest against the Myanmar military coup.

On 8 April 2021, in Insein township (Yangon-North district, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military raided the neighbourhood in Hpaw Kan ward and searched people who involved in an anti-coup protest held in Insein on 6 April when protesters also burned the Chinese flag. The Myanmar military arrested 4 civilians.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 9 April 2021, in Mawlamyine town, Mawlamyine township (Mawlamyine district, Mon state), a fire broke out in the morning at the Shwe Myaing Thiri ward administration office. The cause of the fire was not reported, although government buildings had been hit by arson attacks recently.
On 9 April 2021, in Tedim Town (Falam District, Chin), security forces arrested a nurse who is participating in CDM and her brother. Two other civilians were also arrested.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 9 April 2021, in Sanchaung township (Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), a fire broke out at the ward administration office in Thantada Ward. The cause of the fire was not known and the fire brigade was able to extinguish the fire within minutes. The office was only partly damaged. Arson attacks on ward administration offices have been common recently.

On 9 April 2021, in Bahan township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), two famous actors were arrested in their home by the military junta (coded as military and police forces). They had been charged under Section 505 (a) of the Penal Code.

On 9 April 2021, in Yankin township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), military and police forces arrested people who were withdrawing money near a bank branch, as well as patrons drinking tea at a nearby tea shop. The reason for the arrest was not reported.
On 10 April 2021, in Pantanaw, (Maubin District, Ayeyarwady), security forces arrested the NLD's winning candidate from the 2020 Myanmar's General Elections.
On 10 April 2021, in Ye Township (Mawlamyine District, Mon), security forces arrested a father and a son in the morning. Locals said both are related to the chair of the Ye Township's NLD Party.

On 10 April 2021, in Myeik (Tanintharyi), a doctor who is participating in the CDM was arrested while providing medical treatment to those in need on mobile clinic. Another person who was helping the doctor and also supporting the CDM was also arrested.
On 10 April 2021, in Lashio Town (Shan), two men were arrested by the security forces at a traffic light in the afternoon.

Property destruction: On 10 April 2021, in Bago town (Bago Township, Bago District, Bago Region), military troops raided the house of a local protest leader and smashed properties in the house. The soldiers also took away food items, USD1,000 and three motorcycles.

Property destruction: On 11 April 2021, in Ye township, Mon State, the Myanmar military asked monks to let the soldiers stay at the monastery temporarily. However, monks denied on the ground that the monastery shouldn't be used for military purpose. Afterwards, the military set fire to the monastery.

Arrests: On 11 April 2021, in Aungmyaythazan township (Mandalay District, Mandalay Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested six social workers at night. Three underaged detainees were released, but three others were sentenced to 3 months in prison under a night curfew order.

On 12 April 2021, in Sagaing town (Sagaing Township, Sagaing District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military arrested a female teacher who joined the civil disobedience in protest against the Myanmar military coup. The military came to her house and arrested her. On 15 October, she was sentenced to 2 years in prison.

Property destruction: On 12 April 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon Region), five public city buses caught fire before dawn. It was not clear what caused the fire, but similar attacks have occurred in recent weeks, targeting government or military buildings and public infrastructure.

Property destruction: On 12 April 2021, 12 miles from Taungdwingyi town in Taungdwingyi township (Taungdwingyi District, Magway Region), military troops entered three villages - Pat Lal Gyi, Pyin Chaung and Si Thar - and opened fire to intimidate locals. They also raided around 1,000 homes in the three villages. One house was reportedly burned to ashes. More than 3,000 residents fled.

Security measures: On 12 April 2021, in Myitkyina town (Myitkyina township, Myitkyina District, Kachin State), locals heard the sound of an explosion at the Mytel Company Office. The security measure was tightened around the neighbourhood. Afterwards, locals also heard the sound of gunfire around the same area.

Property destruction: On 12 April 2021, in Namhsan township (Kyaukme district, Shan state), the military junta (coded as military and police) raided the house of a parliamentarian who won the November 2020 elections. They reportedly set fire to his house.

Displacement: On 12 April 2021, in Mogoke township (Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military told villagers to go out of the village as the Myanmar military and KIA clashed near the village. Hundred of villagers fled to Mogoke town and stayed at Phontaw Oo Pagoda. On 21 April, the Myanmar military reportedly forced those IDPs to go back to their village.

Security measures: On 13 April 2021, in Lel Thit village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), military forces raided the village at around 4am. It was reported that villagers had been actively participating in anti-coup protests in the nearby Myingyan.

SOURCE: Myanmar Labour News; AFP; Myanmar Now
NOTES: Defusal: On 13 April 2021, in Sanchaung township (Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), security forces (assumed to be military and police forces) found and defused a bomb beneath Myaynigone Bridge at around noon, according to a police source.

On 13 April 2021, in Ye town (Ye Township, Mon State), the Myanmar military arrested the head of Ye Town Public Hospital at night. He had been charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code by the military junta for his involvement in the civil disobedience movement.
Displacement: Around 13 April 2021 (between 10 - 15 April), in Bhamo District (Kachin State), the fighting between the Myanmar military and KIA displaced more than 2,000 civilians.

On 13 April 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), four members of the Yangon University of Economics student union (including the chairperson and treasurer) were arrested by military and police forces near Tamwe Market.

On 13 April 2021, in Ah Pyaung village in Pyapon township (Pyapon District, Ayeyarwady Region), four Myanmar military and police came to an NLD office in the village. They destroyed flags and signboards at an NLD village office and arrested a civilian believed to be an NLD supporter. The incident happened after the villagers opposed the Myanmar military-appointed villager administrator.
On 13 April 2021, in Hakha town (Hakha township, Hakha district, Chin State), two youth returning from Thantlang were arrested by the military at the Hakha town gate.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 13 April 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), a fire broke out at the ward administration office in Ma U Kone ward. Some adjoining buildings and cars also caught fire. The cause of the fire was not known. Arson attacks on ward administration offices have been common recently.

On 13 April 2021, in Lashio township (Lashio district, Shan State), four men were arrested for reasons unknown (assumed to be by military and police forces). One of them was arrested in Ward 10, while three villagers were arrested in Taunt Ta Lawng village while talking to their relatives. The reason for their arrests was not clear.

On 13 April 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon Region), the Deputy Information Minister under the ousted civilian government was arrested at his home by plain clothed and uniformed military and police forces. He remains in custody as of 14 April 2021.

On 13 April 2021, in Hpapun township (Hpapun District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military from Hpapun town travelled to Baw Hta village, and gathered all villagers in Baw Hta. The military searched their phone contents, and also arrested a 57-year-old man and his daughter attending eighth grade. The man was released on the same day, and his daughter was released on the following day after one-night detention in the Myanmar military camp.

ACTOR1: CNO/CNDF: Chin National Organization/Chin National Defense Force
NOTES: Change to armed group: On 13 April 2021, in Falam township (Falam District, Chin State), communities in Falam Townships and the regions of Kalay and Kabaw region worked with Chins who moved abroad and formed a new armed force called Chin National Organization/Chin National Defense Force (CNO/CNDF) based in Falam township. On 22 April, the group issued a statement confirming the formation of CNO/CNDF.

Non-violent activity: On 13 April 2021, in Thingangyun township (Yangon (East) District, Yangon Region), locals held a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement by writing anti-military slogans on pots.

Non-violent activity: On 13 April 2021, in Yankin township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), locals held a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement. They lined up flower pots with protest slogans on a street.

Around 13 April 2021 (as reported), in Kani town (Kani Township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided anti-coup protest leaders and reportedly arrested some of them. They also removed barricades set up by the civilians to slow their advances.

ACTOR1: KIO/KIA: Kachin Independence Organization/Kachin Independence Army
NOTES: Property destruction: On 13 April 2021, near Ting Kawk village (Tanai township, Myitkyina District, Kachin State), the Myanmar KIA burned and destroyed two Myanmar military supply trucks at Rawang Kawng.

SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma; Eleven Media Group; Kachinland News
NOTES: On 14 April 2021, in Myitkyina town (Myitkyina township, Myitkyina District, Kachin State), three journalists from local news outlet Myitkyina News Journal were arrested by police forces. One of them - a female journalist - was arrested by plain clothed police officers at her home. Police also confiscated her laptop and documents. It was reported that she had suspended her work with the news outlet since 1 March. Their whereabouts remain unknown. They were released on 19 October after the amnesty announced by coup leader Min Aung Hlaing on 18 October.

Displacement: On 14 April 2021, Mogoke township (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), villagers fled to Mogoke town after the Myanmar military and KIA clashed near villages in Mogoke township.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: USDP: Union Solidarity and Development Party
NOTES: Property destruction: On 14 April 2021, in Taungdwingyi township (Taungdwingyi District, Magway Region), military soldiers entered Pyin Chaung village and destroyed houses with chainsaws which were believed to belong to anti-coup activists. They also took away all the bread from shops in the village. In addition, in Gyo Chaung village across from Pyin Chaung village, soldiers led by USDP members and military informants conducted a search and destroyed seven houses.

On 14 April 2021, in Bhamo town (Bhamo Township, Bhamo District, Kachin State), a striking doctor (also the owner of Ocean Mobile Mart) was arrested by military and police forces. He was one of four health workers in Bhamo who had been charged by the military junta for involvement in the civil disobedience movement.

Security measures: On 14 April 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon region), the Myanmar military and police stopped cars on U Chit Maung Road and carried out inspections after a series of explosions happened in at least three townships such as South Okkalapa, Sanchaung and Mayangone townships.

Movement of forces: On 14 April 2021, in Bhamo town (Bhamo township, Bhamo district, Kachin State), the Myanmar military aeroplane landed at the Bhamo Airport 7 times, and brought about 800 troops. The deployment happened after the Myanmar military reportedly suffered heavy defeats yesterday in Dawthponeyan sub-township of Momauk township in Bhamo District. The Myanmar military has been attempting to recapture the Alaw Bum mountaintop camp.

On 14 April 2021, in Sein Pan ward in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), military troops stopped an ambulance and arrested a woman for reasons unknown. The woman was believed to be a patient. Also in the same township, three members of a local charity organization Nibbana Thukha Social Welfare Association were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) and detained in the compound of Mandalay Palace. It is reported that the charity organization had been providing assistance for protesters.

Movement of forces: On 14 April 2021, on Mu Thay-Kyaukkyi road in Kyaukkyi township (Taungoo District, Bago-East), about 48 Myanmar military trucks - 32 trucks carrying food supply and 16 trucks carrying soldiers - advanced towards the KNU brigade-5 controlled area.

On 14 April 2021, while on their way back to Sanchaung township (coded as Sanchaung) (Yangon-West district, Yangon Region), a mum and daughter were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police forces) after participating in a symbolic protest on 18th Street. They were both transferred to Shwepyithar interrogation centre on 15 April.
On 14 April 2021, in Ywabe ward, in Pyay town, Pyay township, Pyay district, Bago-West Region, State Administration Council forces arrested mother and brother of a bomb suspect.
On 14 April 2021, in Khin-U town, Khin-U township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military and police arrested 8 youth in the Mya Kan Thar ward.
Change to armed group: On 15 April 2021, in the Ayeyarwady region (coded as Pathein), locals formed a new armed force called Ayeyarwady Federal Army.
On 15 April 2021, in Monywa town (Monywa township, Monywa District, Sagaing Region), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested the Monywa protest leader.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: STUM: Solidarity Trade Union of Myanmar; Labour Group (Myanmar); Women (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 15 April 2021, in Shwepyithar township (Yangon-north District, Yangon region), the female leader of Solidarity Trade Union Of Myanmar (a labour union based in Shwepyithar) was arrested at her office by about 40 men who arrived in four military vehicles. Mobile phones of office staff were also confiscated.

On 15 April 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon Region), a veteran actor and a female singer were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). They had both been charged by the military junta under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code. Their whereabouts are unknown.

On 15 April 2021, in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), military forces stormed two Buddhist temples and arrested several students. It was reported that monks at the two temples had been involved in the anti-coup movement.

On 15 April 2021, in Sanchaung township (Yangon-West district, Yangon Region), at night, security forces (assumed to be military and police forces) raided a house on Thapyay Street and arrested at least four people for reasons unknown.

Property destruction: On 16 April 2021, in Yesagyo town (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), a fire broke out at a police station at around 9pm. The cause of the fire was not known, although there has been multiple incidents of government buildings or police stations being targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

On 16 April 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay township, Pyay district, Bago region), military and police forces raided the home of a man, claiming to have found hand grenades in his house. They arrested his mother and brother after they failed to locate the target of the raid. Their whereabouts remain unknown at the time of reporting on 27 April.

Other: On 16 April 2021, the Committee Representing Pyidaungsu Hluttaw representing elected lawmakers who had been ousted following the 1 February coup announced the establishment of a parallel government called the National Unity Government. The government is headed by Aung San Suu Kyi as State Counsellor and President Win Myint (both of whom remain detained by the military junta). The list of appointed ministers include prominent politicians from a number of ethnic minority groups. Location changed as Nay Pyi Taw.
On 17 April 2021, in Payathonzu township (Kayin), plainclothes police arrested one man after a procession held with Buddhist monks to celebrate the first day of the Burmese New Year.
On 17 April 2021, in Ngwe Pyaw San Pya Village north of Myitkyina (coded as Myitkyina) (Myitkyina, Kachin), military soldiers arrested several male youths with military trucks.
On 17 April 2021, in Thamine 2nd lane in Mayangone township (Yangon-West, Yangon region), security forces raided the area and arrested people. The number of detainees was not confirmed.

Around 17 April 2021 (between 16 - 19 April), in Thi Lone village, Shwebo township (coded as Shwebo) (Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), military and police forces arrived at the village and arrested more than 100 people over the four days. More than 30 have since been charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code. They also searched the home of an orthopaedic surgeon reportedly involved in the civil disobedience movement and arrested his mother instead after they failed to find him. Beginning on 16 April, 22 military vehicles arrived and fired either rubber bullets or live rounds in the village. Security forces also looted food in the village. It was reported that villagers had been holding protests against the new village administrator appointed by the military junta.
On 17 April 2021, in Shwegyin township (Bago District, Bago Region), more than 10 young men who had returned from Yangon were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police).
On 18 April 2021, in Shwegyin township (Bago District, Bago-East), the Myanmar military arrested some civilians accusing them of obtaining military training from an unidentified ethnic armed group.

Non-violent activity: On 18 April 2021, in Katha town (Katha Township, Katha District, Sagaing Region), locals organized a people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement. Locals lined up placards with anti-coup slogan on roads using local fish pickled products as placard stands.

On 18 April 2021, in Yankin township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), military and police forces launched night raids of residences and arrested around three dozen people. The operation was in relation to the bombing of a General Administration Office in the same township on 17 April 2021. State-run television reported that six people were arrested in the township with homemade bombs and related materials following a tip-off.

On 18 April 2021, in Maubin township (Maubin District, Ayeyarwady Region), military and police forces arrested four doctors who were members of the civil disobedience movement against the Myanmar military coup. A volunteer with a charity was also arrested. All five of them were charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.
On 18 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), military and polices stormed a school in Aung Chan Thar ward and occupied the school.

Security measures: On 18 April 2021, in Chaung Ma village (coded as Chaung Ma (East)) about 20km from Kani, Kani township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), following a clash between villagers and military forces the day before, soldiers in around 15 military trucks arrived in the village to look for anti-coup activists. Soldiers raided shops and took away rice and killed chickens for food. More than 2,000 villagers from Chaung Ma village and other villagers from 6-7 other villagers fled.
On 19 April 2021, in Bago town (Bago Township, Bago District, Bago Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) raided monasteries and houses. An aid worker was arrested.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
NOTES: On 19 April 2021, in Kyaung Pan Kone village (Kyaukse Township, Kyaukse District, Mandalay Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) in plain clothes raided two members of NLD who actively involved in the anti-coup protests. Both of them were able to escape. Afterwards, the security forces arrested the fathers of the two NLD members instead.

On 19 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), in the early morning, military and police forces arrested four people, including an ethnic Lisu tycoon (also a member of the Ta'ang Literacy and Cultural Association) in connection with anti-coup protests. A town elder and his son were also arrested after the man was accused of being involved with the TNLA. The daughter of a ward administrator who joined the civil disobedience movement was also arrested after security forces searched their home but could not find the ward administrator.

Property destruction: On 19 April 2021, in Myingyan town (Myingyan township, Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), military and police forces stormed a residential area and set fire to houses and motorbikes. They also raided bakeries and took away bread and food.

On 19 April 2021, in Pazundaung township (Yangon-East, Yangon region), a Japanese freelance journalist was arrested by the military junta (coded as military and police forces) in Yay Kyaw ward. He has been charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 19 April 2021, in Thaketa township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), a ward administration office on Khaing Shwe War Street broke out in fire. The cause of the fire was not known but arson attacks on ward administration offices have been common recently.

On 19 April 2021, in Shwepyithar township (Yangon-north District, Yangon region), at night, seven youths from Ward 8 were arrested by military and police forces allegedly torching a nearby police station. Locals however claimed that there were no fires at the police station nor evidence to support the allegations.

Displacement: On 19 April 2021, in Monywa Township (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), more than 3,000 locals have fled to nearby forests after the military raided five villages - including Inbaw and Aung Mingalar villages - along the Monywa-Yargyi road near Mile 65.

On 19 April 2021, in Si Hat village in Momauk township (Bhamo District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military troops occupied the village as a base camp and threatened villagers with gunshots. About 5,000 villagers fled.
On 19 April 2021, in Aungpan Town (Kalaw Township, Taunggyi District, Shan South), the Myanmar military with five trucks raided a house and arrested a woman at night around 11:00 pm.

Displacement: On 19 April 2021, near Si Hat village in Momauk township (Bhamo District, Kachin State), about 5,000 villagers fled the Si Hat village after the Myanmar military troops occupied the village as a base camp, and threatened villagers with gunshots.

On 20 April 2021, in Myaungmya town (Myaungmya Township, Myaungmya District, Ayeyarwady Region), the police arrested a freelance journalist who previously worked as a TCP News agency. The police called the office and told him that they want to give him the news. As he went to the police station, he was arrested under the penal code 505 (a). Another reporter was also taken away to the police station but was released after being issued a warning.

On 20 April 2021, in Khin-U township (Khin-U district, Sagaing Region), military and police forces arrested four villages from Ma Gyi Kone and Than Bo villages. It was reported that two of the villagers in Ma Gyi Kone village had been involved in protests in the villages.

Looting: On 20 April 2021, at Khin Gyi village (Wundwin township, Meiktila District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military searched houses and looted gold, money and other valuable things. They also destroyed motorcycles. The incident happened on a day after the villager protested against school teachers who attempted to reopen school in the village.

On 20 April 2021, near Khin Gyi village (Wundwin township, Meiktila District, Mandalay Region), with the help of an informer, the Myanmar military arrested 40 villagers who were hiding outside the village. The incident happened on a day after the villager protested against school teachers who attempted to reopen the school in the village.

On 20 April 2021, in Shwebo town (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military and police arrested a student at a restaurant while she was having breakfast after the anti-coup protest. Her whereabouts is unknown.

Property destruction: On 20 April 2021, in Khin-U town, Khin-U township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), military and police forces stormed the house of Aung Chan Thar ward administrator (assumed to be the ward administrator under the civilian government) in the evening. Furniture, cabinets and refrigerators in the house were smashed. The ward administrator and his family had been on the run since 25 March.

Security measures: On 20 April 2021, in Bhamo town (Bhamo township, Bhamo district, Kachin State), about 30 military troops entered homes in Hkun Tar ward and inspected guests. The Gang Dau-Yang based military troops conducted stop-and-search on passers-by and travellers in the town on 19 April.

Security measures: Around 20 April 2021 (as reported), near Ka Paing village (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), military and police forces were stationed near the village and men between the age of 18-50 were not allowed to enter the village. Security forces remain deployed in the area until the time of reporting on 22 April. Security forces reportedly offered on 22 April that they will leave the village if villagers hand over 150 firearms to them. Villagers refused to hand over their firearms.

Security measures: On 20 April 2021, in villages near Myingyan town (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), about 100 military and police forces entered three villages to conduct search and opened fire.

On 20 April 2021, in Thee Kone village (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military occupied a pagoda compound as their base camp, following a clash between the military and local militia near the village.

Security measures: On 20 April 2021, in Win Kone village (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided two villages such as Thlalauk and Win Kone. Several villages were raided this month in the Sagaing region as the Myanmar military searched pro-democracy activists.

On 20 April 2021, in Hpa-an town, Hpa-an township (Hpa-an District, Kayin State), a female schoolteacher from Basic Education High School 3 who was involved in the civil disobedience movement against the military coup was arrested by police at her home in Ward 9.

On 20 April 2021, in Kanbalu township (Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a former editor of the Voice Journal while he was sitting in a teashop. He was sentenced to two years after 8 months of detaining on December 2.

On 21 April 2021, in Chanmyathazi township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), mulitary and police forces raided neighbourhoods at around 9pm and opened fire at residents until midnight. A 14-year-old girl was shot in her right hand at her home. She had to undergo surgery for the bullet wound as arteries in her hand were damaged. Two teenagers were also arrested following the attacks. Security also raided Mya Yi Nanda Housing Estate to hunt down a restaurant owner. Security forces arrested an employee instead, after they failed to locate the owner.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 21 April 2021, in Kale town (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), a former ward administrator was arrested by military and police forces in a house in Nyaung Pin Thar Ward. It was reported that the ward administrator had resigned from his position on 8 February to join the civil disobedience movement as he refused to serve under the military junta. Security forces also raided houses in San Myo area and arrested four people who had allegedly been participating in anti-coup demonstrations.

On 21 April 2021, in Pathein town, Pathein township (Pathein district, Ayeyarwady region), two university students were arrested along a busy street in the morning by military and police forces for reasons unknown.

On 21 April 2021, in five villages in Kanbalu township (Kanbalu District, Sagaing Region), military and police forces raided houses in an attempt to arrest protest activists in the villages. They looted properties and also arrested two youths in Inn Lel Gyi village after they failed to find the protest leaders. In addition, in Nyan Inn and Yi Dway villages, they raided houses of protest leaders and took away furniture and other items. Money were reportedly also taken away by security forces. A young man wearing an NLD shirt was also arrested by security forces as he entered Pho Kone village. No protest leaders were arrested as they had managed to escape.

On 21 April 2021, in Myitkyina town (Myitkyina township, Myitkyina District, Kachin State), military and police forces arrested the mother of a Myitkyina University student at their home in Rampu ward after they failed to find him in the house. In addition, security forces arrested the interim chairperson of Myitkyina University Students' Union at his home in Shan Su Taung ward.
Property destruction: On 21 April 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), in the morning a vehicle belonging to the NLD office was reportedly set on fire by a group of people.

On 21 April 2021, in Ein Du village (Hpa-an Township, Hpa-an District, Kayin State), a female schoolteacher who joined the civil disobedience movement against the military coup was arrested (assumed to be by military and police forces).

Security measures: On 21 April 2021, in Sanchaung township (Yangon-West district, Yangon Region), military and police forces raided Sanchaung Garden Condominium to search for an actress who had been charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code by the military junta. No arrests were made.

On 21 April 2021, in Mandalay City (Mandalay Region), following raids in three townships in the city (including Chanmyathazi, Mahaaungmyay and Pyigyitagon townships), at least 10 residents were reportedly arrested across the three townships.

Security measures: On 21 April 2021, in Thantlang Township, Hakha District, Chin State, the Myanmar military has restricted access to five villages. Vehicles were reportedly ordered to turn away by military forces. The military has also reportedly set up checkpoints in some of the villages. The exact reason for the blockade was not clear, although locals stated that it may be due to the location of these villages to the nearby Chin National Front headquarters.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 21 April 2021, in Taung Tha Man village (Amarapura township, Mandalay District, Mandalay Region), a fire broke out at the village administration office. It was not clear what caused the fire although many government buildings have been targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 21 April 2021, in Dagon Myothit (South) township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), a fire broke out at the Labour Office. The cause of fire was not known although many government buildings have been targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

On 21 April 2021, in Taunggyi town, Taunggyi township (Taunggyi District, Shan State), five civilians were arrested by military and police forces for reasons unknown. They were detained at a police station and security forces reportedly asked for 100,000 kyats for each of them to be released.

Displacement: On 21 April 2021, in Namtu township (Kyaukme District, Shan North), about 2,000 villagers from Man Hsar, Man Kyan and Pang Long fled their villages following intense fighting between the RCSS clashed with the combined forces of TNLA and SSPP.

Security measures: On 21 April 2021, in Monywa town, Monywa Township (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), authorities (coded as military and police) raided the office of a local news outlet Monywa Gazette. The house of the owner of the news outlet was also raided. Following the crackdown, the news outlet announced that they will stop publishing.

Property destruction: On 21 April 2021, in Ka Paing (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military raided hundreds of houses and destroyed an NLD office in the village.

ACTOR1: RCSS/SSA-S: Restoration Council of Shan State/Shan State Army-South
NOTES: Land seizure: On 21 April 2021, in the Nam Lan area (Hsipaw Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), the RCSS forcefully seized more than 600 acres of farmland from 150 farmers. The reason for the seizure of the land was not known.

Movement of forces: Around 21 April 2021 (as reported), in Namhsan township (Pa Laung Self Administered Zone, Shan North), about 500 Myanmar military troops from the north, south and west of Namhsan township were deployed in the Nam Teng river valley in the southeast of Namhsan township. The southeast of Namhsan township is bordered by Kengtung township.

On 22 April 2021, in Pakokku town (Pakokku township, Pakokku district, Magway Region), a citizen journalist who had been posting photographs of the anti-coup movement was arrested by junta forces (coded as military and police) and charged under Section 505A of the Criminal Code. He was later sentenced to three years in prison on 6 July.

SOURCE: Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: Security measures: On 22 April 2021, in Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military soldiers entered Thar Ga Ya village and nearby Myothit village and opened fire and conducted search in the homes of NLD members. No arrests were made but villagers have fled out of fear.

Security measures: On 22 April 2021, in Myo Thit village, Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), military and police forces in five military vehicles entered the village and opened fire in the village. They also searched the house of the village administrator and took away food items and loudspeakers. Security forces also cut up NLD signs in the village with a knife. Villages had reportedly fled.

Property destruction: On 22 April 2021, in Paw Yaw village, Kyunhla township (Kanbalu District, Sagaing Region), military and police demanded 5 million kyats in compensation from villagers who were engaged in gold mining after engines of gold plating machine were set on fire. Security forces reportedly destroyed properties of villagers who could not pay the compensation.

On 22 April 2021, in Yebyu town (Yebyu township, Dawei District, Tanintharyi region), military and police forces arrested a man in his home in Thiri Mingalar ward. The wife of another man was also arrested in Bogyoke ward when security forces could not find the man in the house.

Property destruction: On 22 April 2021, between Thar Ga Ya village and Myin Daung village (coded as Thar Ga Ya village) in Khin-U township (Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), a 30-foot-long wooden bridge was set on fire by a group of unknown people at around 3am. The bridge was damaged by the fire, cutting off road access for villagers.
On 22 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), military and police forces entered Pate Swel ward and arrested two people and also looted 7 million kyats.

On 22 April 2021, in Chanmyathazi township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), military and police forces raided a house in Mya Yi Nanda Housing Estate and arrested two men and two women. Shields and bulletproof vests used at anti-coup demonstrations were found in the house and confiscated.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
NOTES: On 22 April 2021, in Nawngmun township (Puta-O District, Kachin State), the people militia forces arrested six youth from Khaunglanhpu town. The reason for the arrest was not known. The arrestees were sent to Nawngmun town.

On 22 April 2021, in Ein Du village (Hpa-an Township, Hpa-an District, Kayin State), a couple was arrested by four plainclothes men (assumed to be military and police forces) in the morning for posting about the arrest of a female schoolteacher on 21 April on social media.

On 22 April 2021, in Dagon Myothit (North) Township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), five people were reportedly arrested (assumed to be by military and police forces) following an explosion that took place on the same day at a police station in the township.

On 22 April 2021, in Tha Pyay Aye village (Yinmarbin Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), 45 villagers were arrested (assumed to be by military and police forces) as they went to collect the bodies of those who had been killed by security forces during clashes between villagers and security forces in the past few days. They were all released later on the same day after paying a small fee.

Defusal: On 22 April 2021, in Taunggyi town, Taunggyi township (Taunggyi District, Shan State), a rocket was found at the corner of Jetawan Road and Khwar Nyo Road. It was reported that residents heard an explosion shortly after military vehicles arrived in the area (rocket was assumed to be defused by the military). It was not reported who planted the rocket.

On 22 April 2021, in Myingyan town (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), around 5:30am, a man in plainclothes, reportedly leading a small group of soldiers behind him, arrested a man from a teashop in Ward 6. The man had reportedly been participating in anti-coup demonstrations that resulted in deadly clashes earlier in the week.

Security measures: On 22 April 2021, on the Monywa-Alaungdaw Kathapa road near Kani township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), military forces conducted search in villages along the road. The military was reportedly reinforcing its troops in areas close to the villages where clashes between villagers and military forces have taken place in recent days.

Around 22 April 2021 (from 18 - 26 April), in Kyoet Chaung village (coded as Kyoet Chaung Ywar Ma) in Taungdwingyi township (Magway district, Magway region), the Myanmar military raided the village and arrested some villagers. Villagers were released by paying ransom money of 1,000,000 kyats per person.

Around 22 April 2021 (from 18 - 26 April), in Pyin Chaung village in Taungdwingyi township (Magway district, Magway region), the Myanmar military raided the village and arrested some villagers. Villagers were released by paying ransom money of 1,000,000 kyats per person.

On 23 April 2021, in Par Sumt village in Nansang Township (Loilen District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military arrested 6 villagers after the fighting between the Myanmar military and RCSS near the village.

On 23 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), military and police forces conducted an eight-hour patrol and arrested 13 people in Shwe Ku ward and three others in Pate Swel ward. 10 of them were later released in the evening.

Looting: On 23 April 2021, in Chanayethazan township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), military and police forces forcibly opened and stormed a shop selling defense equipment and took away goods from the shop. Security forces were seen wearing civilian clothes and armed with guns and long swords.

On 23 April 2021, in Kengtung town (Kengtung Township, Shan State), military and police forces in plainclothes arrested a member of a Shan group called Tai Youth Organization at gunpoint. The reason for the arrest was not known although it was reported that he has been active in community development in the area.

Looting: On 23 April 2021, in Pha Sawn village in Namhsan township (Pa Laung Self Administered Zone, Shan North), the Myanmar military looted villagers properties such as knives, rice, soybean cake, plastic buckets and chickens.

On 23 April 2021, in Pha Sawn village in Namhsan township (Pa Laung Self Administered Zone, Shan North), the Myanmar military arrested six male villagers at the village temple and tied them up outside the temple. After the villager elder appealed for their release, the military untied six villagers but didn't release them.
Security measures: On 24 April 2021, in Mogoke town, Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay Region, the State Administration Council forces raided a protest leader's house and took his photo.
On 24 April 2021, in Pyapon town, Pyapon township, Pyapon district, Ayeyarwady Region, a teacher participating in Civil Disobedience Movement was arrested by the State Administration Council forces.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
NOTES: On 24 April 2021, at a bridge near Nawng Mum, Lashio township, Lashio district, Shan State (North), 6 youths were arrested by Khaung Lan Phu (local) militia. Those arrested were sent to Nawng Mun.

On 24 April 2021, in Myawaddy town, Myawaddy township, Myawaddy district, Kayin State, one teacher who is participating in Civil Disobedience Movement was arrested by State Administrative Council forces.

On 24 April 2021, in Pyin Pon Gyi village (Bago township, Bago district, Bago-East), military forces arrested a village administrator. They also attempted to arrest a village elder but arrested his son instead after failing to find the elder.
On 24 April 2021, in Zay Haung village, Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay Region), 9 people on night watch duty were arrested by State Administration Council's Air Force.

Property destruction: On 24 April 2021, in Tha Pyay Aye village, Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region, State Administration Council forces raided a monastery, destroyed a building and took 20 laptops.

Looting: On 24 April 2021, in Kyun U village, Lint Gyi village tract (Myingyan township, Myingyan District, Mandalay region), the Myanmar military raided a house of a village tract NLD chairman, and looted gold jewellery and other items such as ring and necklace. The military also took 150,000 kyats.

On 24 April 2021, in Thayarwady town, Thayarwady township, Thayarwady district, Bago-West Region, 5 civilians including government staff and healthcare workers who are participating in Civil Disobedience Movement were arrested by State Administration Council forces.

ACTOR1: ASEAN: Association of Southeast Asian Nations
ACTOR2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Other: On 24 April 2021, ASEAN leaders and ministers from Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam, held an ASEAN summit in Jakarta with the leader of the Myanmar military government. The ASEAN leaders demanded the military government end the violence in Myanmar after the coup in the country and release the political prisoners. Location coded to Nay Pyi Taw.

On 24 April 2021, in Muse town, Muse township, Muse district, Shan-North State, State Administration Council forces raided the IDO office and arrested 6 people. It was reported the next day that 4 out of the 6 people arrested had been set free.
On 24 April 2021, in Mindat town (Mindat Township, Mindat District, Chin State), the Myanmar military arrested 6 people who were involved in the people-less protest.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Border Guard Force
NOTES: Movement of forces: On 24 April 2021, around Loi Ngin and Par Sumt villages in Nansang Township (Loilen District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military and BGF increased troop deployment after the clash between the Myanmar military and RCSS.

SOURCE: Radio Free Asia; Myanmar Now; Irrawaddy
NOTES: On 24 April 2021, in Thanlyin township (Yangon (South) District, Yangon Region), a female writer-cum-media-trainer and her family were detained by security forces (coded as military and police forces) at her home. They were released on 18 October after the amnesty announced by coup leader Min Aung Hlaing on 18 October.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: On 24 April 2021, in Oakshitpin town, Padaung township, Pyay district, Bago-West Region, 3 ward administrators were arrested by State Administration Council forces.

On 25 April 2021, in Hpa-an town (Hpa-an township, Hpa-an district, Kayin state), the Myanmar military and police arrested two young men, including a student. The security forces accused them of taking part in a protest.

On 25 April 2021, in Myawaddy town, Myawaddy township, Myawaddy district, Mandalay Region, a headmistress participating in Civil Disobedience Movement was arrested by State Administration Council forces.
On 25 April 2021, in Ye Dwe village, Kanbalu township, Kanbalu district, Sagaing Region, 2 villagers were arrested by State Administration Council forces.

Security measures: On 25 April 2021, in Myaungmya town, Myaungmya township, Myaungmya district, Ayeyarwady Region, the NLD party office was raided by the miltiary forces and police forces, destroying the party's posts and flags.
On 25 April 2021, in Myeik town, Myeik township, Myeik district, Tanintharyi Region, 3 students were arrested by State Administration Council forces.
On 25 April 2021, in Khin-U town, Khin-U township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military and police raided Aung Bon Monastery, and arrested a monk.

On 25 April 2021, in Pazundaung township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), tens of soldiers raided a neighbourhood and opened gunfire. The military soldiers along with an informer entered a house of a DVB journalist and arrested a journalist. Two other civilians were also arrested.

Looting: On 25 April 2021, in Myingyan town (Myingyan township, Myingyan District, Mandalay region), the Myanmar military raided two houses and looted several properties including gold, antiques, shoes, sunglasses and rice bags. The Myanmar military also destroyed a house.

On 25 April 2021, in Ka Paing (Yinmarbin township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military arrived at the village with 8 military trucks and a bulldozer. They occupied a hospital and a school as their base camp.

On 25 April 2021, in Bago town, Bago township, Bago district, Bago-East Region, one school teacher who is participating in Civil Disobedience Movement was arrested by State Administration Council forces.

Displacement: On 25 April 2021, in Tar Pu village (Namtu Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), about 130 villagers left the village and fled to Hsipaw due to the ongoing fighting around Pang Long village.

Defusal: On 25 April 2021, in Ye town, Ye township (Mawlamyine district, Mon state), a hand grenade and two anti-personnel mines were found in the yard of a USDP member. Actor 1 coded as military forces to represent security forces carrying out the removal.

ACTOR1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: RCSS/SSA-S: Restoration Council of Shan State/Shan State Army-South
NOTES: Property destruction: On 25 April 2021, in Yae Oe village (Namtu Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), a house was burned down in the village. The RCSS and TNLA blamed each other for the incident.
On 26 April 2021, in Pazundaung township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), a former cameraman of DVB was arrested at his house by security forces (coded as military and police).

On 26 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), two students, as well as two Buddhist monks from two different monasteries, were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). Security forces also raided a social media influencer's house. The security forces arrested her father as they can't find her.

On 26 April 2021, in Insein Township (Yangon-north District, Yangon Region), military and police forces raided an NLD office in the township and arrested two youths. Three others in the office were released. Security forces reportedly removed the party flag and signboard on their way out of the office.
On 26 April 2021, in Myingyan town (Myingyan township, Myingyan District, Mandalay region), the Myanmar military arrested 7 young people at the Myingyan railway station.

Displacement: On 26 April 2021, in Kani township ( Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military deployed 500 troops and searched houses in six villages. About 1,500 villagers from Min Ma, Tha Min Chan, Min Kone, Pu Htaw, Ngar Hpyat and Shan Myaung fled.

On 26 April 2021, in Dawei town (Dawei Township, Dawei District, Tanintharyi Region), a man was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) in the evening. The reason for the arrest was not known.

On 26 April 2021, near Yar Za Gyo village, Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), police arrested a Buddhist monk at a missionary school. Locals reported that military and police forces are searching for protesters in the area and youths have fled.

Looting: On 26 April 2021, in Kani township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military deployed 500 troops and searched houses in villages including Min Ma, Tha Min Chan, Pu Htaw, Ta Zei Chaung, Min Kone, Ngar Hpyat, Shan Myaung. The military first used drones to monitor villages on 24 April, before searching villages on 26 Apr for the presence of communal militia. They looted pigs, chicken, motorcycles and rice bags.
Movement of forces: On 26 April 2021, in Mindat township (Mindat District, Chin State), the Myanmar military sent a convoy of five military truck as a reinforcement from Pakkoku to Mindat.

Property destruction: On 27 April 2021, in Tha Hpan Kaing in Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), military soldiers entered to the village. They looted and destroyed some villagers' properties.

On 27 April 2021, in Mindat town (Mindat township, Mindat district, Chin state), following a four-day clash between local defence group called Chinland Defense Force and military soldiers, a prisoner swap was negotiated which allowed 20 soldiers trapped about 30 miles west of Mindat to leave, while the military released seven residents who had been detained since 24 April. The military also left Mindat that night as part of the negotiated deal.

On 27 April 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay Region), the editor-in-chief and a reporter from the Mandalay-based news agency Voice of Myanmar were detained by security forces (coded as military and police) and taken to an army camp at Mandalay Palace for interrogation. They remain detained at the time of reporting as of 30 April.

Security measures: On 27 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) raided the house of a protest leader and took away his personal belongings and furniture.
On 27 April 2021, in Ye-U town, Ye-U townshhip, Shewbo district, Sagaing Region, two villagers from Kan Thit village, Khin-U township were arrested by State Administration Council forces.

Security measures: On 27 April 2021, in Tha But Kone and Nyaung Zin villages (coded as Nyaung Zin Gyi) (Kanbalu District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided and searched the village, and destroyed the NLD flag and other NLD signs in the village.
On 27 April 2021, Ywargyigone ward, in Thayarwady town, Thayarwady township, Thayarwady district, Bago-West Region, one civilian was arrested by State Administration Council forces.

Displacement: On 27 April 2021, in the Thaw Lel Tha area in Hpapun district (Kayin State), the Myanmar military airstrike forced about 2,000 Myanmar citizens to flee. On 28 April 2021, in Pathein town, Pathein township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady Region, one man who had participated in anti-coup protests was arrested.

On 28 April 2021, in Mudon town (Mudon Township, Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the former administrator of Ward 1 was arrested by military and police forces at his house. It was reported that he had retired following the military coup.
On 28 April 2021, in Kapaung Kya village and Chaungzon village, in Taze township, Shwebo district, Sagaing Region, three civlians who protested against the coup were arrested by the military.

On 28 April 2021, in Myawaddy town (Myawaddy Township, Myawaddy District, Kayin State), police arrested the former administrator of Ward 2. While the reason for his arrest was not known, the military junta has been hunting down ward administrators who are on strike or have resigned in support of the civil disobedience movement recently.

On 28 April 2021, in Muse town, Muse township, Muse district, Shan-North State, two laboratory technicians at the Kaung San Hospital were arrested by State Administration Council forces. It is not known where they were held or why they were arrested.

On 28 April 2021, in Sittwe town (Sittwe township, Sittwe district, Rakhine State), a former NLD candidate for the Pyithu Hluttaw was arrested from the NLD office by two plainclothes men in a police car.

On 28 April 2021, in Dawnachan ward, in Monywa town, Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing Region, one civlian was arrested by State Administration Council forces. On 28 April 2021, in Sanchaung township (Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), ten youths were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police), reportedly accompanied by a military-appointed ward administrator.

NOTES: Movement of forces: Around 28 April 2021 (from 25 - 30 April), in Hpapun township (Hpapun district, Kayin State), about 150 BGF troops were deployed in the KNU brigade 5 controlled area.
On 28 April 2021, in Matupi town, Matupi township (Matupi district, Chin State), one social worker and two other civilians were arrested by the Myanmar military forces.

NOTES: On 28 April 2021, in Meiktila town (Meiktila Township, Meiktila District, Mandalay Region), a regional MP who was elected in the 2020 general election was arrested after he returned to his parents' home (assumed to be by military and police forces). On 28 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), the mother and brother of a teacher on strike in support of the civil disobedience movement were arrested by military and police forces and detained at the Mogok Police Station. On 29 April 2021, in Hakha town (Hakha township, Hakha district, Chin State), security forces (coded as military and police) raided the house of the chief editor of Chinland Post and arrested his brother-in-law after they failed to find the chief editor.

On 29 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested a former ward administrator. On 29 April 2021, in Mawlamyine city (Mawlamyine Township, Mawlamyine District, Mon State), security forces (coded as military and police) conducted a search operation to hunt down former ward administrators and arrested two former ward administrators. NOTES: Property destruction: On 29 April 2021, in Dagon Myothit (South) township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), a fire broke out at the ward administration office in Ward 54. A member of the ward administration who was sleeping in the office was reportedly injured in the blaze. The cause of fire was not known although many government buildings have been targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

On 29 April 2021, in Pyin Oo Lwin town (Pyin Oo Lwin Township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), a ward administrator on strike in support of civil disobedience movement was arrested by military forces.

On 29 April 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), three Yadanarbon University students were arrested after military forces gave chase to them as they were on their way home after participating in an anti-coup demonstration.

On 29 April 2021, in Ngapudaw town (Ngapudaw Township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady Region), a ward administrator on strike in support of civil disobedience movement was arrested by five police officers and taken to the Ngapudaw township police station.

On 29 April 2021, in Taunggyi town, Taunggyi township (Taunggyi District, Shan State), a young man was arrested by security forces (coded as police and military). The reason for his arrest was not known.
On 30 April 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Mogoke district, Mandalay Region), two youths using Wi-Fi in their backyard were arrested by the military.

On 30 April 2021, in Thabyaysan South and North villages (Magway Township; Magway District; Magway Region), four villagers were arrested by the Myanmar military regarding the villagers' attack to the Magwe Air Force Base.

On 30 April 2021, in Hpruso town (Hpruso township, Loikaw district, Kayah State), a total of 74 youths who were returning from a youth capacity building training course were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police forces). They were taken to a military training and school before being detained at Loikaw Prison. It was alleged that the youths were given basic military training by ethnic armed groups, although this claim was denied by KNPP.

Movement of forces: On 30 April 2021, in Num Lant village, Momauk township, (Bhamo district, Kachin State), more than 300 personals from Myanmar military reportedly arrived in the village and were stationed in houses and schools. Some of the forces have already marched towards Alaw Bum.
Movement of forces: On 30 April 2021, in Tagun Daing village, Kyainseikgyi township (Kawkareik district, Kayin State), some of the Myanmar military forces stationed in the village withdrew.

On 30 April 2021, in Dagon Myothit (North) township, (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), Myanmar military forces reportedly searched and arrested civilians participating in the Civil Disobedience Movement and in protests. The number of those arrested is not reported.

On 30 April 2021, in Hakha town, Hakha township (Hakha district, Chin State), Myanmar military forces raided the house of Chief Editor of the Chinland Post. In the event of not being able to find the Chief Editor, Myanmar military forces arrested the brother-in-law.
On 30 April 2021, in Myitkyina town, Myitkyina township (Myitkyina district, Kachin State), four civilians riding a motorbike were arrested by Myanmar military forces.

Displacement: Around 30 April 2021 (as reported), in Momauk township (Bhamo district, Kachin state), more than 100 villagers fled to the Kachin Baptist Convention following six consecutive days of airstrikes launched by the Myanmar military. More than 5,500 villagers had fled to churches and monasteries in Momauk from Sihike, Kone Law, Myo Haung Myo Thit, Shwe Myaung, Namt Lan, Mone Khat, Naung Kon and Nant Ngoe villages by 27 April.

Looting: On 30 April 2021, in Gway Kone village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), military and police forces stormed the village and looted properties belonging to villagers, including household appliances and about 500,000 kyats. All villagers fled into the forest.

Defusal: On 30 April 2021, in South Okkalapa township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), two bombs were found in front of Metta Lake. Military forces blocked two roads in the area until the bombs were successfully detonated.

Security measures: On 30 April 2021, in Mon state (coded as Mawlamyine), military and police forces increased checkpoints and security in different townships following a series of explosions in the state capital Mawlamyine and other townships. Gunshots were reportedly heard in Paung and Thaton townships as security forces conducted search and inspections.

On 30 April 2021, in Yenangyaung town (Yenangyaung Township, Magway District, Magway Region), two members of the Yenangyaung University students' union and a civilian were arrested by military and police forces. They were released around 19 October (between 18 - 19 October) after the amnesty announced by coup leader Min Aung Hlaing on 18 October.

On 30 April 2021, in Shwelinban residential complex, in Hlaingthayar-East town, Hlaingthayar township (Yangon-North district, Yangon Region), 7 youths were arrested by Myanmar military and police forces.

SOURCE: Kachin Post; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: Change to armed group: Around 1 May 2021 (as reported), in Hpawng Hseng (Pang Hseng village) (Muse township, Muse district, Shan-North), the Kachin National Organization (KNO) formed the 108th Special Brigade. The KIA has issued a statement to strongly condemn the formation of the special brigade.

Non-violent activity: On 1 May 2021, in Lashio town (Lashio township, Lashio District, Shan-North), a people-less 'domestic strike' was held against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

On 1 May 2021, in Thabyaysan South and North villages (Magway Township; Magway District; Magway Region), four villagers were arrested by the Myanmar military regarding the villagers' attack to the Magwe Air Force Base.

On 1 May 2021, in Tat Kone ward, Myitkyina town, (Myitkyina township, Myitkyina district, Kachin State), 11 youths who were distributing vegetables as part of the 'share if you have extra, take if you need' campaign were arrested by the security forces.

On 1 May 2021, in Dagon University Staff Residence, in Dagon Myothit (North) township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), a freelance journalist's house was raided by the military and police forces. The journalist's husband who is also a former journalist was arrested.
On 1 May 2021, in Aungthitsar Ward, Kale town (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing Region), an instructor from a nursing school and a teacher were arrested by military and police forces.

Looting: On 1 May 2021, in Kyat Pyin ward, Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Mogoke district, Mandalay Region), Myanmar military raided Ruby Yadanar Clinic and took 1.5 million Kyats worth of medical supplies. Ruby Yadanar Clinic is a temporary charity clinic.
On 1 May 2021, in BOC area, Thamardi lane, Thingangyun township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), 13 civilians were arrested by Myanmar military forces.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Labour News
NOTES: On 2 May 2021, on Htuparyone Street, Thaketa township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), military forces arrested youths. At least 5 were reported arrested.

On 2 May 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay Region), 30 members of the local relief teams and cars used for public social welfare were arrested by the military forces. Among the 30 members who were arrested also include women.

On 2 May 2021, on 41st Street (Between 86 and 87 Streets), in Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), some youths were arrested by plaincloth armed security forces (coded as police and military). The number of those arrested was not reported.

On 2 May 2021, between 69th Street and Sein Pan Street (Chanmyathazi township, Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), security forces in plainclothes arrested civilians and raided a tea shop. A youth was also arrested on 58th Street (Between 116 and 117 Streets). Arrests with the use of cars with ordinary licence plates and ambulances were also reported.
Property destruction: On 2 May 2021, in Botahtaung township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), an unknown assailant destroyed vehicles parked on 47th and 46th roads at night.

On 2 May 2021, at the NLD AIDS Center, in Number 11 ward on Heisen Doo Wah Street, Dagon Myothit (East) township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), 12 patients (3 children included) who were on ART medication were arrested by the military forces. NLD AIDS Center was founded by Daw Phyu Phyu Thin, a member of CRPH which the State Administration Council announced as unlawful association.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
NOTES: Property destruction: On 2 May 2021, in Man Li village (Namtu Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), after fighting between the RCSS clashed and the combined forces of TNLA and SSPP, 44 houses were set on fires in the village. RCSS and TNLA blamed each other for the incident.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
NOTES: Recruitment: On 2 May 2021, in Nawngmun township (Puta-O district, Kachin State), Rawang Traditional Culture Group and local people's militia military mobilization to oppose and fight the KIA.
On 2 May 2021, in Sanchaung township (Yangon-West district, Yangon Region), a woman was brutally abducted by Myanmar military forces.
On 2 May 2021, in Mingalar Street, Tamwe township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), youths were arrested by Myanmar military forces. The number of those arrested is not reported.
On 2 May 2021, in Kyeemyindaing township (Yangon-West district, Yangon Region), Myanmar military forces arrested three youths.

On 2 May 2021, in Myingkakone village, in Bogale township (Pyapon district, Ayeyarwady Region), Myanmar military forces (11th Light Infantry Division) arrested civilians who previously participated in anti-coup protests.

Non-violent activity: On 2 May 2021, in Hpa-an town (Hpa-an Township, Hpa-an District, Kayin State), a people-less strike was held against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.
