Non-violent activity: On 3 May 2021, in Hlaingthayar township (Hlaingtharya-East, Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), locals organized a paper plane people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup. Paper planes were put on the ground and protesters called 'planes that can't fly strike'.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-)
SOURCE: Radio Free Asia; Shan Herald Agency for News
NOTES: On 3 May 2021, in Hopong township (Taunggyi district, Shan state), an NLD parliamentarian was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) at night while he was on his way home to visit his wife who had fallen ill. He has been wanted by the military junta after being charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Myanmar (2021-); Civilians (Myanmar); NLD: National League for Democracy
NOTES: On 3 May 2021, in Pin Din village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), security forces (coded as military and police) stormed the village, breaking into three houses and firing either rubber bullets or live rounds. They also raided and destroyed the houses of prominent NLD leaders in the community. An anti-coup activist from the village was arrested. As security forces exited the village, they set barricades and tents set up by the local security team on fire. The crackdown came after villagers held a protest against the reopening of schools.

Looting: On 3 May 2021, in Aung Pan village (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), military and police forces raided the home of a local protest leader and reportedly took away 500,000 kyats.

Security measures: Around 3 May 2021 (from 3 - 4 May), in Kyoet Pin Yoe village in Kyauktaga township (Bago district, Bago-East Region), Myanmar military forces arrived at the village and fired live ammunition into the village. No injuries reported.

Looting: On 3 May 2021, in Dar Yei Kaung village in Myittha township (Kyaukse district, Mandalay region), after villagers held a protest against school teachers in the village, the Myanmar military raided houses and looted money. They also destroyed some materials. The military also fired warning shots at people running for their safety.

Security measures: On 3 May 2021, in Kan Thit village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), following an explosion at the military-appointed administrator's house, military and police forces entered the village and opened fire and conducted search on unoccupied houses. Villages fled to a jungle.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 3 May 2021, in Oktwin town, Taungoo township (Taungoo district, Bago region), a fire broke out at the ward administration office. The fire was extinguished about 20 minutes later but the entire building was almost destroyed. No casualties reported. The cause of the fire was not reported, although government and military facilities have been hit by arson and bomb attacks in recent weeks.
Property destruction: On 3 May 2021, in Yae Oe village (Namtu Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), an unknown armed group reportedly set two houses on fire.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Border Guard Force
NOTES: Movement of forces: On 3 May 2021, in Hpapun township (Hpapun district, Kayin State), about 400 BGF troops were deployed in the KNU brigade 5 controlled area.

Property destruction: On 3 May 2021, in Pazundaung township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military and police destroyed civilians cars and also accidentally broke a car window that belonged to a military major.

Around 3 May 2021 (as reported), in Bago town (Bago township, Bago district, Bago region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested at least one civilian. The security forces have reportedly been raiding neighbourhood in Bago town and arrested about 1 to 3 civilians every day.
On 3 May 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay township, Pyay district, Bago-West Region), the wife of the assassinated NLD elected member of parliament was arrested by the Myanmar military.
On 3 May 2021, in Hsipaw town (Hsipaw township, Kyaukme district, Shan-North State), U Dollar (aka) U Tun Shwe from 88 Generation Peace and Open Society was arrested by the Myanmar military forces.

On 3 May 2021, in Yae Pyar village (Pauk township, Pakokku district, Magway region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested some villagers reportedly found with improvised explosives. The military junta claimed that villagers fired artillery shells.

Non-violent activity: On 3 May 2021, in Tamwe township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), locals organized a paper plane people-less protest against the Myanmar military coup.

Non-violent activity: On 3 May 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon region), students from the National University of Arts and Culture held a people-less paper strike in protest against the Myanmar military coup and denounced education under the Military regime.

On 4 May 2021, in Kyauk Pyat That village (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), a village elder was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). The reason for his arrest was not reported.

On 4 May 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), a 40-year-old woman was arrested at her home by military and police forces. The reason for her arrest was not reported.

Movement of forces: On 4 May 2021, in Kale town, Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), soldiers in seven military vehicles were moving towards Gangaw township where clashes between Myanmar military and locals were ongoing.

Looting: On 4 May 2021, in Pin Tin village, Khin-U town (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing), Myanmar military forces raided the house of a villager who is very active in anti-coup protest movement. The military forces destroyed some of his belongings and took away properties worth of 12 million Myanmar kyats.
On 4 May 2021, in Kyauk Myaung ward, Tamwe township (Yangon-East District, Yangon), two girls were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) for playing a revolutionary song at home.

Defusal: On 4 May 2021, in Namhsan township (Kyaukme district, Shan-North), a bomb was found in front of a government building. Following this, the military sealed off the road around the office to investigate the bomb.

Displacement: Around 4 May 2021 (between 4 - 7 May), in Nawnghkio township (Kyaukme district, Shan-North), more than 300 villagers from Nar Yoke and Nar Mun villages fled Ku Lar Kwe village due to fighting between RCSS and SSPP.

Displacement: On 4 May 2021, in Kutkai township (Muse District, Shan-North), more than 500 villagers fled to Kutkai town due to the clashes between the Myanmar military and the combined forces of MNDAA, TNLA and KIA in Maw Hit, and between Man Ban and Nawng Hswe village.

On 4 May 2021, in Twantay township (Yangon (South) District, Yangon Region), police conducted a search after the curfew hours and arrested nine young men as they were found walking around on the streets after the curfew was in place.

On 4 May 2021, in Thaketa township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), security forces (coded as military and police) raided neighbourhoods and arrested young people. This came one day after a ward administrator was stabbed to death by unknown individuals in the same township.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Teachers (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 5 May 2021, in Mudon town (Mudon Township, Mawlamyine District, Mon State), an NLD information officer-cum-youth organizer, the wife and 20-day-old baby boy of the leader of a local rescue services team, and a teacher participating in the civil disobedience movement were arrested by military and police forces. It was reported that two military informants were also involved in the manhunt for the leader of the local rescue team.

On 5 May 2021, in Salin town, Salin township (Minbu District, Magway Region), three brothers - including a protester who was shot and injured at an anti-coup demonstration back in 3 March - were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police forces).

On 5 May 2021, in Tawma village and Monpin village, Kyuakse township (Kyaukse district, Mandalay Region), Myanmar military forces raided the two villages, arrested the villagers and took away money and other valuables from the village administrator's house who used to work under NLD government. The number of those arrested is not reported.

Looting: On 5 May 2021, in Tha Min Chan village (Kani township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military forces fired guns for 5 times, threatened the villagers, killed the chickens, and took away alcohol and money owned by the villagers.

Property destruction: On 5 May 2021, in Sin Inn village, Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military forces stationed in the village raided anti-coup protesters' houses and destroyed 11 houses.

ACTOR1: RCSS/SSA-S: Restoration Council of Shan State/Shan State Army-South
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
NOTES: Property destruction: On 5 May 2021, in Yae Oe village (Namtu Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), 4 houses were set on fire and destroyed. The RCSS and TNLA blamed each other for the incident.

Movement of forces: Around 5 May 2021 (as reported), in Bhamo town (Bhamo township, Bhamo district, Kachin State), the Myanmar military reinforced troops in town. The Myanmar military was accused of bombing and one-sidedly firing in the town as a part of their effort to instil fear among civilians.
On 5 May 2021, in 50th Street, Botahtaung township (Yangon-East district, Yangon Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested eight youths.

Other: On 5 May 2021, in Lashio town (Lashio Township, Lashio District, Shan State), the office of Shwe Phee Myay News Agency was raided and broken into by unknown individuals. The editor claimed that it was not unlikely to be a case of burglary as food, electrical appliances and other items in the office were searched through but no items were taken away.

On 5 May 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon region), three other youths were arrested by military and police forces in relation to the explosion that took place at Utopia Tower earlier on the same day. The mixed martial arts (MMA) fighter who was injured in a bomb blast was later arrested by security forces at the North Okkalapa Hospital for allegedly manufacturing improvised explosives. Security forces then raided the house of the MMA fighter and arrested two people.

On 5 May 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), two youths were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) and remain incommunicado at the time of reporting on 7 May. While the reason for their arrests was not reported, residents claimed that security forces were taking photos of participants in an anti-coup demonstration on 2 May and chasing identified people in the photos.

Looting: On 5 May 2021, in Pi Tauk Pin village (Kanbalu Township, Kanbalu District, Sagaing Region), security forces (coded as military and police) took away the villagers' properties and phones while the villagers were fleeing away from the villages.
Change to armed group: On 5 May 2021, in Sagaing township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), locals established the Sagaing People Defense Force (SPDF).

Change to armed group: On 5 May 2021, the interim National Unity Government (NUG) announced the formation of the People's Defense Force, established in cooperation with ethnic armed organizations. The NUG stated that the defense force will be made up of youths and others who oppose the military junta and will receive military training from EAOs in territories controlled by the EAOs. The PDF will serve as a precursor for a federal army. Location coded as Nay Pyi Taw.

Non-violent activity: On 5 May 2021, in Chanayethazan township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), people-less strike was held to protest against the military education system, Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

Non-violent activity: On 5 May 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), a people-less strike was held against the Myanmar military coup and in support of the civil disobedience movement.

On 6 May 2021, in Pathein town (Pathein township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady Region), military and police forces arrested the mother and brother of a man after they failed to find the man. Three phones were also confiscated.

Property destruction: On 6 May 2021, in Sagaing town (Sagaing township, Sagaing district, Sagaing region), a branch office of Myanmar Economic Bank (a public bank that manages pension payment to government pensioners) was set on fire at night. No casualties or major damages were reported.

Security measures: On 6 May 2021, in Kar Paung Kya village (coded as Kar Paung Kya (East)), Taze township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), following the killing of a villager with close links to the junta, security forces (coded as military and police) entered the village and fired either rubber bullets or live rounds.

On 6 May 2021, in front of the NLD headquarters in Bahan Township (Yangon (East) District, Yangon Region), three members of the NLD central committee were taken away by security forces (coded as military and police forces). Their whereabouts remain unknown at the time of reporting.

Looting: On 6 May 2021, in Ywar Thar village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), military forces stormed the village and opened fire at a young man who was fleeing on a motorcycle. They also took bags of rice and food from houses and shops in the village, and sheep from a shepherd. Villages fled in the rain following the incident.

On 6 May 2021, in Dawei town (Dawei township, Dawei district, Tanintharyi Region), a young man volunteering at a local emergency rescue services was arrested at the office by security forces (coded as military and police).

On 6 May 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested the mother of a young anti-coup protester after they failed to find him at his house. They also raided a temple and arrested one person who was reportedly using Wi-Fi at the temple.

On 6 May 2021, in Hakha town, Hakha township (Hakha district, Chin state), twelve people, including a Christian pastor, were arrested by military and police forces. During the raid in the town, security forces reportedly also took away 600,000 kyats and clothes from a family. Ten of the 12 arrested were later released just after 9pm on the same day.
Displacement: Around 6 May 2021 (as reported), in Hpapun district (Kayin state), more than 30,000 people have been forced to flee their homes due to heavy artillery fire by the Myanmar military.
On 6 May 2021, in Taunggyi town, Taunggyi township (Taunggyi District, Shan State), three youths were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) in the morning for reasons unknown.

Security measures: On 6 May 2021, in Upper Kin village (Ah Htet Kin) (Kani township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), following an earlier shootout near the village during the day, military troops were deployed and conducted raids the village in the evening. Around 3,000 villagers from Kin, Kin Taung and Mi Chaung Twin villages fled their homes. Several hundred villagers are now living in the forest.

On 7 May 2021, in Ywar Thar village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), military forces arrested a 40-year-old villager who was reportedly drunk and had fallen asleep. The reason for his arrest is not clear.

On 7 May 2021, in Dawei township (Dawei District, Tanintharyi Region), a headmistress from Thinbawsate primary school and her husband were arrested at their home by the security forces (coded as military and police). On 7 May 2021, in Namtu town, Namtu township (Kyaukme district, Shan State), military troops conducted a search and arrest operation at night. One person who allegedly joined an anti-coup protest earlier that day was arrested.

On 8 May 2021, in Mogoke township (coded as Mogoke) (Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay Region), 11 civilians were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police).

On 8 May 2021, in ward number 1, Ngazun town (Ngazun Township, Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), a member of National League for Democracy was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police).

On 8 May 2021, in Shwebo town (Shwebo township, Shwebo district, Sagaing Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested a poet, his wife and another family member from their home after accusing them of planning a bomb attack.

On 8 May 2021, Hsipaw Township (Kyaukme District, Shan-North State), 4 people involved in anti-coup protests were arrested by security forces (coded as police and military) and charged under Section 505.

On 8 May 2021, in some villages near Kani town including Zeepintwin village (Kani Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested four villagers. All four villagers were released in the evening.

On 10 May 2021, in Kani township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), about 80 military soldiers arrested nine villagers from Thaminchan, Aung Mingalar and Minma villages who had fled into the jungle. Some of villagers were taken to Monywa in nine military vehicles. Troops then raided the forest of Hman Taung mountain and arrested 14 members of the civilian resistance group. They were all detained and sent to Monywa. It was reported that nearly 13,000 villagers from at least two-dozen villages have been hiding in nearby forests in fear of raids by security forces following recent clashes between the Myanmar military and local resistance groups.

SOURCE: Irrawaddy; VOA; Democratic Voice of Burma

NOTES: On 26 May 2021, in Letpadapya village, Kyaukpadaung Township (coded as Kyaukpadaung), Nyaung-U District, Mandalay Region), nine female fried chicken vendors were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). The arrest came after an image of them dated 24 May was posted with the vendors posing with three-finger salutes.
On 26 May 2021, at Ayetharyar gate near Taunggyi town (Taunggyi District, Shan-South State), 5 men from Nyaung Shwe town on their way to the hospital were arrested by Myanmar military forces.
On 26 May 2021, in Dawei town (Dawei District, Tanintharyi Region), the owner of the teashop where teashop-protest was staged on 25 May was arrested.

Weapons seizure: On 26 May 2021, in Shwe Nan Thar ward in Bahan township (Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), Myanmar military forces seized pistols, hand-made guns, bullets and other weapons. 2 people found with the seizure were arrested.

On 26 May 2021, near Loikaw town (Loikaw District, Kachin State), three volunteers (including a former NLD candidate) who were delivering aid to internally displaced villagers in Htee Poe Ka Loe village were arrested by Myanmar military forces. They were detained at a military compound in Loikaw.

Change to armed group: Around 26 May 2021 (as reported), in the Ayeyarwady region (coded as Pathein), a pro-military armed force called Ayeyarwady National Force was formed. On 6 September, they issued a statement with a list of NLD supporters and threatened their lives. They vowed to cooperate with the Myanmar military.

On 26 May 2021, in Mogoke township (Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), five former village administrators and village elders in Thit Seint Kone and Sa Khan Gyi villages were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). A couple who were gardeners were also arrested.

On 26 May 2021, in Maw Gyi village, Phaungdaw village tract, Kan Pauk area (Yebyu Township, Dawei District, Tanintharyi Region), 4 civilians were beaten and arrested by Myanmar military forces. All 4 civilians who were arrested were the observers in 2020 General Elections.

Change to armed group: On 27 May 2021, in Hkamti township (Hkamti District, Sagaing Region), the People's Defense Force - Hkamti was formed. The group stated that it will follow the defence policies of the People's Defense Force under the National Unity Government.

On 27 May 2021, in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi township, Magway District, Magway region), a teacher participating in the civil disobedience movement was arrested at her home by military soldiers and people in civilian clothes and taken to the police station. The reason for her arrest was not reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Labour Group (Myanmar); Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: On 27 May 2021, in Loikaw township (Loikaw district, Kayah state), a fire broke out at the factory manager's office building of a government-owned hydropower plant. The cause of the fire was not known, although government and military buildings and facilities have been targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

Security measures: On 27 May 2021, in Nat Kan Lel village (Kyaukpadaung township, Nyaung-U district, Mandalay region), 15 military vehicles surrounded the village. Nearly all men in the village fled. This came after military soldiers raided the village last night and arrested five villagers.

Defusal: On 27 May 2021, in Ywar Thar Gyi village (Wetlet township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), bombs were reportedly found in a dumpster in front of a high school. Military and police came to the scene to detonate the bomb.

On 27 May 2021, in Lay Taung, Ramree township (Kyaukpyu district, Rakhine state), military soldiers reportedly opened fire and arrested three youths. The youths were riding a motorcycle and reportedly shouted anti-coup slogans while they were passing by monastery where military soldiers were temporarily based. They were detained overnight before being released after the ward administrator met with military officials.

Defusal: On 27 May 2021, in Paung town (Paung township, Thaton District, Mon State), a package reported by officials to be a handmade bomb was found in the corridor of a school building in Moe Naing ward. Police forces arrived at 11am to remove the package. School enrolment was suspended on the day due to the discovery of the bomb.

Looting: On 27 May 2021, in Zee Hpyu Kone and Shan Myaung villages (Kani Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided houses and shops. The military looted food items and motorcycles.
Looting: On 27 May 2021, in Kyaw Ywar village (Kani Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided houses and shops. The military looted food items and motorcycles.

On 27 May 2021, in Aungpinle ward in Chanmyathazi Township (Mandalay District, Mandalay Region), two children of NLD member and one neighbour were arrested as hostages by Myanmar military forces. Gold and jewelleries worth of 30 million Myanmar kyats were also take away.
On 27 May 2021, at Hinthada township court in Hinthada town (Hinthada District, Ayeyarwady Region), a lawyer representing political prisoners at the court was arrested by Myanmar military forces.

On 27 May 2021, in Maungdaing (1) Ward in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi District, Magway Region), security forces coded as (military and police) arrested the mother of a political activist as hostage.
On 27 May 2021, in Mudon town (Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a 39-year-old man NLD supporter.
On 27 May 2021, in Nat Kan Lel village (Kyaukpadaung Township, Nyaung-U District, Mandalay Region), Myanmar military forces arrested 3 men and 2 women.
Weapons seizure: On 27 May 2021, near Mayangchaung checkpoint in Kyaikto township (Thaton District, Mon State), Myanmar military forces seized a vehicle carrying an RPG and several other weapons.

Looting: On 27 May 2021, in Kin Mun Thaw village (Chaung-U township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), about 40 members of military junta forces (coded as military and police) arrived in the village, firing 100 shots. Security forces destroyed three houses and stole gold jewellery and about 3 million kyats. They also smashed refrigerators and television sets before exiting the village. Villagers reported that there were no protests held in the village and it was not clear why junta forces ransacked the village.

Security measures: On 28 May 2021, in Moe Kaung village (Kani township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), about 50 members of security forces (coded as military and police) - including 20 in military uniforms and 30 in civilian clothes - arrived at and raided the village. Villagers reportedly fled.

Change to armed group: On 28 May 2021, in Tabayin township (Shwebo District, Sagaing region), the People's Defense Force was formed in Tabayin township. The group stated that they will strictly abide by the defence policies of the National Unity Government.

Security measures: On 28 May 2021, in Aing Pauk Gyi village (Khin-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), following the killing of a USDP member earlier on the same day, military soldiers entered the village to launch an investigation on villagers who were suspected of murdering the USDP member. Some villagers fled as they were afraid of staying in the village.

On 28 May 2021, in Chanayethazan township (Mandalay district, Mandalay Region), a photojournalist from the Myanmar Pressphoto Agency was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). The reason for his arrest was not reported.

On 28 May 2021, in Mudon town (Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) searched for a teacher who joined the civil disobedience movement. The security forces could not find her and arrested her brother.

On 29 May 2021, in Payathonzu town (Kyainseikgyi Township, Kawkareik District, Kayin State), at least 6 civilians were arrested by Myanmar military forces on suspicion of being involved in explosions in the city.

On 29 May 2021, in Thanlyin township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a man and charged him under panel code 505 (a). He later died at Insein Prison sometime in July 2021 after being infected with COVID-19.

On 29 May 2021, in Myinthar ward in Magway town (Magway District, Magway Region), two poets were arrested by Myanmar military forces. During the arrest, pictures of State Counsellor Daw Aung San Suu Kyi were taken as evidence.
On 29 May 2021, at a gaming station in Taungpyin ward number 2 in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi District, Magway Region), 10 youths playing games were arrested by Myanmar military forces.

Looting: On 29 May 2021, in In Daing Gyi village (Khin-U Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military forces looted the villagers' properties and took away jewelleries, cash, food and others household appliances.
Property destruction: On 29 May 2021, in Hin Thar village (Yesagyo Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), Myanmar military forces raided NLD members' houses and destroyed the properties.

On 29 May 2021, in Kar Paung Kya (East) village (Taze Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), a large number of Myanmar military forces entered the village, forcing villagers to flee into nearly jungle for safety. Military forces chased villagers into the jungle and arrested around 8 villagers.

On 29 May 2021, in Rikkha ward in Paletwa town (Paletwa Township, Matupi District, Chin State), chairman of the Khumi Literature and Culture Committee was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police).
On 29 May 2021, in Dawei town (Dawei District, Tanintharyi Region), 14 student leaders who were involve in anti-coup protest movements were arrested by Myanmar military forces.

Change to armed group: On 29 May 2021, in Hsihseng township (Pa-O Self-Administered Zone, Shan-South), locals formed the Pa-Oh National Defense Force to carry out armed resistance against Myanmar military regime.

SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency
NOTES: On 30 May 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), a man (who owns a lottery shop and a drugstore) was arrested by regime forces (coded as military and police). He was charged under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-); Women (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 30 May 2021, outside of Monywa town (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), a female member of parliament from NLD (who won the 2020 general elections) was arrested by Myanmar military forces.
On 30 May 2021, in Myaungmya township (Myaungmya District, Ayeyarwady Region), 4 teachers volunteering at a school were arrested by Myanmar military forces.
On 30 May 2021, in Kyat Pyin ward in Mogoke town (Mogoke Township, Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay Region), a civilian was arrested at his home by Myanmar military forces.
On 30 May 2021, in Mudon town (Mawlamyine District, Mon State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a 60-year-old man NLD supporter.
Property destruction: On 30 May 2021, in Mudon town (Mawlamyine District, Mon State), an unknown assailant set fire to a primary school. The fire destroyed the office of the head of the school.

Movement of forces: On 30 May 2021, in Pauk Township (Pakokku District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military employed about 200 soldiers, and tightened security measures around Zee Taw, Tet Kone and Kin Ma villages.
On 30 May 2021, in Kanpetlet town (Kanpetlet Township, Mindat District, Chin State), the Myanmar military arrested two youths who went to the town to go shopping.
On 30 May 2021, in Bawlake town (Bawlake District, Kayah State), two youths were arrested by Myanmar military forces.
On 30 May 2021, in Pekon town (Pekon Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South State), a youth was arrested by Myanmar military forces after they found anti-coup protest photos in his phone.

ACTOR1: PNO/PNA: Pa-Oh National Organization/Pa-Oh National Army
NOTES: Movement of forces: Around 30 May 2021 (from 29 May - 1 June), in Hsihseng township (Pa-O Self-Administered Zone, Shan-South), the PNA enforced its troop movement in the township after the formation of Pa-oh National Defense Force on 29 May. PNA is an ally of the Myanmar military.

On 31 May 2021, (coded as Kamayut town, Kamaryut Township, Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), a Foodpanda rider was arrested by Myanmar military forces and was kept at the police station on Pyay Road while he was delivering the order.
On 31 May 2021, in Bhamo town (Bhamo Township, Bhamo District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military and police arrested a member of NLD at his house at night.

Looting: On 31 May 2021, in Thar Si village (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military searched a house of a teacher who joined the nationwide civil disobedience movement, and looted 22 lakhs Myanmar kyats.

On 31 May 2021, in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi township, Magway District, Magway region), the grandfather of a political activist was arrested by the military at his house on Myo Yone Kone Road after the military failed to find the target. The political activist's girlfriend's house was also searched. The military reportedly smashed mobile phones and also took away some items.

On 31 May 2021, in Moe Sit village (Shwegu Township, Bhamo District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military established a base camp at the top of the village after villagers held a pot-banging held a protest against the Myanmar military coup and to drive out teachers who didn't join the civil disobedience movement

On 31 May 2021, in Tat Kone village in Pauk town (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), Myanmar military forces arrested 5 civilians. This came after clashes broke out between the military and villagers.

NOTES: On 31 May 2021, in Monywa town, Monywa township (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military arrested a member of All Burma Federation of Students Unions. Security forces (assumed to be the military and police) also arrested a woman who helped IDPs in the Sagaing region.

Change to armed group: On 31 May 2021, in Kayah State (coded as Loikaw), a local armed group such as People's Defense Force - Demoso, People's Defense Force - Loikaw, People's Defense Force - Hpruso and People's Defense Force - Nan Mei Khon formed Karenni Nationalities Defense Force.
On 31 May 2021, in Thar Si village (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military arrested 8 civilians.

On 31 May 2021, in Kaung Wai village, Mong Ko sub-township, Muse township (Muse district, Shan-North), soldiers from the 547th Infantry Battalion have set up camp near Kaung Wai village. Residents reported that soldiers have been raiding shops, interrogating and threatening shopkeepers and attempting to extort money from them.
On 31 May 2021, in Zar Di village in Yebyu township (Dawei District, Tanintharyi Region), the Myanmar military arrested one former health worker and a political activist at night.

Property destruction: On 1 June 2021, in Na Bet Gyi village, Taze township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), a fire broke out and destroyed a residential building within the compound of Taze Police Station as well as a high school at night. While the cause of the fire was not confirmed, police and military buildings, as well as educational facilities and schools, have been targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

Security measures: On 1 June 2021, in Ma U Ale village (Yesagyo Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), military forces arrived in three vehicles and raided and searched the home of a anti-coup protest leader.

Property destruction: On 1 June 2021, in Kangyidaunt town (Kangyidaunt Township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady Region), a fire broke out at the Myoma market, destroying 175 shops as well as three houses near the market. Security forces have arrested four local youths and political activists in relation to the incident. Two of them were later released on 2 June.

On 1 June 2021, in Myingyan town, Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay Region), three military personnel in plainclothes arrested a youth who was sitting at a teashop in Ward 9. The reason for his arrest was not reported.

On 1 June 2021, in Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), a man was arrested at his home in Panma ward by security forces (assumed to be the military and police). Locals stated that he may have been arrested for being involved in charitable activities in the area.

On 1 June 2021, in Pakokku town, Pakokku township (Pakokku District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military searched a photocopier shop. As they could not find the owner, they arrested a young man from a nearby motorcycle repair shop.

On 1 June 2021, in Kyonpyaw town (Kyonpyaw Township, Pathein District, Ayeyarwady Region), the Myanmar military arrested three civilians after a bomb exploded near a primary school and township education office.

Property destruction: On 1 June 2021, in Pan Lin village (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), a fire broke out at a school. The cause of the fire was not reported, but government schools have been targeted by arson attacks in recent weeks.
Security measures: On 1 June 2021, in Puta-O Township (Kachin State), the Myanmar military raided a Lung Sut IDPs on suspicion of KIA spies living in the camp.
Security measures: On 1 June 2021, in Kyainseikgyi township (Kawkareik District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military aeroplane flew over villages around the foothills of Mulai Mountain.

Change to armed group: On 1 June 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), a local armed resistance group called Ghost Rider (MDY) Special Task Force was formed. The group vowed to protect the civilians' properties and operate under the People's Defense Force.

Other: On 1 June 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon Region), locals formed People Supply Force. In its first statement, the PSF stated that it will provide medical support to PDF groups and the public to support the fight against the Myanmar military regime.

Around 1 June 2021 (as reported), in Paletwa Township (Mindat District, Chin State), 16 residents - including the chairperson of the Khumi Literature and Culture Committee - were arrested by military forces in relation to the explosions on 28 May. Six of them were later released. In addition, the military has cut off all access to the town by blocking all roads and stopping all boats from entering the town. Locals are also not allowed to leave the town. The military claimed that the town would be cut off in order for the military to conduct an investigation on the blasts.
Displacement: On 1 June 2021, thousands of villagers fled from three villages such as Hnan Khar, Yae Shin Ma and Ye Hla villages in Gangaw Township, Gangaw District, Magway Region.
Security measures: On 1 June 2021, in Yangon (Yangon Region), the Myanmar military tightened security measures in the city. More troops were seen patrolling the city.

On 1 June 2021, at Kachin Baptist Convention IDP camp in Chipwi township (Myitkyina District, Kachin State), one woman and 2 of her children were arrested by Myanmar military forces on accusation of communicating with KIA.

Property destruction: Around 1 June 2021 (between 21 May - 12 June), in Ngwe Taung village (Demoso Township, Loikaw District, Kayah State), an unknown armed group destroyed houses and shops in the village. About 20 houses were destroyed. The Myanmar military LIB 427 and IB 102 were active in the area.

On 1 June 2021, in Hlaingthayar township (Hlaingtharya-East, Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), a man driving a trailer in ward 7 was arrested by the military at 11pm, on suspicion of being a spy. His mobile phones were reportedly confiscated.

Training: Around 2 June 2021 (as reported), in Puta-O district, Kachin state, amid escalating conflict with the KIA, the military has reportedly instructed veterans living in Machanbaw, Nogmung and Khawnglanhpu to return to service. Locals estimated that around 200 veterans from 46th Battalion have been recalled. Insider sources stated that the veterans are not required to fight on the frontlines, but are providing security at battalion headquarters. Some of the veterans' adult-aged children were reportedly receiving military training.

On 2 June 2021, in Oakshitpin town, Padaung township, Pyay district, Bago-West Region, police forces raided the house of a political activist and arrested his mother and wife after police failed to find the target who had gone into hiding.

SOURCE: Network Media Group; Democratic Voice of Burma; Karen Information Center News; Irrawaddy
NOTES: Displacement: On 2 June 2021, in Myawaddy Township (Myawaddy District, Kayin State), about 700 villagers from Hpa Lu, Hpa Lu Lay and Rathe Ku and Waw Lay fled to the Thai-Myanmar border and Layt Kay Kaw town due to the ongoing conflict around the area.

SOURCE: Shan Herald Agency for News; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: Displacement: On 2 June 2021, near Loi Hun village located between Kyethi and Mongnawng town (Kyethi Township, Loilen District, Shan-South), the fighting between TNLA and RCSS displaced more than 700 villagers.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Lawyers (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 2 June 2021, in Sagaing town (Sagaing Township, Sagaing District, Sagaing Region), a lawyer (also an NLD member) was arrested at his home in Ywa Daung ward in the morning. The reason for his arrest was not reported.

On 2 June 2021, in Pyaung Khaung village, Mogoke township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), five political activists were arrested at their homes by security forces (coded as military and police). Three of them were later released on 3 June.

NOTES: Property destruction: On 2 June 2021, near the port of Kyauk Gyi village (Shwegu township, Bhamo district, Kachin state), a ship said to be carrying rice from Katha for military troops was shot down by unknown persons. It was said that gunshots and artillery fire were heard by villagers.

On 2 June 2021, in Kyauk Kone village, Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrived in the village at around 1am and arrested six villagers, including a Korean language teacher.

About 13 villagers (including Ah Lel Ywar, Chaung Gwa, Shwe Bo, Taung Khin Yan, Thin Taw, Ywar Ma, Ye Hla, Yae Shin Ma, and Hnan Khar) were raided in the Yaw area. In some villages, the military also took villagers' properties.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Security measures: On 2 June 2021, in Rakhine state (coded as Sittwe), the respective township administration announced a nightly curfew from 9pm to 5am for two months, imposed under Section 144 of the Penal Code in Rathedaung township and Minbya townships.

Defusal: On 2 June 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), a bomb was found at the entrance of No. 3 Basic Education High School. The bomb was detonated by the authorities (coded as military and police).

On 2 June 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan State), a man was arrested at 3pm by regime forces (coded as military and police). He was charged under Section 505(b) of the Penal Code.

Around 2 June 2021 (between 2 - 2 June), in Hpa Lu areas (coded as Hpa Lu Gyi) (Myawaddy Township, Myawaddy District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military occupied civilians houses. Several civilians fled to Thailand on 1 June and 2 June. And they returned on 5 June. However, as the military had taken up positions in their houses, the civilians could not return to their houses.

On 3 June 2021, in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi township, Magway District, Magway region), a woman was arrested by military and police forces while she was at work at a store. Around 3 June 2021 (as reported), in Hpa Lu Lay village in Myawaddy Township (Myawaddy District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military occupied a monastery as their base camp.

On 3 June 2021, in Mohnyin town, Mohnyin township (Mohnyin District, Kachin State), two mosques were raided by security forces (coded as military and police) at around 2pm. A member of the Mohnyin Jame Mosque was arrested by security forces.

On 3 June 2021, in Ahthoke town (Yegyi Township, Pathein District, Ayeyarwady Region), two civilians were arrested by Myanmar military forces in relation to the bomb explosion on 1 June 2021.

SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 4 June 2021, in Monywa town, Monywa township (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), a young man was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) at his home at around 7pm. He was arrested after security forces failed to find his father.

On 4 June 2021, in Ahpyauk town, Taikkyi township (Yangon (North) District, Yangon Region), an NLD member from Shwepyithar township was arrested by the military at around 1am. He was arrested under Section 505(a) of the Penal Code and taken back to Hlawga police station in Shwepyithar township which he was detained.

NOTES: Movement of forces: On 4 June 2021, around Kha Lel village in Kyainseikgyi township (Kawkareik District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military and BGF deployed soldiers with nearly 30 military trucks to Kha Lel-Ta Khun Taing police station after a clash between the KNU and the combined forces of the Myanmar military and BGF.

NOTES: On 6 June 2021, near Sanpya market in Thingangyun township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), an elected member of parliament from NLD was arrested by Myanmar military forces.

The military junta accused four people - including the detainee - of attending training from the Kachin Independence Army. On 6 June 2021, in ward number 5 of Ayetharyar town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South State), a member of NLD party's township executive committee was arrested.

The Si Laung village track (Si Laung, Aung Chan Thar and Aung Chan Aye villages) host about 1,300 people.

NOTES: On 8 June 2021, in Nawnghkio township (Kyaukme District, Shan-North), a philanthropist was arrested by the police after the police raided his home and allegedly found a yellow hat and a black shirt typically used by protesters during the anti-coup protests. On 8 June 2021, in Kamma township (Thayet District, Magway Region), six locals, including a Hluttaw parliamentarian for Kamma township, were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police). The regime claimed that they were in possession of weapons and ammunition.

Security measures: On 8 June 2021, in Mu Tar Lel village (Katha Township, Katha District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military on a ship heading toward Bhamo one-sidedly fired warning shots at about 20 villagers taking bath at a beach. Villagers ran away.
Defusal: On 8 June 2021, in Shwebo town, Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military defused two bombs at the BOC traffic point and the middle of a road.

On 8 June 2021, in Tigyaing town (Tigyaing township, Katha district, Sagaing Region), according to the state-run media, security forces (coded as military and police) arrested an odd job worker - reportedly dressed in school uniform - after he exploded a sound bomb within the compound of a school. It was reported that he pretended to be a student and accepted a payment of 100,000 kyats from an unidentified woman to set off the sound bomb.

Property destruction: On 8 June 2021, in Mohnyin township (Mohnyin district, Kachin state), a fire broke out at a high school in Myo Thit Ka Lay village at 8:30pm. Another fire also broke out at a high school in Nam Khar ward at 6:45pm. No casualties reported. While the cause of the fire was not reported, educational facilities and offices have been targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

Property destruction: On 8 June 2021, in Loi Yin village, coded as Loi Yin (Lower), in Pekon Township (Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military set fire and destroyed two cars that carried rice bags, oil and medicines for about 3,000 IDPs in Pekon Township.

Security measures: Around 8 June 2021 (as reported), in Demoso township (Loikaw District, Kayah State), the Myanmar military allegedly planted landmines in empty wards and villagers. The recent fighting between the military and local defense forces in Demoso Township displaced several villagers.

On 8 June 2021, in Kin Mun Taw village (Chaung-U Township, Monywa District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military troops entered to the village and arrested two men, including a man older than 50 years of age. Villagers fled to a safe area.

NOTES: Property destruction: On 15 June 2021, in Yi Dway village (Kanbalu township, Kanbalu district, Sagaing Region), three betel farms owned by USDP members and supporters were destroyed by unknown perpetrators. USDP members accused NLD supporters in the village for carrying out the attack.

On 15 June 2021, in Kun Saik village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), in the evening, the military arrested 38 civilians after the incident where two unidentified men stabbed the former USDP chair near the village earlier on the same day. 36 of them were later released. More than 1,000 villagers fled to the forested hills.

On 15 June 2021, in Nyaung Hla village (Tabayin Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), about 200 Myanmar military entered to the village and destroyed some houses. The military also arrested some villagers.

Around 15 June 2021 (month of), in Thit Seint Gyi village (Wetlet Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), after the village administrator reported to the military, the Myanmar military came to the village and arrested 7 youth.

On 15 June 2021, in Kayan township (Yangon-South District, Yangon Region), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a woman. The arrested woman later died from COVID-19 on 22 July while detained in Insein Prison.

Around 16 June 2021 (between 15 - 16 June), in Hpa Do village (Kyauktaga township, Bago District, Bago Region), security forces (coded as military and police) raided houses in Ward 1 and 5 and arrested more than 20 people in connection to the explosion that happened in front of Ward No. 5 administration office on 15 June. The detainees included a former Hpa Do administrator and a local volunteer. Family members said that they had no contact with those held in custody. Military forces raided several houses again on 18 June.
On 16 June 2021, in Botahtaung township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), 5 civilians were arrested by Myanmar military forces on suspicion of links with the murder of former USDP candidate.

On 16 June 2021, in Lel Gyi village (Sagaing Township, Sagaing District, Sagaing Region), military forces stormed the village and arrested an anointed person and a female schoolteacher at their home. Military forces fired seven shots during the raid to intimidate villages. Students and villagers then demanded the release of the schoolteacher, who was later found unconscious in the forest. The anointed person remain in custody. Three motorcycles were also taken away by military forces from the village.

On 16 June 2021, in Homalin township (Hkamti district, Sagaing Region), military forces raided a Buddhist monastery on Naungpukyit mountain and arrested the abbot. It was reported that the abbot had put up a sign at the entrance of the monastery stating that military soldiers should not encroach on monastery grounds. Two other civilians were also arrested for alleged possession of air guns during a raid.

On 16 June 2021, in Hlay Swea village (Kyonpyaw Township, Pathein District, Ayeyarwady Region), a young man from the village was arrested by regime forces (coded as military and police). The reason for the arrest was not known.

Defusal: On 16 June 2021, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), a bomb was found at the Pa-O National Organization (PNO) headquarters. The Myanmar military was called in and the bomb was safely detonated.

Displacement: On 16 June 2021, in Kutkai Township (Muse District, Shan-North), the Myanmar military clashed with the Northern Alliance group forced more than 120 villagers to flee to the Pang Ku IDP camp.
On 16 June 2021, in Shwegu town (Shwegu Township, Bhamo District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military tightened the security measures and arrested about 20 people.

Displacement: On 16 June 2021, in Hpet Khat and Pin Tin village (Mingin Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military forced the villagers to get out of the village and threatened them of burning their villages.

Looting: On 17 June 2021, in Chaung-U township (Monywa District, Sagaing Region), military forces stormed several villages (including Myint village, Shwe Ku village, Ywar Thit village) and ransacked shops and houses of protest leaders and health workers participating in the civil disobedience movement. They removed and destroyed NLD signboards. They also broke into the homes of business owners to demand bribes. They also raided a shop and took away 200,000 kyats, cooking oil and a can of kerosene.
Looting: On 17 June 2021, in Homalin township (Hkamti district, Sagaing Region), military troops and about 50 police officers raided a Buddhist monastery and took away more than 100 bags of rice.
On 17 June 2021, in Ka Lawt Thawt village (Mudon township, Mawlamyine district, Mon state), an NLD member was arrested by military forces at night. The reason for his arrest was not reported.

On 17 June 2021, in Amarapura township (Mandalay District, Mandalay Region), about 100 military troops raided areas in the township and arrested two people. The reason for their arrests was not known.
Security measures: On 17 June 2021, along Mingin and Kani township (coded as Mingin) (Kale District, Sagaing Region), the military searched villages to hunt down members of local defense groups.

Property destruction: On 17 June 2021, in Inn Lay village (Mohnyin township, Mohnyin District, Kachin State), an unknown assailant set fire to a high school in the village. The cause of the fire was not known, although government buildings, schools and education offices have been targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

On 18 June 2021, in Kone Gyi village (Kani Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military forces and Pyu Saw Htee forces searched the houses and arrested the villagers. The number of those arrested is not reported.

Most of them were from Taung Min Tae Ward. Eleven of the detainees were reportedly released later that morning although this has yet been confirmed.

Property destruction: On 21 June 2021, in Lel Zin village (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), a fire broke out in a basic education high school. Three youths were later arrested in relation to the incident. The cause of the fire was not known, although government buildings, schools and education offices have been targets of arson attacks in recent weeks.

On 21 June 2021, in Monywa town (Monywa Township, Monywa District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided a house and arrested a tutor, his five family members (including a 6-year-old girl) and three house guests. NOTES: On 21 June 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), security forces (coded as military and police) raided a local civil society organization called Kanaung Institute and arrested four people, including two staff members of the organization, a former NLD parliamentarian and a recently-defected military soldier.

On 22 June 2021, on the way back from Ann to Yangon (in Ann township, Kyaukpyu district, Rakhine), two Hmawbi University of Technology students were arrested and charged with Penal Code of 505. This charge was dropped on 20 October, but they were taken to Toungup police station and charged with Unlawful association law 17(2).

The destruction of 8 house left more than 40 people homeless. No reports of casualties.

NOTES: Property destruction: On 22 June 2021, in Gwa town (Gwa township, Thandwe District, Rakhine State), a fire broke out at a village tract administration office. A few wooden planks were damaged as villagers managed to put out the fire quickly. The village tract clerk stated that the fire was a deliberate arson attack as the office was doused in gasoline.

On 22 June 2021, in Chanmyathazi township (Mandalay District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military conducted security measures in Htun Tone, Mya Yi Nan Dar, Aung Pin Lel and Aung Thayar wards after the fighting between the Myanmar military and Mandalay PDF on the same day. Villagers made a random draw to decide who would join the military. People who were selected through random draw but refused to join the military were ordered to pay 250,000 Myanmar kyats.

Security measures: Around 22 June 2021 (as reported), in San Ka Lay village (Aunglan Township, Thayet District, Magway Region), about 10 Myanmar military troops entered the village with 10 military trucks and searched houses. All villagers fled. Location coded as San Ka Lay Ywar Ma.

Security measures: On 22 June 2021, in Seik Mu (Hpakant Township, Mohnyin District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military searched houses following the clashes between the Myanmar military and KIA in Hpakant township on 21 June. The military also one-sidedly fired gunshots.
Security measures: On 22 June 2021, in Daing Nat village (Tabayin township, Shwebo District, Sagaing region), the Myanmar military entered the village and searched houses.

Security measures: On 22 June 2021, in Hpakant town (Hpakant Township, Mohnyin District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military searched houses following the clashes between the Myanmar military and KIA in Hpakant township on 21 June. The military also one-sidedly fired gunshots.

On 22 June 2021, in Pyin Oo Lwin town (Pyinoolwin Township, Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay Region), a former colonel was arrested at his home by Myanmar military forces. Residents claimed that he had been charged under section 505 (a) of the Penal Code but this has yet been confirmed. The former major had been posting on Facebook criticizing the military coup.

Property destruction: On 23 June 2021, in Bant Bway village (Yinmarbin Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided the house of a Mandalay protest leader and destroyed 16 houses. No reports of casualties.

Movement of forces: On 23 June 2021, near Hta Yaw Kyin village (Yinmarbin Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military reinforced about 100 to 200 troops. The military searched houses and forests near villages located on the Monywa-Kalaywa highways.

SOURCE: Irrawaddy; Eleven Media Group; Myanmar Now
NOTES: On 23 June 2021, in Takaung town (Thabeikkyin Township, Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military claimed to have arrested four members of Mandalay PDF. However, the Myanmar PDF denied that the Myanmar military's claim and said that the people arrested could be from another armed group.

SOURCE: Eleven Media Group; Myanmar Now; Irrawaddy
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On 23 June 2021, near War Yon Kone village (Thabeikkyin Township, Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military claimed to have seized 114 guns and nearly 2,000 bombs and hand grenades from Mandalay PDF after detaining four people from an unknown armed group which Myanmar military claimed as members of Mandalay PDF. The Myanmar military said that the Mandalay PDF took those guns and grenades from KIA. However, the Mandalay PDF denied the allegation and said that those seized weapons didn't belong to them. Likewise, the KIA also denied and said that they didn't supply weapons to the Mandalay PDF.

On 23 June 2021, in Pu Tee Kone village (Thegon township, Pyay district, Bago-west), three youths were arrested at around 10pm by security forces (coded as military and police), allegedly for sharing a social media post about the local people's defense force group.

On 23 June 2021, in Kyaung Kone village (Pwintbyu township, Minbu district, Magway region), a young man was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) following a tip-off by the military-appointed administrator that he was allegedly making weapons.

On 27 June 2021, in Sin Za Loke village in Daik-U township (Bago District, Bago-East Region), Myanmar military forces raided the houses and fired nine shots at the houses of NLD members. Military forces also searched the houses and arrested 6 villagers.
On 27 June 2021, in Htauk Kyant village, in Kale township (Kale District, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military forces arrested a woman and her 12-year old daughter.

Around 27 June 2021 (between 26 - 28 June), in Myawaddy town (Myawaddy Township, Myawaddy District, Kayin State), the security forces (assumed to be the Myanmar military and police) arrested seven youth found with a 9 mm pistol, bullets, two drones and materials to make explosive devices on 26 and 28 June.

ACTOR1: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
NOTES: Security measures: On 27 June 2021, at the Myanmar military base near Mahamuni Pagoda compound near Kyauktaw township (Mrauk-U District, Rakhine State), Arakan Army raided a temporary police outpost and disarmed more than 20 police officers and took some weapons. It was reported that the Arakan Army has repeatedly warned the military not to occupy the pagoda. Residents stated that there were no firefight and the Arakan Army that both sides have resolved the issue through negotiations.

SOURCE: Kachin News Group; Radio Free Asia; Eleven Media Group; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 28 June 2021, in Nawngmun town (Nawngmun Township, Puta-O District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military and police arrested three Christian pastors who led a prayer event for peace in Myanmar. Security forces also raided the neighbourhood in search of a member of PDF. As they didn't find the person they were searching for, they arrested all family members - 7 in total - including a 1-year-old child. Five out of seven family members were released at night. Three Christian pastors were also released on 18 October after the amnesty announced by coup leader Min Aung Hlaing on 18 October.

On 28 June 2021, in Taungoo town, Taungoo township (Taungoo district, Bago region), more than 50 military and police personnel raided a Catholic church and arrested five people, including two religious leaders and three members of the church. Security forces accused the detainees of using explosives after they found shells and gunpowder used in ammunition. They were later released on 29 June 2021.
On 28 June 2021, in Myoma ward in Puta-O town (Puta-O Township, Puta-O District, Kachin State), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested one villager.
On 28 June 2021, in Pa Mon Chaung village near Weibula town (Falam Township, Falam District, Chin State), Myanmar military forces establish a base in the village school.
On 28 June 2021, in Lochum village (Falam Township, Falam District, Chin State), the Myanmar military established a base camp in the village.

Property destruction: On 28 June 2021, in Par Mun Chaung and Lochum villages (Falam Township, Falam District, Chin State), the Lochum and Par Mun Chaung-based Myanmar military looted villager's animals and destroyed houses.
On 28 June 2021, in Par Mun Chaung village (Falam Township, Falam District, Chin State), the Myanmar military established a base camp in the village.

ACTOR1: SSPP/SSA-N: Shan State Progress Party/Shan State Army-North
NOTES: Recruitment: Around 28 June 2021 (as reported), in Muse township (Muse District, Shan-North), the SSPP met with town elders from Muse town and reportedly also from other towns, demanding town elders to send them about 5-2 youth per town to join the SSPP.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: KBC: Kachin Baptist Convention; Baptist Christian Group (Myanmar); Kachin Ethnic Group (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 28 June 2021, coded as Myitkyina, Kachin state, three pastors from KBC were arrested by Myanmar military forces after the Rawang Literature and Culture Committee (RLCC) accused KBC on spreading fake news and filed a complaint against them for leading a prayer service for peace in Myanmar back in March. RLCC is reported by local media sources as closely affiliated with the military. The three pastors was charged for incitement under the Penal Code which criminalizes causing fear, spreading false news and agitating for criminal offenses against government employees.

On 29 June 2021, in Nattalin township (Thayarwady district, Bago-west), police forces arrested a charitable organization worker (also a member of the Red Cross) after returning from sending back a patient to the hospital in Pyay.

On 29 June 2021, in Za Yat Kwin village (Thabeikkyin township, Pyin Oo Lwin district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) raided the village and arrested six villagers. Security forces also took away a truck and 3 million kyats.

Change to armed group: On 29 June 2021, in Kyaiklat township (Pyapon District, Ayeyarwady Region), locals established Kyaiklat People's Defense Force and vowed to protect civilians from the Myanmar military brutality.

On 29 June 2021, in Taungtha township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), an NLD member was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police forces) following the killing of a government employee from the township general administration department office earlier that day.

Around 29 June 2021 (as reported), in Taikkyi town (Taikkyi Township, Yangon-north District, Yangon Region), the Myanmar military arrested three children as hostages, a 14-year-old girl, an 11-year-old and 9-year-old boys, after the Myanmar military didn't find their father for arrest. Later, two of three children were released and an 11-year-old boy was still detained.

SOURCE: Shan Herald Agency for News; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: Displacement: On 30 June 2021, near Loi Hun village located between Kyethi and Mongnawng town (Kyethi Township, Loilen District, Shan-South), the clash between the SSPP and RCSS over territorial dispute displaced about 100-700 villagers.

On 30 June 2021, in Mingyo Sanpya village (Ngazun Township, Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) raided the village in an attempt to arrest the NLD chairperson and former administrator. Security forces arrested the brother-in-law of the NLD chairperson instead when they could not find both of the targets. The husband of the former administrator was reportedly questioned at gunpoint.

On 30 June 2021, in Myingyan town, Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay Region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested at least 13 people in the town, including six people in ward 4, four people in ward 18 and at least three people in Ward 6. The reason for the arrests was not reported.

SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 1 July 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay township, Pyay district, Bago region), an assistant surgeon who was participating in the civil disobedience movement was arrested by junta forces (coded as military and police).

SOURCE: Shwe Phee Myay News Agency; Shan Herald Agency for News
NOTES: Displacement: On 1 July 2021, around Tawt Sang Ywar Ma (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), about 350-800 villagers from Tawt Sang, Kalaw Waing, Sar Hti Taung and Nyaung Maung villages fled towards Man Pint village due to the fighting between the RCSS and the combined forces of TNLA and SSPP.

On 1 July 2021, in Saw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), a man who was carrying medicine meant for IDPs in Kanpetlet was arrested by junta forces (coded as military and police). Security forces have been cracking down at checkpoints in Saw township in an attempt to cut off food and medical assistance for IDPs.

Around 1 July 2021 (between 29 June - 2 July), in Kyaiklat town (Kyaiklat township, Pyapon district, Ayeyarwady region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrested more than 100 people after four bombs exploded around the town on the night of 29 June.

On 1 July 2021, in Pa Lin Pyar Gyi village (Myothit township, Magway district, Magway region), military forces stormed the village and arrested three villagers. They also reportedly threatened and forced villagers to remove the PSI satellite dishes from their homes. About 10 satellite dishes were confiscated by military forces.

On 1 July 2021, in Pa Dan village (Ngape township, Minbu district, Magway region), about 30 military soldiers and police officers arrived at the village to arrest a car mechanic. After security forces failed to find the mechanic, they instead searched around his house and arrested the mechanic's son and three other workers who were working at his garage. Security forces reportedly found four bullets and a knife during the search.

Property destruction: On 1 July 2021, in Hpet Khat village (Mingin Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), about 20 Myanmar military soldiers along with about 80 people in civilian uniform holding hunting rifles raided houses in the village. They destroyed doors and destroyed furniture in houses.
Change to armed group: On 1 July 2021, in Hseni township (Lashio District, Shan-North State), the People's Defense Force - Hseni was formed.

SOURCE: Radio Free Asia; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency
NOTES: Property destruction: On 1 July 2021, in Kone Thar village (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), several houses were found and 3 houses burned down after the clashes between the RCSS and the combined forces of TNLA and SSPP. In addition to the destruction of houses, school textbooks were also burned down and locals belongings were also looted.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Labour News; Eleven Media Group
NOTES: Security measures: On 2 July 2021, nine townships - including Thayawaddy and Minhla (Bago region), and Chanmyathazi, Chanayethazan, Pyigyitagon, Mahaaungmyay, Aungmyaythazan, Patheingyi, Amarapura (Mandalay region) - have been placed under stay-at-home orders by the Ministry of Health under the SAC as part of coronavirus restriction measures. In addition, Homalin township (Sagaing region), Pyin Oo Lwin township (Mandalay region), Nawnghkio township (Shan state) were also placed under stay-at-home orders on 3 July. Location coded as Nay Pyi Taw.

Looting: On 2 July 2021, in Kyun Hpyar village in Kani Township (Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military searched houses and looted some valuable properties, including gold. They also searched houses in nearby villages. The raiding of villages happened after the fighting between the military and local resistance forces occurred yesterday in Kani township.

Movement of forces: On 2 July 2021, in Dawthponeyan sub-township (Momauk Township, Bhamo District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military increased troop deployment around Dawthponeyan, Kaya Bum and nearby villages.
On 2 July 2021, in Shan Inn village, Kalewa township (Kale District, Chin State), a female nurse participating in Civil Disobedience Movement was arrested by Myanmar military forces.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Security measures: On 2 July 2021, in Ann township (Kyuakpyu district, Rakhine state), night curfew was extended for another two months.
Security measures: On 2 July 2021, in Tabayin Township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided villages such as Sat Pyar Kyin, Boke and Ohn Bin.

Security measures: On 2 July 2021, in Tan Ja village, Puta-O township (Puta-O district, Kachin state), Myanmar military forces conducted inspection in the village and seized five hunting guns and small amount of cash (50,000 kyats) from the villagers.

On 2 July 2021, in Paungde town (Pyay district, Bago-West region), more than 20 youths were arrested on suspicion of links with PDF after the explosion on 1 July 2021 and after one military informant was killed by PDF. All of those who were arrested were detained in the police station.

Displacement: On 2 July 2021, in Kani Township (Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), about 30,000 villagers from more than 30 villages fled due to the Myanmar military discriminately firing gunshots in villages.

Property destruction: Around 3 July 2021 (between 1 - 4 July), in Kani township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military forces raided the villages, took away gold, cash, motorbikes and destroyed homes in villages.

On 3 July 2021, in North Okkalapa township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), armed men in plainclothes believed to be working for the military regime arrested a youth. One of the armed man was known as a military informant in the community.

Property destruction: On 3 July 2021, in Kale town (Kale district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces opened fire against civilians' houses after two explosion took place near township police station and district police station earlier. Some houses were destroyed. One man died of a heart attack during the raid.

ACTOR1: SSYG-PDF: South Shan Youths Group/People's Defense Force
NOTES: Change to armed group: On 3 July 2021, the SSYG-PDF was formed by the 8 Southern Shan PDF groups based in southern Shan state, although the list of groups was not reported. On 16 July, the SSYG-PDF announced that all agreements made between 8 Southern Shan PDF were abolished. Location coded as Taunggyi.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: Around 3 July 2021 (week of), in Gon Tan village (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldier and the military-appointed village administrator set fire on a house.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: Around 3 July 2021 (week of), in Tet Tu village (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldier and the military-appointed village administrator set fire on a house.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: Around 3 July 2021 (week of), in Kan Thar village (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldier and the military-appointed village administrator set fire on a house.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Property destruction: Around 3 July 2021 (week of), in Pa Laing village (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldier and the military-appointed village administrator set fire on a house.

ACTOR1: SHYG-PDF: South Shan Youths Groups PDF
NOTES: Change to armed group: On 4 July 2021, local PDFs Youth Voices Taunggyi, Tai PDF, Namsang PDF, Loilem PDF, Pinglong PDF, Laikha PDF and Kholan PDF cooperate to form South Shan Youth Groups PDF. Location coded as Taunggyi district, Shan-South state.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Journalists (Myanmar)
SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 4 July 2021, in Paungde town (Paungde township, Pyay District, Bago-West Region), a Middle Voice reporter and his father (an NLD member) were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) in connection to the murder of a military informant in the town.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Students (Myanmar); ABFSU: All Burma Federation of Student Unions
NOTES: On 4 July 2021, in Mandalay city (Myanmar Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested four students who led ABFSU's anti-coup protest at their houses.
On 4 July 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay District, Bago-West Region), three women who took part in a video mocking the chairman of the military regime Min Aung Hlaing were arrested by Myanmar police force.

On 4 July 2021, Ma Gyi Kone village, Pwintbyu township (Minbu district, Magway region), a villager was arrested by Myanmar military forces, after a military informant reported to the military claiming that the villager had weapons.

On 4 July 2021, in Insein township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), Myanmar military forces arrested some youths from Aung Zeya Housing complex after a hand grenade was thrown into the military vehicle. The hand grenade did not explode.
On 5 July 2021, in Kyi village, Tabayin township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces' 44 LID establish a base.

Movement of forces: On 5 July 2021, at Nyaung Kone village (Kawlin Township, Kawlin District, Sagaing Region), about 150 to 200 Myanmar military soldiers advanced from Monywa entered the Nyaung Kone village at night.

Security measures: On 5 July 2021, in Long Sha Yang village, Puta-O township (Puta-O district, Kachin state), more than 30 military troops conducted door-to-door inspections in the village. They seized two hunting guns and small amount of cash (30,000 kyats) from the villagers.

Looting: On 5 July 2021, in the villages in Pauk township (Pakokku district, Magway region), Myanmar military forces took away the food and rations from villagers during the clash with PDF Pauk township.

SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Myanmar Now; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 6 July 2021, in Hlegu township (Yangon-North District, Yangon Region), at least 10 people were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police), including the father of the Hlegu township student union member, and the father and brother of an NLD parliamentarian for Region 2 constituency after security forces failed to locate the targets. At night, a monk from Kya In Myaing Monastery in Kya In village tract was also arrested, while an unidentified woman was arrested in front of Maxi gas station. The crackdown came after three people accused of being military informant were shot and wounded in the township between 3-5 July.

Security measures: On 6 July 2021, in Nyaung Kone village (Kawlin Township, Kawlin District, Sagaing Region), military soldiers raided the village. Some 150-200 military troops were deployed in villages in Kawlin township on the same day. The raid followed a shootout between military forces and PDF members earlier on 4 July.

Looting: On 6 July 2021, in Saw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), military soldiers took away more than 20 motorcycles belonging to IDPs at an IDP camp. Some of the motorcycles were set on fire on the streets by soldiers.
On 6 July 2021, in Kawlin town (Kawlin Township, Kawlin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military occupied a school as their base camp.
Around 6 July 2021 (as reported), in Nammatee town (Mogaung township, Mohnyin district, Kachin State), the Myanmar military occupied a high school as their base camp.

Displacement: On 6 July 2021, around Hpawng Hseng village (Muse Township, Muse District, Shan-North), about 300 villagers fled due to the ongoing fighting between the Myanmar military and MNDAA around the Hpawng Hseng village. location coded as Hpawng Hseng Ywar Ma.

Defusal: On 6 July 2021, in Wakema township (Myaungmya District, Ayeyarwady Region), an unexploded bomb set up by an unknown armed group at a police checkpoint on Shwe Laung bridge was found. Afterwards, the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) safely removed the bomb.

On 6 July 2021, reportedly in Yangon city (Yangon region), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a female Chin ethnic singer who also contested for singing at the 2009 Melody World.
Security measures: On 6 July 2021, around Koke Ko Kone village (Kawlin Township, Kawlin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military advanced towards Koke Ko Kone and searched villages.

On 6 July 2021, in Ohn Pin Chan village (Sintgaing Township, Kyaukse District, Mandalay Region), military troops raided the village and arrested seven people at a teashop, including a teashop owner, his wife, his brother-in-law, three of his employees and his 12-year-old son. The raid came after a shootout between military soldiers and the Sintgaing PDF earlier in the morning.

Defusal: On 6 July 2021, in Muse town (Muse Township, Muse District, Shan-North), an unexploded bomb was found under an electricity billing counter at Junction River Trading company. The Myanmar military and police defused the bomb.

Looting: On 6 July 2021, in Kani Township (Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided villages. They set fire to houses and looted money, animals, 30 motorcycles and other items from villages.

On 6 July 2021, in Thibawseit, Pyin Gyi village (Launglon township, Dawei district, Tanintharyi region) (coded as Launglon), the military forces arrested the 13-year-old son and 68-year-old mother of an anti-coup protester after they failed to find the targeted protester at home.
Movement of forces: On 7 July 2021, in Kawlin town (Kawlin Township, Kawlin District, Sagaing Region), military soldiers were deployed at a school.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
