NOTES: Security measures: On 7 July 2021, the Ministry of Health and Sports under the State Administration Council declared 14 townships to be placed under stay-at-home-orders, including 10 townships in Yangon regions, as coronavirus cases reached the highest they have been in months. The townships include: Mingaladon, Hmawbi, Hlaingtharyar, Shwepyithar, Insein, Mayangone, South Okkalapa, North Okkalapa, Mingalar Taung Nyunt, Bahan (Yangon region), and Mawlamyine, Thanbyuzayat, Thaton (Mon state), and Gangaw (Magway region). Location coded as Nay Pyi Taw.

ACTOR1: SSLP/SSFF: Shan State Liberation Party/Shan State Front for Federal
NOTES: Change to armed group: On 7 July 2021, the Shan State Liberation Party was formed as a political leading party while the Shan State Federal Front was formed to implement the political goals and policies of the Shan State Liberation Party. Location changed in Shan state (coded as Taunggyi).

On 7 July 2021, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested 10 men with two plastic grenades and 9mm bullets. The military regime accused one of former NLD Upper House lawmakers of supporting those ten men.

Movement of forces: Around 7 July 2021 (between 5 - 8 July), in Hpapun township (Hpapun District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military soldiers from battalions 92, 264 and 349, consisting of 250 soldiers and 248 pack horses were reinforced. About six military trucks also picked up troops at Tha Bo camp, and battalion 598 also replaced battalion 92 at Kler Soe camp.

ACTOR1: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
NOTES: Other: Around 8 July 2021 (as reported), in eastern Buthidaung township (Maungdaw district, Rakhine state), the AA installed village administration committees in most village tracts in the area. The AA claimed that it governs the regions and villagers should report any matters of concern to the group. Following this, on 1 August 2021, the AA issued a public statement claiming that it holds governing power in Rakhine and that all residents should report all legal issues to its political wing.

Change to armed group: On 8 July 2021, Tamwe township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), the People's Defense Force - Tamwe was formed to fight against the military regime and protect the lives of civilians who are participating in the civil disobedience movement.

Change to armed group: On 8 July 2021, in Myeik township (Myeik District, Tanintharyi Region), the People's Defense Force - Myeik officially announced its formation. The group claimed that they had been formed for quite some time prior to the formal announcement.

On 9 July 2021, in Mayin Than Phyu Chaung village, Gyobingauk Township (Thayarwady District, Bago-West Region), a political activist was arrested at his home in the morning (assumed to be by military and police forces). The activist had been active in the anti-coup protests.

Displacement: On 9 July 2021, in Mongkaing township (Loilen district, Shan-South), more than 400 people fled to two monasteries in Maing Khun village tract after fighting between the RCSS and SSPP broke out.

Displacement: Around 9 July 2021 (from 6 - 12 July), near Loi Hun village located between Kyethi and Mongnawng town (Kyethi Township, Loilen District, Shan-South), about 700 additional villagers from the Loi Hun village area fled to Mongkaing town due to the fighting between SSPP and RCSS.

On 10 July 2021, in Kywe Chan village (Myingyan Township, Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a villager for allegedly receiving and hosting protesters. He died in prison on 9 August. The prison insisted that he died of high blood pressure. His body was given to his family but the authorities didn't allow family members to see his face.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Government of Myanmar (2016-); NLD: National League for Democracy
NOTES: On 10 July 2021, on Pinlon road in Pinlel Film Production Studio, in Dagon Myothit (North) township (Dagon Myothit-North, Yangon-East district, Yangon region), 6 civilians, including a former member of parliament from NLD party, were arrested by the Myanmar military. According to the military's press release, the former parliamentarian was found with one pistol and 25 bullets, while the other were found with 2 guns and other weapons.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Former Government of Myanmar (2016-)
NOTES: On 10 July 2021, in Hlaing township (Yangon-West District, Yangon Region), following the military detention of an NLD youth who was also allegedly connected with People's Defense Force members from Hlaing Township, the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a total of seven people from Hlaing township, including an NLD former lawmaker and his wife. The military claimed that an NLD former lawmaker was arrested with a 9mm pistol, 25 bullets and a fake ID card.

On 10 July 2021, in Pi Tauk Pin village (Kanbalu township, Kanbalu district, Sagaing region, the military forces arrested five women for unknown reasons. The villagers were arrested in relation to the killing of a ward administrator the day before. There were some disputes between the deceased administrator and some villagers over opening schools amidst the COVID-19 pandemic.

On 10 July 2021, in Maubin township (Maubin district, Ayeyarwady region), the military forces arrested a local journalist of Ayeyarwady Times for unknown reasons. He had just been released recently on June 30.

Recruitment: On 10 July 2021, in Wakema township (Myaungmya district, Ayeyarwady region), the military forces ordered village administrators to provide minimum 20 locals per village to form militias to protect against PDFs. Locals said the security forces were forming militias with ten people per ward including youths and auxiliary firefighters in every township of Ayeyarwady region, based in ward administration offices.

On 10 July 2021, in Kyaung Kone Gyi village of Pwintbyu township (Kyaung Kone village, Minbu district, Magway region), about 50 military and police forces searched for and arrested a couple based on information provided by military informants.

Looting: On 10 July 2021, near Taung Hpyu village in Mingin township (Kale district, Sagaing region), the military forces and others in civilian clothes fired warning shots and forced a boat in transit to dock. They took the belongings from the boat. The military forces and the members of Pyu Saw Htee stationed in Pan Set village are looting money and valuable things from boat owners.

Change to armed group: On 10 July 2021, a leader of the Anti-Fascist Armed Force confirmed that they have formed an alliance with 14 People's Defence Forces and will operate under the name Yangon Urban Guerrillas. Location coded as Yangon region.

On 10 July 2021, on Anawmar 13th Street (West), in Thaketa township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), one pistol, one bullet case, 55 bullets, 6 grenades and other explosives were seized when the military arrested a man at his house, according to military's press release.

On 10 July 2021, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), Myanmar military forces arrested one civilian whom the military believed to be associated with People Defense's Force and NLD party, according to military's press release. 6 other civilians were also arrested. The military said in a press release that they were found with 10 hand grenades.

On 10 July 2021, in Thin Gan Kyun Gyi village, Mingaladon township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), Myanmar military forces arrested one civilian (an NLD youth member). The military claimed that he was associated with the People's Defense Force, according to military's press release.

On 10 July 2021, in Mindat township (Mindat, Chin state), a ceasefire agreement was extended for ten days between Chinland Defense Force (CDF) and the military which expired on July 4. Locals say the junta continues to impose restrictions on the transportation of basic necessities.

Looting: Around 11 July 2021 (from 9 - 13 July), in Hnan Khar village, Gangaw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), around 80 Myanmar military forces based in the village, killed 2 cows, 200 chickens, took away the villagers' cash and clothes. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Security measures: On 11 July 2021, in Nay Pyi Taw city (Nay Pyi Taw region), the SAC's ministry of health announced stay-at-home orders in 12 townships in Yangon region and 18 townships in Bago region which will be enforced from 4am, July 12 and those who break the order will be taken action against in accordance with existing laws. The townships include Daik-U, Dagon, Dagon Myothit (North), Hlaing, Kawa, Kayan, Kyauktaga, Kamayut, Kyeemyindine, Oktwin, Okpho, Sanchaung, Tamwe, Thingangyun, Thaketa, Taikkyi, Waw, and Yankin.

Defusal: On 11 July 2021, in Thanlyin township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), the military forces defused an unexploded bomb believed to be thrown at the electrical department on Bogyoke Nay Win road of Aung Mingala ward.

SOURCE: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 11 July 2021, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), Myanmar military forces arrested a former journalist from Golden Triangle News and his wife.

ACTOR1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
SOURCE: Kachinland News; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency
NOTES: Around 11 July 2021 (as reported), near Pang Wan village of Mongkaing township (Loilen district, Shan-South state), the TNLA set up three military bases. The movement of about 400 TNLA troops forced villagers to flee.

On 12 July 2021, in Yaylae village, Nyaunglebin Township (coded as Nyaunglebin) (Bago District, Bago-East), the Myanmar military arrested a member of the Kayin Aid/Social Organization on suspicion of helping PDF get materials for making explosive devices.

On 12 July 2021, in Pyay township (Bago-West district, Bago region), the military forces (2 military men and 4 in civilian clothes) arrested a man at his Alinka store at Khittayar express gate for unknown reasons. The military forces came back and searched his place again in the evening.

Security measures: On 12 July 2021, in Kauk Yoe Pon village (Madaya Township, Pyinoolwin District, Mandalay Region), about 15 Myanmar military troops entered the villages and searched houses and monasteries.
Displacement: On 12 July 2021, in Loikaw township (Loikaw District, Kayah State), the fighting between the Myanmar military and KNPP forced to fled about 8,000 villagers to a forest.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Teachers (Myanmar); Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: On 12 July 2021, in Thayame village, Myeik township (Myeik district, Tanintharyi region), Myanmar military forces arrested 3 teachers who participated in civil disobedience movement and the village administrator.

On 12 July 2021, while returning from their fields near Kyun Pin Thar village (Tamu township, Tamu district, Sagaing region), the military forces arrested four young people with ages in their twenties for using India SIM cards. The military forces also claimed they found bombs in the hands of the young people. Tamu-based CSOs denied any connection between these young people and any armed actors and stated that the military was making false accusations.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Teachers (Myanmar); Women (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 12 July 2021, in Taw Ra Me village (Myeik Township, Myeik District, Tanintharyi Region), the security forces in civilian uniform (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a ward level NLD Vice Chairman and three female teachers who joined the civil disobedience movement in protest against the military regime.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Women (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 12 July 2021, in Ayetharyar town (Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan-South), the Myanmar military and police arrested a member of the National League for Democracy over her Facebook post. A lawsuit was filed against her under penal code 905.

Change to armed group: Around 12 July 2021 (as reported), in Nay Pyi Taw city (Nay Pyi Taw region), the SAC's spokesperson stated that they have formed unarmed security support groups in wards and villages to give early warning, preparation and cooperation against violent acts. Some locals and witnesses said these groups were led by the SAC appointed ward administrators and they were armed.
On 12 July 2021, in Thaketa township (Yangon-east District, Yangon Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a civilian.
Displacement: On 13 July 2021, in the Mong Hkun area in Mongkaing township (Loilen District, Shan-South), the clash between RCSS and SSPP forced 2,500 to flee to Mongkaing town.
Movement of forces: On 13 July 2021, in Hseng Hpa Yar village, Hpakant township (Mohnyin district, Kachin state), Myanmar military forces established a base in the village.

On 13 July 2021, in Ma Gyi Su village (Myingyan Township, Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), about 80 Myanmar military soldiers and police entered the village and searched houses a few days after an unknown assailant killed a villager. The military and police arrested five villagers, including one woman. It is believed that they were arrested for being relatives of suspected PDF members.

On 13 July 2021, in Wuntho town (Kawlin district, Sagaing), a microfilm director was arrested by Myanmar military forces and brought to the interrogation center. The director was infected with COVID-19 at the time of his arrest.

Around 14 July 2021 (as reported), in Hpakant township (Mohnyin district, Kachin state), SAC troops occupied Kachin Baptist Church's prayer hill at Hkum Tsai Zup and about 40 SAC soldiers occupied Seng Hpra Kachin Baptist Church's prayer mountain.
On 14 July 2021, in Kyaung street in Ngathaingchaung town , Yegyi township (Pathein district, Ayeyarwady region), Myanmar military forces arrested two youths for reasons unknown.

On 15 July 2021, in Hkamti town (Hkamti Township, Hkamti District, Sagaing Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested the chairman of the Tai-Leng Nationalities Development Party (TNDP) at night.

Displacement: On 15 July 2021, in Hpakant township (Mohnyin District, Kachin State), more than 200 villagers from four villages such as Hkum Tsai Zup, Gawlu Yang Mare, Gat Noi and Ta Dar Nyi Nawng fled due to the fighting between the Myanmar military and KIA.

Property destruction: On 15 July 2021, near Ku Seik village (Hpapun Township, Hpapun District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military entered the village and destroyed five houses with fire. The incident happened after a clash between the Myanmar military and KNU near the village on the same day.

Displacement: On 15 July 2021, in Kale township (Kale District, Sagaing Region), the fighting between the Myanmar military and Kalay PDF displaced more than 3,000 civilians. Location coded as Tin Thar village.

Around 15 July 2021 (month of), near Taunggyi and Ayetharyar (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), Myanmar military forces arrested around 20 youths on suspicion of links with the People Defense Force. No weapons were found at the time of the arrest.

On 16 July 2021, in Ngathaingchaung town (Yegyi township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady region), about 20 military forces arrested four men including a Myo Thit ward NLD member for unknown reason. No further report on three other arrestees nor where they were taken.
On 16 July 2021, in Auk Yae Hpyu village (Launglon Township, Dawei District, Tanintharyi Region), the Myanmar military arrested a 50-year-old father of a protest leader as a hostage.

On 17 July 2021, in Pwintbyu township (Minbu district, Magway region), the military forces arrested four locals on suspicion of having weapons based on information provided by military informants. Three men were from Pay Taw, Kywe Di village and Tha Min Chan villages. A pregnant woman from Kan Pyae village was arrested instead of her husband who was not home at the time of arrest.

On 17 July 2021, in Sein Pan Ward area of Mahaaungmyay township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), the military forces arrested a NLD member from Myauk Ngan Pyar Ye area. Separately, later at night, the military forces arrested a father of a wanted person from Tha Byue area as the target was not there at the time of arrest.
Displacement: On 17 July 2021, in Kyethi Township (Loilen District, Shan-South), more than 200 IDP returnees fled their village again after they heard the sound of artillery shell explosions.

SOURCE: Shan Herald Agency for News; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency
NOTES: On 17 July 2021, in Lashio town (Lashio district, Shan-North state), military forces arrested four youths on suspicion of being PDFs and for investigation in relation to the explosion at the office of the military-linked company MyTel.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Teachers (Myanmar)
NOTES: On 18 July 2021, in Kan Thar village, Shwebo township (coded as Shwebo) (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces destroyed a house of a former NLD member and burned down a house of a teacher. Three villagers were reportedly arrested.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Teachers (Myanmar)
NOTES: Property destruction: On 18 July 2021, in Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces burned a house of an NLD supporter in Pa Laing village.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Security measures: On 18 July 2021, in Pyay township (Pyay district, Bago-West region), the ward administration officers announced that nobody could go outside after 12 pm except for health reasons, without further explanation on why or for how long.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Security measures: On 18 July 2021, in Magway township (Magway district, Magway region), the junta read announcements with loudspeakers and instructed locals not to leave houses after 9 in the morning and buses not to pass through Magway. Locals were not clear if the measures were COVID-19 related.

On 18 July 2021, in Kan Pyar (East) village of Magway township (Magway district, Magway region), the military arrested a teacher from Bagan Hmyaw village who joined the civil disobedience movement (CDM). No further report on where he was detained.

On 18 July 2021, in Kyaung Taw Yar (1) village of Pwintbyu township (Minbu district, Magway region), the military forces arrested a man from Kyaung Taw Yar village on suspicion of having weapons following information provided by military informants.
On 18 July 2021, in Man Tawng village, Muse township (Muse district, Shan-North state), about 100 soldiers from Myanmar military's 99th LID arrived and quartered at the village's monastery.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Security measures: On 18 July 2021, in Myawaddy township (Myawaddy district, Kayin state), the military controlled administration in Myawaddy ordered residents to stay at home except for 3 hours per day from 6 am to 9 am when they can shop for groceries with a permit card issued by the ward administration office.

On 18 July 2021, in Bago town (Bago district, Bago-East region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested two relatives, mother-in-law and nephew, as a hostage for a bomb explosion suspect. After the suspect was arrested, two relatives were released on 19 July.

Around 18 July 2021 (between 17 - 18 July), in Taunggyi township (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), military soldiers entered residential wards and arrested four women and two men between 11 pm and 4 am. About 30 soldiers and police arrested a couple from their house in Yatanar Thiri ward and about 20 soldiers raided into a house and arrested a couple from Chan Mya Tharsi Ward. Two other women were taken separately for unknown reasons.

Displacement: On 18 July 2021, in Pa Laing village, Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces opened fire against the villagers indiscriminately. Afterwards, more than 5,000 villagers fled the village.

SOURCE: Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 19 July 2021, in Pyin Oo Lwin town (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), military forces arrested the chairman of the Mandalay branch of Takhon Farmer Federation for Burma (also a former independent candidate and brother of an NLD MP) at his house for investigation. The military forces also took his car and money and arrested a young neighbor who were there at the time of arrest.

SOURCE: Irrawaddy; Democratic Voice of Burma; Eleven Media Group
NOTES: On 19 July 2021, in Dagon Myothit (North) township (Dagon Myothit-North, Yangon-East district, Yangon region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) tricked and arrested five volunteer doctors. The security forces lured them to a house under false pretence with a fake coronavirus emergency case. Once three doctors arrived at a house they were directed and the security forces arrested them. Afterwards, the security forces raided their office and arrested two more doctors. Total five doctors were arrested.
Change to armed group: On 19 July 2021, in Taungdwingyi township (Magway District, Magway Region), local activists established the Beikthano area People's Defense Force.

Property destruction: On 19 July 2021, in Ward 7 in Yesagyo town, Yesagyo township (Pakokku district, Magway region), the military forces entered the house of an education staff who joined the civil disobedience movement. They destroyed the property as he was not home.

On 19 July 2021, in Bago town (Bago district, Bago-East region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a man who was allegedly responsible for the bomb explosion in the town on 16 July. His father-in-law was also arrested on the same day.

Displacement: On 19 July 2021, in Mingin township (Kale District, Sagaing Region), thousands of villagers fled following the Myanmar military indiscriminate shelling and gunfires, and the clash between the military and Mingin PDF.

On 19 July 2021, on Baho road of Hlaing township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), the military forces arrived with 8 military trucks before a protest started and opened fire to disperse the crowd. One was arrested.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia; Myanmar Now
NOTES: On 20 July 2021, in Myittha town (Myittha township, Kyaukse district, Mandalay region), the wife, son and daughter of a regional parliamentarian from NLD party were arrested by Myanmar military forces.

SOURCE: Shwe Phee Myay News Agency; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 20 July 2021, in Kan Gyi ward, in Taunggyi town (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), one female editor-in-chief and 2 female journalists from Thanlwin Thway Chin media were arrested by Myanmar police forces. Police also took their phones, computers and cameras.

Defusal: On 20 July 2021, in Pi Tauk Pin village (Kangyidaunt Township, Pathein District, Ayeyarwady Region), a bomb was found near the Myanmar military supporter's house. Afterwards, the Myanmar military detonated a bomb with gunshots.

On 20 July 2021, in Kone Thar village, Kani township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces' 44 LID arrested villagers. The exact number of those arrested is not reported. More than 600 villagers fled from the village.
On 20 July 2021, in Dawei town (Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), Myanmar military forces in plain clothes arrested a university student specializing in geography.

On 20 July 2021, in Konlaw village, Momauk township (Bhamo district, Kachin state), about 70 soldiers from SAC's 320th LIR based at Myo Tit have arrived and quartered in Kung Law Kachin Baptist Church compound.

On 20 July 2021, in Dagon Myothit (Seikkan) township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), a 23-year-old man from Pyapon township, Ayeyarwady region was arrested with two other men in a garage of Ward 85, allegedly found with a handmade gun and mines according to the state-run media. The 23-year-old man later died around 4 August while detained at the military investigation camp although the cause of his death was not reported.

Looting: Around 20 July 2021 (between 18 - 22 July), in Tha Hpan Kaing in Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), military soldiers entered to the village. They looted and destroyed some villagers' properties.
On 21 July 2021, in Hman Tan village, Myanaung township (Hinthada district, Ayeyarwady region), Myanmar military forces establish a base in the village monastery.

On 21 July 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay district, Bago-West region), a civilian on the motorbike looking for oxygen was arrested by Myanmar military forces. The man was said to be travelling with a permit for medical reasons but was arrested for reasons unknown.

Property destruction: On 21 July 2021, near the 4-mile junction in Katha township (Katha district, Sagaing region), the military forces returned to the town after a clash with the local PDF (coded separately) and questioned pedestrians and destroyed some shops.

On 21 July 2021, in Htaukkyant, Mingaladon township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), Myanmar military forces arrested a volunteer doctor treating coronavirus patients. The military regime has been targeting health workers who are providing support to COVID-19 patients privately.

On 21 July 2021, in the industrial zone in Myingyan town (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the owner of the workshop and 4 staff who were filling oxygen cylinders for coronavirus patients were arrested by Myanmar military forces in plain clothes.

On 22 July 2021, in Hnget Gyi Kwin village of Myanaung township (Hinthada district, Ayeyarwady region), about 60 military troops raided the village and arrested a villager on suspicion of making handmade grenades. The military was stationed in Tha Yet Kone village and was searching nearby villages on a daily basis on suspicion of military training for PDFs taking place there.

Detonation: On 24 July 2021, in Sin Mee Swea town (Thegon township, Pyay district, Bago (West) region), two PDF members were killed from an explosion of an improvised hand grenade while they were testing it. One young man is a student union member of Tharyawady Agricultural College.
On 24 July 2021, in Pyay township (Pyay district, Bago-West region), the Myanmar military arrested two executive members of the Pyay University Student Union.

Change to armed group: On 24 July 2021, in Magway region, 13 local people's defense forces formed an alliance as Magway Division Army (MDA) to fight against the military. Local PDFs from 13 townships are Chauk PDF, Magway PDF, Minbu PDF, Minhla PDF, Myothit PDF, Natmauk PDF, Ngape PDF, Pwintbyu PDF, Salin PDF, Sidoktaya PDF, Singbaungwe PDF, Taungdwingyi PDF and Yenangyaung PDF. Location coded as Magway.

Other: On 24 July 2021, in M'Kuiimnu town (Mindat Township, Mindat District, Chin State), the CDF raided a small police post. There was no exchange of gunfire as six Myanmar military soldiers and police officers, including a military captain agreed with the CDF to join the Civil Disobedience Movement against the Myanmar military coup.

Weapons seizure: On 24 July 2021, in M'Kuiimnu town (Mindat Township, Mindat District, Chin State), the CDF raided a small police post. There was no exchange of gunfire as six Myanmar military soldiers and police officers, including a military captain agreed with the CDF to join the Civil Disobedience Movement against the Myanmar military coup. The CDF seized 22 guns including rifles and pistols, as well as rounds of ammunition.

Property destruction: On 25 July 2021, in No.4 Pyidawthar street of Shwebo town (Shwebo township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the house of a member of Pyu Saw Htee was set on fire. The firefighter was able to stop the fire one hour later.

Displacement: On 25 July 2021, in Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region, the fighting between the Myanmar military and an unidentified PDF group displaced thousands of villagers from Zee Pin, Aung Min Ga lar, Chaung Ma, Lin Pone and Moe Kawng villages (in Yinmarbin township and Kani Township). Location coded as Yinmarbin district.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Security measures: Around 25 July 2021 (as reported), in Mandalay district (Mandalay region), the military administration enacted new coronavirus restrictions and restricted movements in seven stay-at-home townships; Chanmyathazi, Chanayethazan, Pyigyitagon, Mahaaungmyay, Patheingyi and Amarapura. Residents are allowed to go out twice a day; from 6 am to 9 am in the morning and 3 pm to 6 pm in the evening for grocery shopping and health related matters.

On 25 July 2021, in Kyatpyin ward of Mogoke town (Mogoke township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), about 20 military soldiers arrested the Vice Chair of Kha Nan Church and four others including one woman for investigation in relation to burning a military informant's house.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Security measures: On 25 July 2021, the Ministry of Health and Sports enacted new coronavirus restrictions and announced stay-at-home order in total of seven townships in Shan state, Magway region, and Naypyitaw: Nyaungshwe, Taunggyi, Lawksawk, Aunglan, Minbu, Pwintbyu, and Lewe township. Location coded as Nay Pyi Taw.

Security measures: On 25 July 2021, in Let Pan Kyin village (Kyaukpadaung Township, Nyaung-U District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar police and armed men in plainclothes entered the village and threatened villagers not to call them 'dog soldiers'. Some villagers fled. Troops went to the village with more than 10 military trucks one day after an anti-coup protest was held in the village. Location coded as Let Pan Kyin (Middle).

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Other: On 26 July 2021, in Nay Pyi Taw city (Nay Pyi Taw region), the military appointed election commission annulled the 2020 election results, citing electoral fraud and citing that the military-appointed Union Election Commission has found more than 11 million irregularities on the voter lists.

Arrests: On 26 July 2021, near Bant Bway village (Yinmarbin Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), security forces (assumed to be military and police) arrested an ambulance driver from a charitable organization who was driving a pregnant woman to Monywa Hospital. He was arrested at the Bant Bway checkpoint.

On 26 July 2021, in Htan Pin Su village (Taungdwingyi Township, Magway District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military searched houses and arrested two villagers. Later, one of them was released again.

Displacement: On 26 July 2021, in Hu Hsun village (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), more than 80 villagers fled their village due to tension between two ethnic armed groups in the area.

Arrests: On 27 July 2021, in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi Township, Magway District, Magway region), security forces (assumed to be the military and police) took 7 family members of a political activist (including a 7-year-old child) as hostages after they failed to find the targeted activist.

Property destruction: On 27 July 2021, in Tha Pyay Aye village, Yinmarbin township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces destroyed the villagers' houses and took away cash and jewelleries. The net worth of the property was not reported.

ACTOR1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
NOTES: Property destruction: On 27 July 2021, in Chon Thit village (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), the TNLA allegedly torched two houses. However, the TNLA spokesperson denied the allegation.

Security measures: On 28 July 2021, in Koke Ko Gwa village (Taungdwingyi Township, Magway District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military searched houses following a report to the Myanmar military by an informer. Location coded as Koke Ko Gwa (Ah Shey Su).

On 28 July 2021, in Han Thar Taik village (Taungdwingyi Township, Magway District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military searched houses and arrested a man as a hostage as the military could not find his son.

On 28 July 2021, in Taungoo township (Taungoo district, Bago-East Region), the Myanmar military arrested five students volunteers who were doing charity work and transporting oxygen tanks for coronavirus patients. They were arrested on their way to Yangon.
Security measures: On 28 July 2021, in Kawthoung district (Tanintharyi Region), the Sa Lin-based Myanmar military searched houses.
On 28 July 2021, in Myingyan town (Myingyan Township, Myingyan District, Mandalay Region), the Myanmar police arrested a 25-year-old man. The police accused him of being connected to the PDF.

Displacement: On 28 July 2021, in Magyong Kalet village (Kawthoung Township, Kawthoung District, Tanintharyi Region), a few days after locals held a protest against the Myanmar military coup, the Myanmar military entered the village and searched for protest leaders. More than 100 villagers fled.

On 28 July 2021, in Thit Yar Pin village located in Kani-Yinmarbin border (coded as Kani township, Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), Myanmar military forces arrested one villager for unknown reasons.

Property destruction: On 28 July 2021, in Tha Hpan Kaing in Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), military soldiers entered to the village. They looted and destroyed some villagers' properties.

Property destruction: On 29 July 2021, in Tha Hpan Kaing in Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), military soldiers entered the village. They looted and destroyed some villagers' properties.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-)
NOTES: Property destruction: On 29 July 2021, in Zee Pin Twin village (Kani Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), the Aung Min Ga Lar-based Myanmar military set fire and destroyed the house of a NLD-elected Member of Regional Parliament.

On 29 July 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay Region), the Myanmar military raided Myat Taung Monastery and arrested two monks and a civilian. Monks from Myat Taung Monastery have led several protests in Mandalay since the 1 February coup.

On 29 July 2021, in Thar Yar Aye village (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided a monastery and arrested four villagers on suspicion of being PDF members. The raid came one day after the killing of a person believed to be an military informant in the village.

Displacement: On 29 July 2021, in Thar Yar Aye village (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided a monastery in the village. Afterwards, about 3,000 villagers fled from the village. The raid came one day after a man believed to a military informant was killed.

Displacement: On 29 July 2021, in Pan Set village (Mingin Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the fighting between the Myanmar military and Mingin PDF displaced more than 8,000 villagers from more than 20 villages.

On 29 July 2021, in Pathein town (Pathein township, Pathein district, Ayeyarwady region), about 30 military soldiers in civilian clothes surrounded a house and arrested two men, a 29-year-old and under 16-year-old, in relation to an explosion at Thin Baw Gyin police station.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2016-); NLD: National League for Democracy
NOTES: On 30 July 2021, in Dawei township (Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), the military arrested an NLD Lower House parliamentarian from the civilian government while he was at his house.

On 30 July 2021, near Let Pan Chaung village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military arrested two Chin men in relation to weapons seizures at an inspection gate at the entry to Kale town. The military arrested them because they had been travelling previously in a car that was carrying weapons from Mandalay.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NLD: National League for Democracy; Government of Myanmar (2016-)
NOTES: On 30 July 2021, at one of the security gates in Pekon township (Taunggyi District, Shan-South State), the security forces (assumed to be the Myanmar military and police) arrested five parliamentarians of the NLD.
Property destruction: On 31 July 2021, in Wun Chone village (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military burned down 3 houses.

Looting: On 31 July 2021, in Kyauk Kar village (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), military soldiers and members of Pyu Saw Htee entered the village and destroyed houses. They took cars, motorbikes, and goods worth $1500 from a shop. An old woman died after hearing a gun shot.

Looting: On 31 July 2021, in In Taing village on Monywa-Kani road (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), about 100 military soldiers raided the village and took belongings from each house in the village and left the houses destroyed.

On 31 July 2021, in Obo Shwe Kyin ward, Mandalay city (Mandalay region), the Myanmar military arrested the mother of a 2-year-old girl as a hostage. Her spouse was accused of having a connection with PDF.

ACTOR1: Government of Myanmar (2021-) State Administration Council
NOTES: Other: On 1 August 2021, in Nay Pyi Taw city (Nay Pyi Taw), the State Administration Council (SAC) was reorganized as a caretaker government led by a prime minister. The newly self-appointed prime minister, who was the chair of the State Administration Council, stated that his caretaker government will rule until August 2023 as the preparation for a new election will not be ready until then. A ceasefire statement was also issued stating that all military operations would be suspended from August 1 to September 30 to contain coronavirus.

Property destruction: Around 1 August 2021 (between 31 July - 3 August), in Wun Chone village (Pauk township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military and Pyu Saw Htee destroyed more than 30 houses and shops following a clash between local PDFs and Pyu Saw Htee in the morning. Villagers were forced to flee.

On 1 August 2021, in Pyinmana town (Pyimana township, Det Khi Na district, Nay Pyi Taw), the military arrested three young men for participating in a motorbike protest against the military coup in Pyinmana held on July 25. No information reported on where they were taken.

Property destruction: On 2 August 2021, in Tat Kone village (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), the Myanmar military soldiers destroyed some houses and seized some materials. The military took those materials to their base. They used a monk's car and other emergency aid cars when they came to the village to destroy houses.

On 2 August 2021, in Kin Ma village in Pauk town (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested two nursing students - one boy and one girl - from Nursing University (Yangon).

On 2 August 2021, in Budalin town (Budalin township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a woman who sold betel nuts and four other young men who were buying betels in relation to the killing of the Twin Taung Village Administrator. A local said that the son-in-law of the deceased administrator accused the woman of being a Thunderstorms Without Borders member and informed the military to arrest her.

On 2 August 2021, in Hnipadaw village (Mudon township, Mawlamyine district, Mon state), the military arrested 8 villagers in relation to a killing of a village administrator. Three of the detainees were from the village electricity accessibility committee and the rest were young volunteers.

On 3 August 2021, in Pyay town (Pyay Township, Pyay District, Bago-West), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a political activist who is also a member of the National League for Democracy. He was arrested while he was attending his father's funeral service.

Movement of forces: On 3 August 2021, in Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), three airplanes full of military soldiers arrived at Kale airport throughout the day. Locals said the soldiers were deployed in seven trucks heading to Mingin and 11 trucks heading to Mindat.

On 3 August 2021, in Sin Ywar village of Paung township (Thaton district, Mon state), the military and police arrested two female university students who had been participating in flash mob protests against the Myanmar military coup.
On 3 August 2021, in Sin Ywar village (Paung Township, Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar military and police arrested 2 university students under penal code 505 (a) and sent them to prison.

Displacement: On 3 August 2021, near Mant Yang and Bang Hmway village in Muse Township (Muse District, Shan-North), the fighting between the Myanmar military and MNDAA forced 173 to 300 Mant Yang and Bang Hmway villagers to flee to Bang Wa and Lak Den in the Myanmar-China border.

Property destruction: On 3 August 2021, in Katha District, (Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military destroyed a house in a farm field and a farm truck with fire. The military suspected the PDF members used to live in the farm field.

ACTOR1: RCSS/SSA-S: Restoration Council of Shan State/Shan State Army-South
NOTES: Recruitment: On 3 August 2021, in the Pang Hkan village track area (Hsipaw Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), the RCSS carried out new soldiers recruitment.

Property destruction: On 4 August 2021, in Ton village (Mingin Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), about 30 people from Pan Set and 10 Myanmar military soldiers entered the village and destroyed houses and looted villagers' properties.

On 4 August 2021, near Hledan bridge of Kamaryut township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), the military and police arrested four young men for unknown reasons and took them in a military truck and drove towards Hlaing township. A planned anti-coup protest was cancelled after the arrest in Kamaryut.

On 4 August 2021, in Hpakant town (Hpakant Township, Mohnyin District, Kachin State), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested another daughter of a member of Pyithu Parliament representing Hpakant township.

On 5 August 2021, near Oe Bo village (Mingin township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military and the Pyu Saw Htee accused and detained five Than Pauk villagers in relation to alleged involvement in the anti-coup movement. Three others were released but another one was still missing.

On 5 August 2021, in Pazundaung Township (Yangon Region), the Myanmar military arrested a secretary of the U Win Tin Foundation when he tried to get the coronavirus vaccination. The military previously issued an arrest warrant against him.

On 5 August 2021, in Gyoe Gyar Kwin village (Toungup Township, Thandwe District, Rakhine State), the Myanmar military battalion 542 and 543 entered the village with 10 military trucks and interrogated villagers. The military interrogated people who had a connection with the Arakan Army (AA). One villager was arrested twice, once on 3 August and again on 5 August. However, he was released again. About 20 youths fled.

On 6 August 2021, in Loikaw town (Loikaw township, Loikaw district, Kayah state), the military arrested three Kayan Tha Yar villagers on suspicion of being connected to PDFs at the Kayan Tha Yar check point.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: MG6 Guerilla Force; Seven People Defense Force; 27 Revolution Forces; Hnalone Hla Lu Maik Gyi Mya A Phwe: Big Beautiful Hearted Hoodlums
NOTES: Change to armed group: On 6 August 2021, in Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), 5 Myingyan-based local defense forces formed an alliance to fight against the military. Member PDFs are MG6 Guerilla Force, Big Beautiful Hearted Hoodlums, Zero Guerilla Force, Seven People Defense Force and 27 Revolution Forces. Location coded as Myingyan.
On 6 August 2021, at night in Bant Bway village (Nawnghkio Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), the Myanmar military arrested three men for not wearing a mask amid the coronavirus outbreak.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Shan Herald Agency for News
NOTES: On 7 August 2021, in Nyaung Hla village (Tabayin township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military arrested 10 villagers (8 from Nyaung Hla and 2 from Wea Gyi villages) who were doing chores at the village monastery. The military also burned more than six motorbikes of arrestees and a few others.

On 7 August 2021, in Mingalar U Yin ward in Kale town (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military arrested 7 people for receiving food items. Locals said arrestees were not involved in protests and they went to where basic food supplies were provided to those needed.

ACTOR1: PSLF/TNLA: Palaung State Liberation Front/Ta'ang National Liberation Army
NOTES: Property destruction: On 7 August 2021, in Namtu township (Kyaukme District, Shan-North), the TNLA troops destroyed a door of a house after a village refused to lend them a car.

Training: Around 7 August 2021, in Taikkyi township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), members of Pyu Saw Htee were provided military training in the military artillery base near the road between Kyar Chaung village and Kwan Thee Myaung village at the foot of the Bago Yoma mountain. It takes ten days to train a batch and it provides the basic courses including the use of weapons and mines.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 8 August 2021, in Nyaung Hla village in Tabayin Township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military entered and arrested eight villagers, including one disabled person and a 14-years-old boy. Arrested villagers were released again in early September, around 3 September.

On 8 August 2021, in Myauk Khin Yan village of Gangaw township (Gangaw district, Magway region), about 13 military forces in civilian clothes arrested a former executive member of the NLD at his house. He was charged with 505(a) and in hiding until he came back to the family as they were infected by COVID-19.

On 8 August 2021, near Sar Kyin cemetery in Monywa town (Monywa township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), the military tied up and arrested 4 people for wearing red shirts. Witnesses also said that the military checked the phones of the arrestees. People have been wearing red shirts on the day for the eight fingers strike in commemoration of Four Eights People's Movement.

Property destruction: Around 8 August 2021 (between 8 - 9 August), in Tabayin Township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military entered and searched houses in about 10 villages including Wea Gyi, Nyaung Hla, Ma Ya Kan, Na Myar and Ma Yoe Kone villages and destroyed villagers' properties. About 10,000,000 kyats worth of properties were destroyed in each village.

On 8 August 2021, near Pan Ya village of Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the local police arrested a 25-year-old truck driver and his 15-year-old assistant on suspicion of carrying weapons and ammunition. Another person on the truck escaped.

Weapons seizure: On 8 August 2021, near Pan Ya village of Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the local police seized ammunition carried in a truck including sixty K-22 rifles, eighty grenades, eighty five ENERGA grenades, 110 magazines, 8000 bullets, 21 ropes and 60 military equipment.

On 8 August 2021, in North Okkalapa township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), the military soldiers came out from nearby houses and arrested about 11 young people who were in the car and waiting to join a protest on commemoration of Four Eights People's Movement and against the military coup.

Property destruction: On 8 August 2021, at ward-7 in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme Township, Kyaukme District, Shan-North), the Myanmar military searched for a man with an arrest warrant under panel code 505. They entered his house, but as they couldn't find him, they destroyed a motorcycle and his belongings.

SOURCE: Network Media Group; Democratic Voice of Burma; Kachin News Group
NOTES: On 9 August 2021, in Waingmaw township (Myitkyina district, Kachin state), about 15 police and soldiers from the military LIB 58 raided the Bu Ga electrical power corporation company (owned by KIO/KIA) building. They arrested six electrical staff after checking their phones. The arrestees were sent to military Northern Command. Five out of six arrestees were released on 19 August.

On 9 August 2021, in Aye Thar Yar village in Tabayin township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military arrested the parents and the son of an NLD coordinator as hostages because the coordinator was not home at the time of the raid. Also on the same day, the military arrested a teacher who joined the CDM. Locals were forced to run and hide as they also fired shots in the village.

Looting: On 9 August 2021, in Pin Sein Khin village (Ye-U township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), about 40 military soldiers came with five private cars to the village and looked for a village volunteer leader. They took money, TV and electronic devices from his house and the houses of his father and brother.

Property destruction: On 9 August 2021, in Ma Yoe Kone village in Tabayin township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military searched houses. They looted valuable materials and destroyed villagers' properties. The incident came after an unknown armed group attacked the military convoy with landmines in Tabayin township.
Property destruction: On 9 August 2021, in Pale township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the house of a retired police officer which was next to the Pale Myoma police station was set on fire.

On 9 August 2021, in Na Myar village (Tabayin township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village and fired random shots, burned some property and interrogated some villagers. One villager was arrested.

On 9 August 2021, in Ma Ya Kan village (Tabayin township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village and fired random shots, burned some property and interrogated some villagers. Two villagers were arrested.

On 9 August 2021, in Sanchaung township (Yangon-West district, Yangon region), the Myanmar military cordoned off around the Hanthawady roundabout with truckloads of soldiers and made some arrests. The source didn't report the number of arrests made.

Displacement: Around 9 August 2021 (between 8 - 10 August), in Tabayin township (Bhamo District, Sagaing Region), thousands of villagers from about 20 villages fled after the Myanmar military raided villages on 8th, 9th and 10th August.

Change to armed group: On 9 August 2021, in Kyaukhtu village (Gangaw Township, Gangaw District, Magway Region), 10 Myanmar military soldiers defected. Although the reason for defection is not clear, it is believed that the soldiers defected either because they were beaten by their captain and/or they didn't get full salary.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency
NOTES: On 10 August 2021, in Myin Tan Kyay in Tabayin Township (Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), in the morning around 7 am, the Myanmar military entered several villages including Daing Nat, Myo Kyi, Mo Yoe Kone, Myin Tan Kyay and Tha Pyi villages and arrested about 20 villagers, including 3 villagers from Myint Tan Kyay village.

SOURCE: Irrawaddy; Radio Free Asia; Democratic Voice of Burma
NOTES: On 10 August 2021, in Nat Chaung village (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military entered the village and arrested some villagers. The Myanmar military arrested 8 villagers from Nat Chaung and Nat Nan (coded separately) on the same day.

Change to armed group: On 10 August 2021, in Gangaw district (Magway region), the Yaw's People Defense Force- YPDF was founded to operate in the area populated by Yaw people, including Gangaw, Kyaw, Kyaukhtu, Saw, Tilin and Laungshay towns. They will ally with EAOs and local PDFs operating in consecutive territories. Gangaw PDF, Tilin PDF, Saw PDF, Kyaw PDF, Kyaukhtu PDF and Laungshay PDF will operate under the YPDF.

On 10 August 2021, in Htauk Kyant village (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military and police entered the village and searched for one of the villagers. As they couldn't find the person they were looking for, they arrested his father-in-law and mother-in-law as hostages.

Property destruction: On 10 August 2021, in Myin Tan Kyay village (Tabayin Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), in the morning around 7 am, the Myanmar military entered the village and burned down some houses.

Displacement: Around 10 August 2021 (between 9 - 12 August), in Hsipaw Township (Kyaukme District, Shan-North), more than 300 villagers from Loi Long, Wan Kyawng, Kawng Kaw and Wan Kawng fled due to the fighting between the TNLA/SSPP and RCSS.

Property destruction: On 10 August 2021, in Zin village (Kanbalu township, Kanbalu district, Sagaing region), an unused police station was set on fire, destroying a construction site and a detention area. A witness said the Pyu Saw Htee started the fire as he saw Pyu Saw Htee logos on one of the motorbikes used by those who started the fire. The police station building had not been in use since 5 March after it was relocated to Kanbalu town.

On 10 August 2021, in Mading village in Waingmaw township (Myitkyina district, Kachin state), the military LIB 58 soldiers searched houses and arrested a villager for digging a hole to hide during the raid. No further report on where he was taken.

Displacement: Around 10 August 2021 (between 1 - 20 August), in Demoso township (Loikaw District, Kayah State), hundreds of civilians fled during to the ongoing fighting between the Myanmar military and armed resistance group. Nearly 5,000 new IDPs were recorded in both Demoso Township in Kayah State and Pekon Township in Shan-South this month.

Displacement: Around 10 August 2021 (between 1 - 20 August), in Pekon township (Taunggyi District, Shan-South), hundreds of civilians fled during to the ongoing fighting between the Myanmar military and armed resistance group. Nearly 5,000 new IDPs were recorded in both Demoso Township in Kayah State and Pekon Township in Shan-South this month.
Movement of forces: On 10 August 2021, in Hpa-An township (Hpa-An District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military troops from the Yangon-based battalion were sent around Hpa-An township.

Movement of forces: On 10 August 2021, in Thaton township (Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar military troops from the Yangon-based battalion were sent to Thaton, Bilin and Kyaikto townships in Mon States.

On 10 August 2021, in Nat Nan village (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military entered the village and arrested some villagers. The Myanmar military arrested 8 villagers from Nat Chaung (coded separately) and Nat Nan on the same day.

Land seizure: On 10 August 2021, at the junction of Lashio-Tangyan road in Lashio Township (Lashio District, Shan-North State), the Myanmar military seized land with 10 houses. The military ordered them to remove their belongings. In 1996, the Myanmar military used the area as a rubber plantation but didn't order the villagers to move away from the village.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Myanmar (2016-); NLD: National League for Democracy
SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Radio Free Asia
NOTES: On 11 August 2021, in Nattalin town in Nattalin township (Thayarwady district, Bago-west), the local police arrested a member of Parliament representing Constituency-2 in Pauk Township (NLD member) in Magway Region and her friend. They charged them with Penal Code 505(a). Her friend, who was arrested along with her, was released the following day.

On 11 August 2021, in Wakema township (Myaungmya district, Ayeyarwady region), the military arrested a few people who were preparing to distribute rice to those in need. One of those arrested had just been released from prison recently. No further report on where they have been taken.

Property destruction: On 11 August 2021, in Ton Par village (Mingin Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), about 30 members of Pyu Saw Htee accompanied by 2 Myanmar military soldiers burned and destroyed 6 houses in the village.

Looting: Around 11 August 2021 (as reported), in Pale township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military interrogated villagers and looted the belongings of the villagers and destroyed their properties. More than a thousand villagers from 10 villagers had fled due to fighting between the military and the People's Revolution Army earlier this month.

On 11 August 2021, in Pa Wut Kone village (Palaw township, Myeik district, Tanintharyi region), the military and police forces arrested a villager for interrogation in relation to explosions that happened in the area the day before. It was reported the villager was a former member of a ceasefire armed group, although the exact group was not reported.
On 11 August 2021, in Daw Au Khu Ward in Loikaw town (Loikaw Township, Loikaw District, Kayah State), the security forces (assumed to be either Myanmar military or police) arrested 3 youths.
On 12 August 2021, in Star City housing of Thanlyin township (Yangon-South district, Yangon region), the military arrested a woman for providing financial assistance to PDFs.

On 12 August 2021, in Ramree township (Kyaukpyu district, Rakhine state), the military arrested the Rakhine State Minister for Agriculture, Livestock, Minerals and Forests under the civilian government at his house. He was charged under Section 55 of the Anti-Corruption Act.
Looting: On 12 August 2021, in Kyaukme town (Kyaukme township, Kyaukme district, Shan-North state), the military searched the house of an IDP resident and took away nearly 400,000 kyats.

On 13 August 2021, in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi township, Magway district, Magway region), the military and police in civilian clothes arrested a man from Ohn Taw ward in relation to an explosion. They came back to his house again to search and took NLD related accessories such as a calendar, photos and pins.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Health Workers (Myanmar); Former Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-)
NOTES: On 13 August 2021, in Shwebo town (Shwebo Township, Shwebo District, Sagaing Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a former military medical doctor. The former medical doctor provided coronavirus vaccination to civilians in the town before he was arrested.

Security measures: Around 13 August 2021 (between 11 - 16 August), in Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), a group of about 30 military soldiers and Pyu Saw Htee stationed in Tei Thee Taw village raided several villages such as Min Bay, Nyaung Kaing, Nyaung Pin Hla, Pauk Chaing, Yone Taw every day and forced over 2000 villagers to flee into forest. Two seniors died of sickness in the forest while running and hiding.
On 14 August 2021, in Kale town (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military and police forces arrested three teachers who joined the CDM including one Chin ethnic national.

On 14 August 2021, in Loikaw town (Loikaw township, Loikaw district, Kayah state), the military searched a volunteer from the Helping Hands charitable organization at her house in the Mai Lone ward and arrested her mother and three other volunteers from the charitable organization as hostages as she escaped.
On 14 August 2021, in Yar Za Gyo village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military and police forces arrested six villagers for unknown reasons.

Property destruction: On 14 August 2021, in Pale township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military burned some houses, killed animals and looted properties in Pone Taung Nat Htate village after fighting with local defense forces separately on August 10 and 12.

On 14 August 2021, in Thahtaygon village, Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military forces searched the house of the regional parliamentarian of Madaya township who is an NLD member and arrested his daughter-in-law and a grandchild as hostages as he was not home. They were released later in the evening.

ACTOR1: Aye Yar Yit Wine Moe Kyoe Mone Tain: Thunderstorms Around the River
NOTES: Change to armed group: On 14 August 2021, in Sagaing township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), a local defense force (Aye Yar Yit Wine Moe Kyoe Mone Tain: Thunderstorms Around the River) was founded. Aye Yar Yit Wine Moe Kyoe Mone Tain claimed to perform a clearance operation on military informants and target those who are involved in the functioning military administration.

Change to armed group: On 14 August 2021, in Nyaungshwe township (Taunggyi district, Shan-South state), the Inn National Defense Force - INDF was formed. The INDF announced that it will protect people of Inle region from harm by any organization and will work with the CRPH, NUG and other armed actors which are fighting against the military's State Administration Council.

On 14 August 2021, in Kant Thar Yon village of Kanpetlet township (Mindat district, Chin state), the military arrested a secondary school teacher and two young men in a military truck according to locals.
On 14 August 2021, in Demoso township (Loikaw district, Kayah state), the military arrested four men who were on their way to a village to take rations for their displaced family.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Human Rights Foundation of Monland
NOTES: Looting: On 14 August 2021, in villages in southern Ye township (Mawlamyine district, Mon state), members of an armed group named Mon Land Defense Army entered villages by car and met with the military-appointed village administrator and extorted money from villagers who worked on plantations in the area. Villagers had to pay between 80,000 to 300,000 kyats depending on their income level. Villagers who were extorted were located in Kyone Nyae, Mi Htaw Hlar Gyi, Mi Htaw Hlar Nage, Da Ni Kyar and Ma Gyi villages in southern Ye township.

Mass grave: Around 15 August 2021 (month of), at the junction of former Namt Hu and Yit Hku villages of Monekoe area (Muse township, Muse district, Shan-North state), locals found 17 bodies in military uniforms as well as the bodies of 2 other women in a car. Locals could not identify if they were soldiers who were killed in combat or civilians who were dressed in uniforms and killed.

SOURCE: Irrawaddy; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners
NOTES: On 15 August 2021, in Yar Za Gyo village (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military and police forces arrested six villagers on suspicion of killing a military-appointed village administrator.

Change to armed group: On 15 August 2021, in Kayah state, the Karenni State Police (KSP) was formed under the leadership of the Karenni State Consultative Council (KSCC). The police force is said to be made up of 320 striking police officers in Kayah state, the neighbouring Pekon township, southern Shan state, and a few police officers from central Myanmar who have taken refuge in Kayah state. The spokesperson stated that the KSP was formed to protect the interests and safety of the people. Location coded as Loikaw.

Detonation: On 15 August 2021, in Kale township (Kale district, Sagaing region), a member of the Kalay defense force was killed by an accidental bomb explosion while he was on a bike travelling to plant it somewhere else.

On 15 August 2021, in Shwebo township (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military and police forces stationed in Pa Laing village searched the Shout Pin Kone area as they suspected that some Pa Laing villagers were hiding there. They arrested five villagers from the Shout Pin Kone area who were plowing seedlings. Four of the arrestees were released later.
On 15 August 2021, in Loikaw township (Loikaw district, Kayah state), the military arrested two people in the Shanpine ward on suspicion of having connections with the PDFs.

Displacement: Around 15 August 2021 (as reported), in Mindat township (Mindat district, Chin state), over 1,000 people from at least 20 villages fled into forest due to intensified fighting between the military and resistance fighters.

Displacement: Around 15 August 2021 (as reported), in Pang Hsant village of Kyaukme township (Kyaukme district, Shan-North state), 91 Pang Hsant villagers from 28 households fled to seek shelter in Kyu Shaw (North) due to the intensified fighting between the RCSS and the SSPP and TNLA alliance.

On 15 August 2021, in Bahan township (Yangon-West, Yangon region), a columnist for VOA Burmese and Frontier Myanmar, as well as a female freelance producer for BBC Media Action, were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) in an apartment in Shwe Gone Yeik Mon Housing. The columnist was arrested for posting articles criticizing the military and the caretaker government following the coup.

Defusal: On 16 August 2021, in Bogale township (Pyapon district, Ayeyarwady region), three unexploded bombs were found in front of the township electrical power cooperation office. The police and special branch officers then arrived and investigated the electrical staff.

On 16 August 2021, in Taungdwingyi town (Taungdwingyi township, Magway district, Magway region), the military searched the house of a man in Maung Taing (2) Ward and arrested his family members - parents, two sisters and a brother - as hostages. A local said the man they were looking for was working in China and that security forces had raided their home at least 10 times since the coup. The man was reportedly wanted by the military junta.

On 16 August 2021, in Thaton town (Thaton township, Thaton district, Mon state), the military arrested a member of a grassroots charitable organization called Thaton Donation Team at her house, accusing her of providing financial assistance to PDFs.

On 23 August 2021, in Shwe Pan Kone village (Wetlet township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military raided the village and arrested a villager.

On 24 August 2021, in Thingangyun township (Yangon-East district, Yangon region), security forces (coded as military and police) raided an apartment in Sabal Phyu Condo. A young man reportedly jumped off the building during the raid. Several people - including the man who jumped off the building - were taken away. Irrawaddy reported that the man who jumped off the building was taken away by an ambulance.

Property destruction: On 24 August 2021, in Kan Thar village (Gangaw township, Gangaw district, Magway region), a funeral vehicle parked at a garage was set on fire by military troops. There has been an increase in attacks against funeral service providers since the coup.

Property destruction: On 24 August 2021, in Bhamo township (Bhamo district, Kachin state), a fire broke out at the OK Group Oxygen Plant. While the cause of the fire was not known, it was reported that an official from the group had been threatened in a phone call by an unidentified person. The oxygen plant was said to have distributed more than 300 units of oxygen tanks free of charge to coronavirus patients since it was established. Oxygen has been in severe shortage in the country since the emergence of the third wave of the pandemic.

On 24 August 2021, in Hpa Le village (Kawlin township, Kawlin district, Sagaing region), security forces (coded as military and police) arrived at the village and fired shots around the village. The raid came after an earlier explosion at the Kawlin police station earlier on the same day. About 70 military troops were stationed in the village, forcing more than 300 villagers to flee.

On 24 August 2021, in Mandalay city (Mandalay region), four members of a philanthropic group that has been supplying food and oxygen to those in need were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) at night.

Property destruction: On 24 August 2021, in Khwee Rein village of Mindat township (Mindat district, Chin state), the military destroyed the village monastery and some houses. They also killed and cooked pigs.

On 24 August 2021, in Bar Lar village (coded as Bar Lar (upper)) (Hlegu township, Yangon-North, Yangon region), an NLD village chairperson and two other members were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) at around 8pm. On 24 August 2021, in Taw Kyaung Lay village (Chaung-U township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), military forces stormed the village and arrested four villagers, including a 25-year-old woman who was arrested at her home after military forces failed to locate her brother. Junta forces opened fire as they entered the village and arrested another man at a betel nut shop after asking him if he knew of the targeted person.

On 24 August 2021, in Maubin township (Maubin district, Ayeyarwady region), the military arrested four people. Locals said the military pretended to be charity workers to get information to arrest anti-coup protesters.

On 25 August 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested the wife of the former Yangon Region Social Welfare Minister. She was released again on 30 August.

Property destruction: On 25 August 2021, in Kone Thar village (Budalin township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), about 60 members of junta forces (coded as military and police) raided the village and set fire to a civilian house with a signboard of the NLD. It was reported junta forces arrived in the village after military informants reported that weapons were stored in the house.

On 25 August 2021, in Madaya town (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the father of a parliamentarian was arrested by junta forces (coded as military and police) after they could not find the targeted parliamentarian.

On 25 August 2021, in Nay Pyi Taw city (Nay Pyi Taw), the chairperson of Kachin National Congress was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) at around 4pm and charged under Section 505 of the Penal Code. He was also the founding member of the Kachin People's Political Front, which was formed after the military coup on 1 February.

On 25 August 2021, in Pale township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the son of a member of the township administration formed by the CRPH was arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) following a complaint of the military informer. On 25 August 2021, in Kyway Bagan village (coded as Kyway Bagan (North)) (Ayadaw township, Monywa district, Sagaing region), about 100 military soldiers and five villagers (reportedly Pyu Saw Htee members) stormed the village, destroyed houses and arrested about 30 people. They also set fire to two motorcycles and ransacked houses in the village. Villagers said that more than 10 mobile phones and money were taken away. The military was reportedly searching and destroying homes of anti-coup activists in the village.

On 25 August 2021, in Dagon Myothit (South) township (Yangon-East District, Yangon Region), two young men were arrested by military forces after a previously arrested youth provided information that they had been involved in anti-coup protests. One other man managed to evade arrest.

On 25 August 2021, in Insein township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), the military arrested the wife and son of the former Social Affairs Minister when she came to Insein prison to provide food for her detained husband. The military council stated that she was providing food to PDFs.

On 25 August 2021, in Kale town (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), more than 10 youths were arrested by security forces (coded as military and police) while they were eating and drinking at a house in Aung Thitsar ward.

SOURCE: Democratic Voice of Burma; Ministry of Defense - NUG

Change to armed group: Around 7 December 2021 (as reported), in Pauk township (Pakokku district, Magway region), five soldiers from the Matupi-based military LIB 140 defected and joined the Pauk Guerrilla Force.
