NOTES: On 28 April 2020, Malaysian police forces arrested 238 members of an Islamic organization DPEIN (Dewan Perkasa Ekonomi Islam Nusantara) at a camp in Hulu Rening, Batang Kali, Selangor, for violating the Movement Control Order. The Malaysian government imposed MCO since 18 March 2020 to curb the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus).

On 1 May 2020, Malaysian police forces and immigration arrested more than 700 migrant workers and refugees in Kuala Lumpur. The government accused them of living illegally in the country. During the coronavirus pandemic, there has been a sentiment against migrant foreigners. They have been blamed for spreading the coronavirus and being a burden on government resources.

Security measures: On 19 May 2020, the Selangor government banned Muslims in Malaysia from visiting royal tombs and cemeteries during the Ied Fitr celebrations to curb the spread of coronavirus. On 14 Oct, the Selangor government imposed a Targeted Enhanced Movement Control Order (TEMCO). Non-essential businesses are required to close, and movement in and out of the affected districts is prohibited. On 27 Oct, the government extended the conditional movement control order (CMCO) in Selangor until 9 Nov. On 9 Nov 2020, the government extended the CMCO in Selangor [coded as Shah Alam] until 6 December 2020.

On 20 May 2020, around 200 foreigners without valid travel and identification documents were detained by Malaysian police in a raid at a wet market in Petaling Jaya, Selangor. The migrants were mostly from Bangladesh, Pakistan, Myanmar, Indonesia, and India.

On 24 May 2020, Malaysian police arrested 91 people in Kluang, Johor, who gathered to watch motorcycles stunt acts. They violated the Conditional Movement Control Order (CMCO) during the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak. The police confiscated five cars and 74 motorcycles.

On 26 May 2020, Malaysian police arrested 38 people for gathering at a park in Malacca City, Malacca. They violated the Conditional Movement Control Order (CMCO) during the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak.

On 30 May 2020, Malaysian police arrested 37 people at two restaurants in Penampang, Sabah, for defying the Conditional Movement Control Order (CMCO). The government imposed CMCO to curb the spread of COVID-19 (Coronavirus).

On 30 May 2020, Malaysian police arrested 34 people in Lahad Datu, Sabah, for defying the Conditional Movement Control Order (CMCO) by traveling in the same car with persons not belonging to the same family or staying in the same house. The government imposed CMCO to curb the spread of COVID-19 (Coronavirus).

On 31 May 2020, Malaysian police arrested 42 people on the beach in Bayan Lepas, Penang, for defying the conditional movement control order (CMCO) imposed by the government during COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak.

On 3 June 2020, the Sabah State Government began to allow travel from peninsular Malaysia, Sarawak, and Labuan to Sabah via air, land, and sea. The route was previously closed due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak. Location coded as Kota Kinabalu.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Malaysia (2020-2021) Eastern Sabah Security Command
NOTES: Security measures: On 4 June 2020, the Eastern Sabah Security Command extended the curfew in the waters of seven districts in the Eastern Sabah Security Zone (Esszone) until 19 June 2020 in Sarawak (coded to Southeastern Coast of Sabah). People are not allowed to enter or be in the affected areas between 6 pm and 6 am to prevent abductions by militant groups and cross-border crimes. The curfew was first implemented on 19 July 2014, following a spate of kidnappings which saw the beheading of a Sarawak resident and the killing of several others, including a policeman and tourists. It has been extended periodically. On 1 December 2020, the government extended the sea curfew until 16 December 2020.

On 1 July 2020, Malaysian police intercepted two boats carrying 27 Vietnam fishermen, who illegally entered Malaysian waters around 134.6 nautical miles from Kuala Terengganu, Terengganu. The police arrested the fishermen.
On 26 July 2020, Malaysian police found and arrested 27 Rohingya refugees who illegally landed on the Rebak Besar Island, Langkawi, Kedah.
On 14 September 2020, Malaysian police arrested 77 Indonesians who tried to enter the country near Ketam Island (Klang, Selangor) without permits.

On 17 September 2020, Malaysian police arrested 28 Indonesians at the coast of Sungai Apong (Sungai Ayer Tawar, Selangor), who tried to enter the country without permits. 14 of the arrestees were women. The police force also seized two minivans and a car.

Security measures: On 29 September 2020, the Malaysian government imposed heightened social restrictions during the coronavirus pandemic in several districts of Sabah state [coded as Kota Kinabalu] until 12 October 2020. All public transport vehicles are only allowed to operate at half-passenger capacity. Restaurants, food stalls, grocery shops, and convenience stores are only allowed to operate between 6 am-8 pm. A Conditional Movement Control Order (CMCO) was imposed in Sabah from 13 Oct. On 26 Oct, the government extended the CMCO for the Sabah region until 9 Nov. On 9 November 2020, the government extended the CMCO in Sabah until 6 Dec 2020.

On 9 October 2020, the Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency (MMEA) detained six foreign fishing boats and arrested 54 Chinese nationals on the Coast of Johor. The vessels allegedly entered the Malaysian part of the South China Sea without permission.

On 15 October 2020, Malaysian authorities and police arrested 25 illegal immigrants at several construction sites around Kuching (Sarawak). All of them were screened for Covid-19 and will be processed according to the law.

Security measures: On 17 October 2020, Malaysian authorities imposed the Conditional Movement Control Order (CMCO) in Labuan [coded as Bandar Labuan] to curb the spread of coronavirus. On 9 Nov, the government extended the CMCO in Labuan until 6 December 2020.

Security measures: On 27 October 2020, the Malaysian government extended the conditional movement control order (CMCO) for the Federal Territory of Putrajaya until 9 November 2020 to curb the spread of coronavirus. On 9 Nov, the government extended the CMCO in Putrajaya until 6 December 2020.
Arrests: On 18 December 2020, Malaysian police arrested 35 illegal immigrants from Indonesia near a beach in Sungai Rengit village, Bandar Penawar, Kota Tinggi (Johor).
Arrests: On 18 December 2020, Malaysian police arrested 38 illegal immigrants from Indonesia at a hotel in Klang (Selangor). Their visas had reportedly expired.
Arrests: On 23 December 2020, Malaysian police arrested 46 Indonesians in Kampung Semaut, Bentong (Pahang). They allegedly didn't have valid stay permits.

Property destruction: On 7 January 2021, two unidentified people threw a Molotov bomb at a house on Kuching-Serian Road, Beratok village, Siburan (Sarawak). The victim and other family members managed to put out the fire, which had damaged the house's glass door and its metal grill. No injuries were reported. The motive of the attack was unclear. The perpetrators were later arrested by the police.

Property destruction: On 8 January 2021, an unidentified actor threw a Molotov bomb at the Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) office at Centre Point Commercial Centre, Miri (Sarawak), when the office was operating. Only the space dividing the first and second floors was left with a black mark. No injuries were reported. The motive of the attack was unclear.

Security measures: On 12 January 2021, a nationwide state of emergency (coded to Kuala Lumpur) was declared in Malaysia until 1 August 2021 to curb the spread of the coronavirus. Under the state of emergency, there will be no election and parliament meeting. In addition to the police forces, the military forces may detain and take action against people who violate restriction order during the period.

Security measures: On 18 January 2021, the Sarawak government imposed the conditional movement control order (CMCO) from 18-31 January 2021 (coded to Kuching) for all divisions across Sarawak except Sibu division, to curb the spread of the coronavirus. All social events and gathering are prohibited during the period.

Security measures: On 22 January 2021, Malaysian government imposed Movement Control Order (MCO) on all states in Malaysia (coded to Kuala Lumpur), except Sarawak, to curb the spread of the coronavirus. It will last until 4 February 2021. During the MCO, all residents are not allowed to go out. Only two people from each household permitted to go out for daily necessities, including emergency cases.

Arrests: On 26 January 2021, Malaysian police arrested 114 foreigners, including 29 Filipinos and 20 Indonesians, in Kota Kinabalu (Sabah) during an immigration raid. They were detained for various immigration offences.
Arrests: On 15 February 2021, Malaysian police and immigration arrested 28 Indonesian nationals in Lahad Datu (Sabah). They stayed in Malaysia without valid permits.

Non-violent activity: On 23 February 2021, Malaysian immigration deported 1,086 Myanmar nationals on three Myanmar navy boats in Lumut (Manjung, Perak). The decision was taken after the Myanmar military took over power in the country. Malaysian government claimed they only deported undocumented immigrants, while human rights organizations suspected that they were refugees.

On 25 February 2021, Malaysian police and immigration arrested 49 foreign workers at a construction site near Bertam in Kepala Batas (North Seberang Perai, Penang). They allegedly violated several immigration regulations.

SOURCE: CNA; South China Morning Post; Straits Times (Singapore)
NOTES: Non-violent activity: On 31 May 2021, 16 Chinese military transport planes were detected heading towards Malaysia's national airspace in Sarawak (coded to the Coast of Bintulu). The incident sparked was considered to be a 'serious threat to national sovereignty and flight safety'by Malaysia. The Malaysian government filed a diplomatic protest with Beijing and summoned the Chinese ambassador. However, the Chinese government insisted that it had not violated international law, and some analysts were skeptical tht such a large number of planes were able to fly in formation so close to Malaysia.

Weapons seizure: The Army confiscated four improvised explosive devices (IEDs), ammunition and other war material from the New People's Army (NPA) in Gubat, Sorsogon on 12 Feb 2016.

NOTES: Defusal: On 12 Feb 2016, the military and police defused an improvised explosive device placed near the highway at Buluan town area, Maguindanao. The bomb, suspected to have been placed by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF), was likely planted in order to sabotage Maguindanao's Sagayan Festival held in the locality.
Arrests: The police and military arrested a ranking New People's Army (NPA) leader and his companion in Madaum, Tagum City, Davao del Norte on 16 Feb 2016.
Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) torched property of Bruscan, a construction company carrying out irrigation projects. The incident took place in Baggao area, Cagayan on 16 Feb 2016.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: The military defused a bomb planted at the roadside in Gindulungan, Maguindanao on 17 Feb 2016.

Weapons Seizure: The Army's 10th Infantry Division captured a New People's Army (NPA) improvised explosive device (IED), several weapons and war items during a raid in Sitio Muling, Barangay Gupitan, Kapalong, Davao del Norte on 21 Feb 2016.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: The military captured a camp of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Barangay Tee area, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 22 Feb 2016 after 24 days of heavy clashes. (No fighting mentioned for Feb 22.)
Defusal: On 25 Feb 2016, the authorities defused an improvised explosive device planted by unidentified perpetrators in Midsayap area, North Cotabato.

Defusal: The police defused a bomb planted by two men in Isulan, Sultan Kudarat on 1 March 2016. The perpetrators were later captured by the police, though it is not known whether they are affiliated with any armed groups operating in the region.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Weapons seizure: Troops from the Joint Task Group Sulu (32nd Infantry Battalion) recovered an improvised explosive device from the Abu Sayyaf group and arrested two Abu Sayyaf members during operations in Barangay Kanague, Patikul, Sulu on 2 March 2016.

Property destruction: Armed men burned four passenger buses in Barangay Sta. Arcadia, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija on 4 March 2016. The police is investigating whether the New People's Army (NPA) could have been behind the attack.
Defusal: Two suspected bombers carrying improvised explosive devices were arrested by the police at Sangil Port, Zamboanga City on 13 March 2016. Identity of the suspects was not confirmed.
Displacement: at least 33 Lumad families evacuated from Barangay Carromata, San Miguel, Surigao del Sur as a result of the military shooting and wounding a farmer in the area two days earlier.
Arrests: A senior New People's Army (NPA) leader was captured and arrested by the Army in Calinan district, Davao City in the month of March 2016.
Property destruction: Men hired by the aides of the Aquino-Cojuangco political elite clan destroyed over 20 hectares of crops on 21 March 2016 in Barangay Mapalacsiao, Hacienda Luisita, Tarlac.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: the military defused an improvised explosive device planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) along the highway in Barangay Iganagampong, Datu Unsay, Maguindanao.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Arrests: Around 2 Apr 2016, a field commander of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) Special Operations Group involved in bomb making and guerrilla operations, was arrested Cotabato Regional and Medical Center (CRMC), Cotabato City, Maguindanao, by joint army and police.
Property destruction: On 6 Apr 2016, 10PM, 10 New People's Army (NPA) members burned a grader and a backhoe in Algemar Construction in Brgy. Poypoy, Calintaan, Occidental Mindoro.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: On 15 Apr 2016, bomb experts defused a bomb planted in the Barangay hall of Rosary Heights 10, Cotabato City.

Property destruction: A demolition of collective farms and huts run by a farmworkers' organization in Hacienda Luisita, Barangay Mapalacsiao, Tarlac was carried out on 18 Apr 2016. The demolition was allegedly ordered by the Aquino-Cojuangco political elite clan. Several residents held a vigil in protest of the destruction.

Non-violent activity: On 30 Apr 2016, unidentified armed men threw a grenade at the house of a Cang-agong village chief and councilor candidate under the United Nationalist Alliance (UNA) in Brgy. Cang-agong, Siquijor, Siquijor. The grenade did not explode and the area was cordoned off for defusal of bomb experts.
Arrests: On 2 May 2016, police arrested the commanding officer of the New People's Army (NPA) Regional Operational Command, Ricardo Andan Manili, in Brgy. Remedios, Las Nieves, Agusan del Norte.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Property destruction: On 5 May 2016, unidentified armed motorcycle-riding men threw a grenade at the house of a Vice Mayor reelectionist of Marawi City, Lanao del Sur, which damaged the vice mayor's Toyota pick-up truck and two other vehicles parked nearby. Grenades also exploded near the infirmary of the Mindanao State University (MSU) in Marawi City.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Non-violent activity: On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified armed men launched three successive rifle grenade explosions near Sultan Mastura Elementary School in Brgy. Tapayan, Sultan Mastura, Maguindanao. No one was hurt and voting continued despite the explosions.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Property destruction: On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified armed group partially burned Dilausan Primary School, a polling center in Dilausan, Tamparan, Lanao del Sur.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Property destruction: Assumed on 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified assailants burned down Ragayan Elementary School, a polling centers in Ragayan, Poona Bayabao, Lanao del Sur.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Non-violent activity: On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified assailants started 2 simultaneous explosions with 40-mm rifle grenades in Brgy. Kitapak, Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Maguindanao. No casualties or further information reported.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Displacement: From 13-17 May 2016, around 15,000 families evacuated to safer areas in barangays northwest of Talitay, Maguindanao following a firefight between two rival Buisan and Sabal political clans.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 25 May 2016, the military announced seizure of an encampment from the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) led by Idang Susukan in Gulangan, Maimbung, Maguindanao. No battle was mentioned and no casualties or fatalities were recorded as well.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Displacement: As of 29 May 2016, following the intensified military operations against the Maute Group which started on 26 May in Brgy. Ragayan, Butig, Lanao del Sur, at least 2,000 residents have been displaced and are currently evacuated in the villages of Coloyan, Samer, Bayabao, Raya Timbab, Sandab and Ragayan, Lanao del Sur.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 2 Jun 2016, the military announced seizure of an training camp for the Maute by the 51st Infantry Battalion who were conducting clearing operations in Brgy. Poctan, Butig, Lanao del Sur.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: On 3 Jun 2016, an improvised explosive device (IED) was defused by Iligan city police in Brgy. Gadongan, Marawi City, Lanao del Sur. The bomb was reportedly intended for the military who are in the area, following military operations against the Maute in Butig, Lanao del Sur, which started on 26 May 2016.

Arrests: Assumed on 4 Jun 2016, two high profile leaders of the New People's Army (NPA) Guerilla Front Committee 4A Sparu unit and two others were captured during a raid by joint military and police forces in Butuan City, Agusan del Norte. (No shootout reported.)

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Regional Intelligence Unit
NOTES: Arrests: On 6 Jun 2016, a leader of the New People's Army (NPA) Sangay sa Partido Platoon 21C, Guerilla Front Committee 21 was captured during a raid by a joint team of the Regional Intelligence Division Tracker Team and the Regional Public Safety Battalion in Brgy. Ladgaron, Claver, Surigao del Norte.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Movement of forces: Assumed on 17 Jun 2016, some 5,000 soldiers have been deployed to Sulu province to strengthen military operations in the area as the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) continues threats to kill their captives if their demands are not met. The ASG already decapitated two Canadian civilians after the deadline of their ransom has passed.

Arrests: On 29 Jun 2016, the military arrested a suspected leader of the New People's Army (NPA) Pulang Bagani Company (PBC) 3 of the Southern Mindanao Regional Committee in Brgy. Bongabong, Panutukan, Davao de Oro.
Men linked to the Cojuangco-Aquino political elite assisted by the police bulldozed 30 hectares of rice and vegetables ready for harvest in Barangay Mapalacsiao, Tarlac on 1 July 2016.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Arrests: On 1 Jul 2016, the military arrested a suspected sub-leader of the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) who is known for making improvised explosive devices (IEDs) in Brgy. Sungkayut, Ungkaya Pukan, Basilan.

Between 1-13 Jul, at least 1,500 drug personalities surrendered to the police in the Calabarzon Region in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal)' (coded the Regional Center of Calabarzon Region as location with GP 3).

Between 1-20 Jul, 2,407 drug personalities surrendered to the police in the Cordillera Region in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal)' (coded the Regional Center of Cordillera Region as location with GP 3).

(coded as Tacloban, the Regional Center of Eastern Visayas Region as location with GP 3).

Agreement: Around 11 July 2016 (between 1 - 20 July), at least 26,749 drug personalities (Bulacan, 8,996; Pampanga, 6,212; Zambales, 2,899; Tarlac, 2,054; Bataan, 1,899 and Aurora, 1,074) surrendered to the police in Central Luzon Region in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal)' (coded as San Fernando, the Regional Center of Central Luzon as location with GP 3).

(coded as Baguio, the Regional Center of CAR as location with GP 3).

NOTES: Agreement: Around 12 July 2016 (between 1 - 24 July), at least 14,760 drug personalities, including 12 village officials and 21 government workers, surrendered to the police in the Caraga Region in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal).' (coded as Butuan, the Regional Center of Caraga as location with GP 3).

Between 1-25 Jul, 1,467 drug users and peddlers surrendered to the police in Bicol Region's provinces of Albay (306 on 1-6 Jul); Camarines Sur (600 on 18 Jul) and Romblon (561 on 1-25 Jul) in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal)' (coded the Regional Center of Bicol Region as location with GP 3).

Agreement: On 12 Jul 2016, more than 2,000 drug users and peddlers surrendered to the police in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal).'

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Displacement: As of 12 Jul 2016, a total of 3,400 families or 17,000 individuals were displaced by the fighting between government forces and the Abu Sayyaf Group in Tipo-Tipo, Al Barka, and Ungkaya Pukan towns in Basilan which erupted in 6 Jul (coded date of publication as Event Date with TP 2 and capital of Basilan as Location with GP 2).

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Agreement: Between 1-14 July 2016, over 6,000 drug users and peddlers surrendered to the policein Maguindanao province in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal)' and for fear of being killed following attacks against drug suspects in different towns.

Agreement: Around 14 July 2016 (between 1 - 28 July), around 30,000 drug personalities (600 in Camarines Sur province and 675 in Sorsogon province) surrendered to the police in the Bicol Region in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal)' (coded as Legazpi, the Regional Center of Bicol Region as location with GP 3).

Agreement: Around 15 July 2016 (between 1 - 30 July), at least 62,000 drug personalities surrendered to the police in the Central Visayas Region (at least 16,000 in Cebu Province; 2,600 in Cebu City; 1,300 in Lapu-Lapu City; 1,000 in Mandaue City, and 22,000 in Bohol) in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal)' (coded the Regional Center of Central Visayas Region as location with GP 3).

Agreement: Around 16 July 2016 (between 1 - 31 July), 10,240 drug personalities surrendered to the police in the National Capital Region's Manila (3,755 on 1-10 Jul); Quezon City (3,539 on 1-25 Jul); Mandaluyong city (90); and the Southern Manila District (2,856 in Las Pinas, Makati, Muntinlupa, Paranaque, Pasay, Pateros, and Taguig on 1-9 Jul) in response to the Philippine National Police's 'Oplan Tokhang (Toktok-Hangyo - knock, appeal)' (coded the Regional Center of National Capital Region as location with GP 3).

Agreement: As of 16 Jul 2016, 2,166 drug users and peddlers surrendered to the police in Pangasinan (1,177 from Urdaneta City, Pangasinan on 15 Jul). 134 drug suspects were also arrested from 1-12 Jul 2016 (coded date of publication as Event Date with TP 3 and capital of Pangasinan as Location with GP 2).

Non-violent activity: On 18 Jul 2016, a grenade hurled by unidentified motorcycle-riding armed men exploded at the yard of a village chairman in Brgy. Pamalian, Pikit, North Cotabato. No one was hurt in the incident but this caused panic among residents.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On 29 Jul 2016, in Brgy. Lilod, Marawi City, Lanao del Sur, the military recovered improvised explosive devices (IEDs) in an abandoned vehicle by alleged Maute Group which is supposed to be transported to Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Displacement: On 29 Jul, following the clash between the military against the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) in Maguindanao areas within the 'SPMS' box, Shariff Aguak, Pagatin (Datu Saudi Ampatuan), Mamasapano and Shariff Saydona Mustapha, around 3,000 families were reported displaced (coded date of publication as Event Date with TP 2 and capital of Maguindanao as Location with GP 3).

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
NOTES: Hundreds of Lumads have been fleeing their homes in Barangay Kawayan, San Fernando, Malaybalay City, Bukidnon following attacks by a paramilitary group (CAFGU) and the military throughout the week of 1st Aug 2016.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
NOTES: Hundreds of Lumads have been fleeing their homes in Barangay Zillovia, Talacogon, Agusan del Sur following attacks by a paramilitary group (CAFGU) and the military throughout the week of 1st Aug 2016.

Property destruction: On 3 August 2016, 40 suspected NPAs burned three dump trucks of Omengan Construction and Development Corporation in Barangay Guinaang (Conner, Apayao, Cordillera Administrative Region). No one was reportedly hurt.

Weapons seizure: On 12 August 2016, the National Bureau of Investigation confiscated firearms (three M2K hand grenades, two .45 caliber pistols with silencers, .40 caliber Glock pistol, .45 caliber pistol, .223-caliber rifle with scope, and bullets) and drugs from a Senior Police Officer and his cousin during an anti-drug operation in Las Pinas City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). They were also arrested.

The leader of the peasant group Piglas-Quezon was arrested by the police and brought to Gumaca town, Quezon on 12 Aug 2016. His subsequent whereabouts were unknown and the community blamed the police for abducting him.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
NOTES: Arrests: On 15 August 2016, a total of 29 drug suspects were arrested following a joint operation conducted by the police and PDEA at a drug den in Barangay Holy Spirit, Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region).

ACTOR1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
NOTES: Agreement: The government has reciprocated the unilateral seven-day ceasefire declared by the Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP) and the New People's Army (NPA) on 20 Aug 2016. The ceasefire will take effect from 21 Aug 2016 with an indefinite validity.

Defusal: Around 22 August 2016 (as reported), a pipe bomb with a triggering device was found near a school in Barangay Dikki, Isabela City (Basilan, Zamboanga Peninsula). It was later recovered by authorities (assumed by the police Explosive Ordnance Disposal Team).

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On 22 Aug 2016, the 51st Infantry Battalion seized a van transporting improvised explosive devices (IED) in Brgy. Nanagun, Lumbayanague, Lanao del Sur. Eight suspects who are members of the Maute Brothers were arrested.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Detonation: On 25 Aug 2016, an Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) leader and bomb expert was killed by his own improvised explosive device when it accidentally exploded as he was escaping from troops in Brgy. Mangalut, Akbar, Basilan.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Prison Guards
ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
SOURCE: Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer; BBC News
NOTES: Non-violent activity: On 27 August 2016, at least 50 suspected Maute Group members raided the Lanao del Sur Provincial Jail in Mapandi, Marawi City (Lanao del Sur, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). They disarmed the guards on duty and helped 8 of their members escape prison. At least 20 other inmates escaped. According to the BBC, no shots were fired during the incident.

ACTOR1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
NOTES: The Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP) and the New People's Army (NPA) declared an interim ceasefire on 28 Aug 2016, valid during the course of peace negotiations. The CPP and NPA's unilateral declaration reciprocates the indefinite ceasefire declared by the government on 21 Aug 2016.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Displacement: On 1 September 2016, approximately 5,045 individuals from 1,102 families were displaced by the fighting between the Abu Sayyaf group and the military in Sulu (Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao) (location coded at Jolo, capital of Sulu). The military also evacuated television reporters and news photographers to Camp Teodulfo Bautista because of the fighting.

Arrests: On 1 September 2016, a total of 72 drug suspects, including 17 women, were arrested by police following a police raid at a drug den in Mujahadin St., Salaam Compound, in Barangay Culiat, Quezon City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region).

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: Bomb disposal experts from the military defused a homemade bomb planted at a highway in Barangay Rebuken, Sultan Kudarat town, Maguindanao on September 6.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: Bomb disposal experts from the 601st Infantry Battalion defused an IED allegedly planted by BIFF rebels at Barangay Meta, Datu Unsay town, Maguindanao province on September 19.

Defusal: On 14 October 2016, the police defused an improvised bomb planted along the highway leading to Barangay Poblacion, Midsayap town, North Cotabato province allegedly intended to cause harm during a local carnival taking place in the area.

Property destruction: The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) burned houses belonging to peasant families who have been evacuated to shelters around Barangay Palongugen, Midsayap on 20 Oct 2016.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: The police defused an improvised bomb allegedly intended to topple a power pylon near a hydroelectric power plant (Agus 1) in Barangay Amay (Amai) Pakpak, Marawi City on 22 Oct 2016.

ACTOR1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Peace talks were held between the government and the National Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP) on 26 Oct 2016 at the University of the Philippines Diliman, Quezon City, Metro Manila.
Defusal: The authorities defused an improvised bomb planted near the house of a government official in Barangay San Rafael, Isabela City, Basilan on 28 Oct 2016.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: The authorities defused a bomb in Cotabato City on 29 Oct 2016. The bomb had been planted by the Dawla Islamiya Fi Cotabato allegedly due to President Duterte's visit in the city.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: The authorities defused a bomb in Broce District, Datu Odin Sinsuat, Maguindanao on 29 Oct 2016. The bomb had been planted by the Dawla Islamiya Fi Cotabato allegedly due to President Duterte's visit in the city.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of the Philippines (2016-); ASG: Abu Sayyaf
ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Arrests: On 4 November 2016, a village chairwoman was arrested at Indanan town (Sulu, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao). She is a suspected Abu Sayyaf rebel. She is accused of hiding Abu Sayyaf rebels in her village.
Property destruction: Armed men claiming to be the New People's Army (NPA) torched a bus in Barangay Polonuling, Tupi, South Cotabato on 13 Nov 2016 after flagging it down.
Property destruction: On 24 November 2016, suspected NPA rebels burned a bus at Barangay Katubao (Kiamba, Sarangani, Soccsksargen).

ACTOR1: AKP: Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines
NOTES: Defusal: The police defused a bomb planted by the Ansar Al-Khilafah on 27 Nov 2016 at Luneta Park, Ermita, Manila, Metro Manila. The group attempted to detonate the bomb on 27 Nov but failed. The failed bombing is being linked to the attempted bombing attack at the US Embassy a day later by the same group.
Defusal: The police defused a bomb planted near the US embassy in Manila, Metro Manila on 28 Nov 2016. The police suspects that the perpetrator is a group affiliated with the Islamic State (IS).
Property destruction: On 6 December 2016, suspected NPA rebels burned heavy equipment at a quarry site in Barangays Concepcion and Magsaysay, Koronadal City (South Cotabato, Soccsksargen).
Defusal: On 7 December 2016, the police found a fake bomb planted by unidentified suspects in front of Manila City Hall at Manila (Metro Manila, National Capital Region).

Non-violent activity: An unidentified assailant launched a grenade that is suspected to have targeted a policeman's house in Barangay Gligli, Pikit, Cotabato on 10 Dec 2016. No-one was hurt in the explosion.
Property destruction: On 12 December 2016, armed men claiming to be New People's Army (NPA) rebels torched a bus at Santo Nino town (South Cotabato, Soccsksargen).
Property destruction: The packing station of Dole Stanfilco was torched by unidentified armed men in Barangay Sebuyon, Surallah, South Cotabato on 19 Dec 2016.
Between 8 December 2016 and 3 January 2017, government forces and paramilitary forces damaged two Lumad run community schools in Davao de Oro.
Arrests: An Abu Sayyaf leader was arrested while being treated in a hospital in Zamboanga City on 26 Dec 2016.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Two unidentified assailants threw two grenades at a police headquarters compound in Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao on 28 Dec 2016. The grenades failed to explode.

Arrests: Policemen raided the Islamic Centre in Quiapo, Manila early on January 7 morning and brought around 80 men, including seven minors, to the Manila Police District (MPD) headquarters, following reports of threats to the Feast of the Black Nazarene.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Agreement: A South Korean captain and a Filipino crewman abducted by Abu Sayyaf militants off the southern Philippines were released on the island of Jolo, Sulu after three-months on Saturday (Jan 14).

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Arrests: At least 28 members of the Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) were arrested at a military checkpoint at Barangay Matampay in Marawi City on January 17. They were released on January 19 night. The soldiers seized a machine gun, assorted rifles, a rocket-propelled grenade launcher and ammunition from the group.

ACTOR1: AKP: Ansar al-Khilafah in the Philippines
NOTES: Arrests: Three suspected Ansar al-Khilafa Philippines (AKP) members, including the suspected new leader of the AKP, had been arrested during a raid conducted by joint police units in a village in Polomolok area, South Cotabato on January 17.

Property destruction: Guerrillas believed to be members of New People's Army torched a truck owned by tobacco giant Philip Morris Fortune Tobacco Corp. in Barangay Mabileg, Sigay town area, Ilocos Sur on January 21.

Property destruction: About 30 suspected members of the New People's Army (NPA) wearing Air Force uniforms stormed the security detachment of Costa del Hamilo Inc. (CDHI) offsite office compound at Sitio Hamilo, Barangay Papaya in Nasugbu area, Batangas on Sunday (Jan 29) and burned its staff house and driver's quarters.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Detonation: Abi Sayyaf is believed to be behind several bombings in Basilan province in the week from Jan 30 to Feb 5.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Detonation: Abu Sayyaf was tagged in a grenade explosion at an abandoned building at the Lamitan District Emergency Hospital in Barangay Limook in Lamitan City, Basilan on February 2. No one was hurt.
Arrests: Two NPA leaders were arrested on Saturday (Feb 4) in Misamis Occidental province.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: Government soldiers also recovered a third improvised explosive in Tuburan town area in the province of Basilan on February 4 or February 5. Abu Sayyaf is suspected to have planted the bomb.

Arrests: Philippine soldiers arrested on Monday (Feb 6) a communist rebel leader at an army checkpoint in Davao City, days after President Rodrigo Duterte scrapped a ceasefire with the insurgents and as clashes between them and the army erupted in several places.

Weapons seizure: Benguet policemen raided a New People's Army transient house along Tiptop, Ambuclao Road in Beckel, La Trinidad on February 9 night, seizing personal belongings, several gadgets, assorted ammunitions and P850,000 cash believed to be revolutionary tax collection of Abellon.

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) burnt two Volvo trucks, filled with gold ore concentrates at Sitio Pakak, Barangay Ampucao, Itogon, Benguet province on February 9. The drivers of the trucks were unhurt.
Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) stole five motorcycles and burnt four heavy equipment units and a generator set in Barangay Tikalaan, Talakag town, Bukidnon on February 9.
Arrests: A top suspected New People's Army leader was arrested by a team of policemen and soldiers in Sorsogon City on February 12.

Arrests: A ranking leader of the New People's Army was arrested by intelligence agents of the Philippine National Police (PNP) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) and the Intelligence Service Group of the Philippine Army in Barangay Sta. Quiteria, Caloocan City on February 12.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
NOTES: Arrests: 28 drug suspects were arrested by Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency personnel in Tanza town of Cavite province on Feb 13.

Weapons seizure: About 20 New People's Army rebels seized the firearms of security guards manning a disputed property at Barangay Salvacion in Rizal town, Occidental Mindoro early morning on February 13.
Government troops recovered an abandoned NPA camp at Barangay Ab-abaan, Balbalan town area, Kalinga on Feb 14.

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) rebels burnt equipment owned by Del Monte Philippines at Barangay Tawantawan, Calinan district, some 15 km southeast of Davao City proper on February 16 afternoon. No casualties reported.

The military claimed that more than 100 New People's Army rebels allegedly occupied a school in Barangay San Martin, Madella, Quirino province. The rebel presence forced hundreds of villagers out of Barangays Cabua-an and St. Nino on Saturday (Feb 18).

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 18 February 2017, the Moro Islamic Liberation Front released 69 minors from its ranks, as part of its commitment to an action plan signed with the UN in 2009. The children were returned to their parents and relatives in a ceremony held at Bangsamoro Leadership and Management Institute, Crossing Simuay, Sultan Kudarat, Maguindanao.

Arrests: Soldiers of the 730th Combat Group of the Air Force arrested a top New People's Army leader in a combat patrol operation along Barangay Munting Indang in Nasugbu at around 3 am on February 21.

Property destruction: Unidentified gunmen strafed the house of a Silayan, Zamboanga del Norte Mayor at dawn on Feb 22. It was unclear whether the attack was carried out by communist rebels or other armed groups operating in the province. No injuries reported.
Government troops recovered an abandoned NPA camp at Sitio Guin-ang, Barangay Dao-angan, Balbalan town, Kalinga on Feb 23.

Arrests: Senator and critic of President Rodrigo Duterte 's war on drugs, Leila De Lima, was arrested by the Philippine National Police from the Senate in Manila for three drug-related cases on February 24.
On 24 February 2017, an explosive device detonated in the parking lot of the AMA Computer Learning Center campus in Angeles City, Pampanga. No reported casualties.
Property destruction: About 15 New People's Army (NPA) rebels attacked a power plant site at Barangay Lumbayao in Valencia City, Bukidnon province on Feb 25.

Property destruction: A group of New People's Army (NPA) rebels burnt down two spray trucks owned by Davao Agricultural Ventures Corp. (Davco) at Barangay Merangiran, Quezon town, Bukidnon province on Feb 25.

Security measures: On March 6, Philippines National Police launched the nationwide Oplan Tokhang 2, also known as Project Double Barrel: Reloaded, an aggressive anti-drug operation which saw the raiding of 81,603 houses. Up to 391,236 people were visited by authorities by April 7.
Arrests: A total of 2,132 drug suspects were arrested between March 6 and 19 during police raids as part of 'Project Double Barrel: Reloaded (Oplan Tokhang 2)'.
Property destruction: On 12 March 2017, NPA rebels burned down a bus at Barangay San Vicente (Makilala town, Cotabato, Soccsksargen).
Looting: On 15 March 2017, New People's Army rebels raided the house of a police agent in Kidapawan City, North Cotabato and seized assorted weapons.
Arrests: 7,281 people involved in drug operations were arrested between March and April 7 across the country as part of Tokhang Revisited.
Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) attacked a spray plane in Surigao del Norte province during the month of March 2017.

Arrests: An alleged key member of the Maute Group was arrested by the police inside the Salam Compound in Quezon City on March 20 evening. The police claimed that the arrest thwarted a plan by the Maute group to set off bombs in Metro Manila.

Looting: On 23 March 2017, NPA rebels reportedly took over the village, forcing hundreds of villagers from Barangay Camutan, Antipas, North Cotabato to leave at gunpoint. NPAs looted houses, collected money from villagers and took their farm animals. They allegedly also took 70 hostages which were later released. No casualties reported.
Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) attacked three container vans loaded with fruits in Davao de Oro province on 25 March 2017.
Property destruction: New People's Army rebels burnt heavy equipment of the Pulsar Construction Corp. at Baybayog village, Alcala town, Cagayan on March 26 night. No injuries reported
Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) destroyed a Sumifru farm in Bukidnon province on 27 March 2017.
Property destruction: New People's Army rebels burnt heavy equipment of the RD Interior Construction at Villa Ysmael village, Maddela town, Quirino on March 27 morning. No injuries reported.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Detonation: Security forces detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) under the Tamontaka Bridge in Cotabato City, Maguindanao on March 27.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Detonation: Security forces found and safely detonated a improvised bomb in Datu Saudi Ampatuan town in Maguindanao on March 28.
Defusal: An improvised explosive device was found inside a Manila-bound passenger bus in Dasmarinas City in Cavite province on March 30.

ACTOR1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
NOTES: Agreement: The Philippine Government and the Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front (CPP-NPA- NDF) signed an interim ceasefire agreement on April 5.

Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) burned P7 million worth of facilities owned by the pineapple producer Dole Philippines Inc. in General Santos City, South Cotabato during the first half of April 2017, with the purpose of extorting revolutionary taxes.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Agreement: Two sub-leaders of the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) and nine other ASG members surrendered to the Joint Task Forces in Bongao, Tawi-Tawi around the first half of April 2017.
Property destruction: A cargo truck owned by a banana trader was set ablaze by suspected New People's Army (NPA) in Barangay Macmod, Kidapawan, North Cotabato on 11 Apr 2017.
Arrests: 2,411 people involved in drug operations were arrested between April 7-16 across the country as part of Tokhang Revisited.

Property destruction: During the week of 12 Apr 2017, the New People's Army (NPA) burned about P4 million in farm equipment at the Del Monte Philippines pineapple plantation in Baguio District, Davao City.
Defusal: An improvised bomb suspected to have been planted by the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) was defused near St. John Learning Center, Barangay New Isabela, Tacurong on 17 Apr 2017.

Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) raided Maconday Plastic Plant, Panabo City, Davao del Norte on 29 Apr 2017. The reason for the attack is said to be linked to an agrarian dispute. On the same day rebels also attacked and burnt down the Macondray Plastic Plant in the village of Tapore in Panabo City.

Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) burned and looted manufacturing plants of Lapanday Foods Corp. (Inc.) in Barangay Mandug, Buhangin, Davao del Sur on 29 Apr 2017. The reason for the attack is said to be linked to an agrarian dispute.
Arrests: An alleged New People's Army leader, and another suspected militant were arrested by the police and soldiers in Barangay (village) Camasi in Penablanca area in the afternoon on May 4.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: 27 alleged Abu Sayyaf Group members, including three sub-leaders surrender on May 5 in Basilan and Sulu provinces to the military.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: 27 alleged Abu Sayyaf Group members, including three sub-leaders surrender on May 5 in Basilan and Sulu provinces to the military.
Looting: 15 New People's Army raided the Mil-Oro Mining Corporation at Salingkomot, Barangay (village) Macambol in Mati City, Davao Oriental on May 6.
Arrests: A ranking NPA leader was captured by soldiers under the Army's 401st Infantry Brigade during a raid in Barangay Libertad in Prosperidad, Agusan del Sur on May 9.

Arrests: Military forces arrested a ranking New People's Army (NPA) leader in Western Mindanao, a bishop and two others along a checkpoint in Barangay Gango in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental on May 11.
Property destruction: Four suspected NPA rebels destroyed two heavy equipment owned by a private road contractor in Barangay Kalyaat in Lucban town area, Quezon on May 14.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Forest Rangers
NOTES: Within the month of May 2017, in Surigao del Sur province, four masked men burned the house of an environmental defender and a government forest ranger assigned to the enforcement section of the Community Environment and Natural Resources Office (CENRO) of DENR.

Property destruction: 20 armed men raided the Ilaguen Hydro power project site in Barangay (village) San Miguel, Isabela on May 18 and burnt a drilling machine and a generator. The military spokesman assumed the attackers may be communist rebels but the New People's Army has not issued any statements about the attack.

Property destruction: Armed men torched a pay loader owned by a construction firm in Bacradal village, Echague area in Isabela province on May 19. The military spokesman assumed the attackers may be communist rebels but the New People's Army has not issued any statements about the attack.
Arrests: Security forces (assumed police) arrested 33 drug suspects in Bacoor, Cavite between May 22 and 23.

Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte on May 23, 2017 declared martial law initially for 60 days in the entire island of Mindanao and nearby island provinces following clashes between government forces and armed Islamist groups. Given months of continuous fighting, brought about particularly by a siege on the city of Marawi, the period of effectivity of martial law in Mindanao was extended twice, finally lapsing on December 31, 2019 after more than two years in effect.

Non-violent activity: A member of the paramilitary group Alamara forcefully entered the Salugpongan Ta Tanu Igkanogon Community Learning Centre in Sitio Nasilaban, Talaingod area, Davao del Norte on June 1 and harassed the teacher-in charge, suspecting him to be a rebel sympathizer.

Arrests: The leader of the Maute Group, along with four other companions that include his daughter and second wife were arrested by security officials in a checkpoint at Sirawan, Toril in Davao City at around 10 am on June 6.

Displacement: On 9 June 2017, in Davao city, Davao del Sur, 1,014 residents of Barangay Dominga in Calinan District allegedly evacuated from their homes following the presence of the military (3rd Infantry Battalion Task Force Harribon under the 7th Infantry Division) in the area, as reported by a women's group.

Non-violent activity: Four members of the paramilitary group Alamara forcefully entered the Salugpongan Ta Tanu Igkanogon Community Learning Centre in Sitio Nasilaban, Talaingod area, Davao del Norte on June 12 and harassed the teacher-in charge, suspecting him to be a rebel sympathizer.
Property destruction: At least 10 members of the New People's Army (NPA) reportedly torched two power generator sets of a Globe cell site in Barangay Tuhian, in Catanauan town area on June 18 night.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Arrests: Military and police personnel staged a raid at Barangay Bangkal in Patikul town area, Sulu on June 20, leading to the arrest of 29 suspected members of the Abu Sayyaf group. No fire fight occurred as the suspects did not resist arrest.

Property destruction: The Philippine military allegedly razed nine houses of farmers and Lumad to the ground at Sitio 56, Barangay Rizal, Monkayo area in Davao de Oro (assumed around June 22) as part of a retaliation campaign against the New People's Army (NPA) following attacks on army detachments in the area.

Displacement: On 23 June 2017, 1,000 residents of Damulog (Bukidnon, Northern Mindanao) and of President Roxas (Cotabato, Soccsksargen) allegedly evacuated from their homes following the presence of 240 soldiers of the 39th Infantry Battalion in their areas, as reported by a women's group.

Displacement: On 23 June 2017, 1,000 residents of President Roxas (Cotabato, Soccsksargen) and Damulog, Bukidnon (Northern Mindanao) allegedly evacuated from their homes following the presence of 240 soldiers of the 39th Infantry Battalion in their areas, as reported by a women's group.

Displacement: On 25 June 2017, 1,000 residents of Sitio Datalfitao, Barangay Colonsabac (Colonsabak) (Matanao, Davao del Sur, Davao Region) evacuated from their homes following the presence of 73rd and 39th Infantry Battlion in their area, as reported by a women's group.

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) burnt equipment owned by government contractors in Gumaca area, Quezon province (assumed in June or July - July first coded as event date with time precision 3).
Property destruction: An unidentified armed group burnt down heavy equipment owned by a construction company on July 3 in Maddela town in Quirino province.

Property destruction: Heavily-armed men believed to be members of the New People's Army torched heavy equipment of a construction firm on July 9 night at Purok 1, Barangay Licabang in Dumingag town area, Zamboanga del Sur.
Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) rebels burnt an abandoned Army camp at Sitio Padaguiton, San Jacinto town area, Masbate province on July 10 night.

Agreement: On 11 July 2017, in Abra province, Cordillera Administrative Region (coded as Bangued), a high ranking officer of the NPA (Rafael Bautista alias Ka Cheche) surrendered to authorities (assumed military).

Weapons seizure: Around 12 July 2017 (as reported), in Marcos town (Ilocos Norte, Ilocos Region), police officers recovered from the residence of a Marcos Mayor (Jessie Ermitanio) and Nacionalista Party member a cache of weapons consisting of 400 pieces of ammunitions and gun paraphernalia, two guns and an armalite. The mayor was also arrested following the incident.

Property destruction: Around 10 suspected members of the communist New People's Army (NPA) burnt equipment of a construction firm in Barangay Tanag Ibaba, in Lopez town area on July 15 evening. The rebels torched RTY Construction Company's pay loader, three ELF trucks and a cement mixer.

Arrests: On 18 July 2017, in Pasay city (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), 40 people, including around 30 Chinese nationals, were arrested by the joint PNP-Anti Kidnapping Group and Bureau of Immigration at the Solaire Resort and Casino over charges of kidnapping a Singaporean national.

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) rebels torched the equipment and vehicles of Mamsar Construction, including a forklift, backhoe and multi-cab cars at Surigao City, Surigao del Norte on July 18 morning. The attack was allegedly a protest move against the imminent extension of martial law in Mindanao until the end of the year.

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) rebels form the Front 19 attacked the Dole-Stanfilco banana plantation in Tago, Surigao del Sur on July 18 noon, where they destroyed some six hectares of banana farm and torched the company's six mini-trucks. The attack was for the company's alleged continued grabbing of farmlands of poor farmers and the use of chemicals for aerial spray that has damaged the environment and the health of the populace.

Weapons seizure: New People's Army (NPA) rebels disarmed the vice mayor of Cortes town in Surigao del Sur around 6 am on July 18. The rebels took two .45-pistols, a shotgun, a sub-machine gun, two grenades, a VHF radio and bullets for a.45-pistol. The attack was allegedly a protest move against the imminent extension of martial law in Mindanao until the end of the year.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On 21 July 2017, the military recovered two high-powered firearms, ammunitions (M653 rifle, an M203 Grenade Launcher with one round of 40mm ammunition) and other materials belonging to the ASG during a clearing operation in Barangay Annulling (Anoling) (Patikul, Sulu, Bangsamoro).

Property destruction: On 24 July 2017, NPAs burned two steamrollers and a backhoe owned by a private company at a road construction site in Barangay Cakepan (Gacepan) (Sibson, Surigao del Norte, Cariaga).

Property destruction: Suspected New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas launched an attack on the Medalla Construction parked near the Siaton River in Barangay Katikugan, Bacolod City area on July 30, burning construction equipment. The Regional Public Safety Battalion assisted the Army in pursuing the guerrillas.

Property destruction: Five New People's Army (NPA) rebels burnt several machines at the warehouse of the Gallego Institute of Agriculture in Barangay Cabaducan West, Nampicuan, Nueva Ecija on July 30. Among those destroyed were three generators and a water pump.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On 31 July 2017, in Barangay Poblacion (San Antonio, Nueva Ecija, Central Luzon), police seized weapons (three guns, a rifle grenade, two grenades, one airgun, ammunitions, among others) from an unidentified group (a man and a former cop) which prevented them from killing the town mayor. The armed group was hired by an incumbent town councilor.

Arrests: An NPA leader was arrested during a raid by the Army's 39th Infantry Battalion at his hideout at Barangay Biangan, Makilala area on August 3 morning. The arrested leader headed the NPA's clandestine community militia that provides tactical support to regular guerrillas during encounters with government forces.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Other: Around 6 August 2017 (as reported), in Barangay Matampay (Marantao, Lanao del Sur, Bangsamoro), 100 residents of the barangay evacuated from their homes after the a nearby barangay in the area (Barangay Ragaya) experienced random bomb explosions from an unknown source.

Movement of forces: The Chinese Government deployed three Chinese navy ships, a coast guard vessel and 10 fishing boats to guard the Sandy Cay, an uninhabited sandbars near Philippines-controlled Kota Island in the South China Sea, on Aug. 12 after a group of Filipino fishermen were spotted on the sandbars. (Kalayaan, Palawan coded as location with geoprecision 2.)
Arrests: Police forces arrested 32 drug suspects in a 'one time big time' (OTBT) anti-drug operation in Olongapo town in Zambales on Aug 19.

Arrests: On 25 August 2017, police arrested 223 people during its One Time Big Time (OTBT) operation in Mimaropa region (coded as Calapan). No fatalities or casualties reported. It was unclear how many were drug suspects among those arrested.

Arrests: On 28 August 2017, in Barangay Queensrow East, Bacoor City (Cavite, Calabarzon), 26 suspects were arrested during the 'Oplan Galugad' police raid. Two of those arrested were wanted for child abuse while the rest are drug suspects.

Defusal: On 29 August 2017, in Recto, Manila City (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), the police Explosive and Ordnance Division (EOD) recovered an unexploded MK2 fragmentation hand grenade placed by unidentified assailants in front of the gate of the University of the East.

Weapons seizure: On 1 September 2017, in Barangay Katipunan, Kidapawan city (Cotabato, Soccsksargen), police recovered a cache of firearms (20 M16 rifles) from 2 NPA members after they were caught burying the weapons.

Weapons seizure: On 2 September 2017, in Barangay Cajel (Borbon, Cebu, Central Visayas), police recovered an M16 rifle and a caliber .38 pistol with live ammunitions, and sachets of suspected illegal drugs (shabu), from a village chief who also claimed to be working as a hitman for certain government officials. The chief was then arrested.

Weapons seizure: On 4 September 2017, in Barangay Bancao-Bancao, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan, police recovered a .22-caliber rifle, three rifle grenades, a fragmentation grenade, four .45-cal. pistols and 30 sachets of illegal drugs (shabu) from the residence of the city vice mayor. The latter was arrested. The lawyer of the vice mayor alleged that the materials were planted by the police.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
NOTES: Arrests: PDEA arrested 43 drug suspects in a 'one time, big time' anti-drug operation in the cities of Bacoor, Imus, and Dasmarinas among others in Cavite on Sep 4.
Arrests: Police arrested 59 people in a 'one time, big time' operation in Pangasinan province on Sep 4.

Looting: On 7 September 2017, in Caloocan City, Metro Manila, 13 policemen raided an elderly woman's house without a warrant and stole money and other valuables from the house. This incident occurred during one of the anti-illegal drug operation of the police. The policemen were charged with robbery and trespassing.
Property destruction: On 15 Sept 2017, suspected communist rebels fired at and damaged at least 90 solar panels of the biggest solar farm in Southeast Asia located in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Drug Enforcement Group; Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Provincial Intelligence Branch
NOTES: Arrests: Around 22 September 2017, in Cebu city (Cebu, Central Visayas), 116 persons were arrested during simultaneous police raids conducted by 11 police stations of the Cebu City Police Office (CCPO), City Intelligence Branch (CIB) and City Drug Enforcement Unit. It is unclear how many of those arrested were drug users.

Displacement: On 24 September 2017, near Batangas city, Batangas, 365 residents of Barangay Talahib Pandayan near Mt. Banoy, 500 residents of Barangay Masagitsit and Banalo of Lobo town, and 70 others sought refuge from nearby villages after fighting between government forces and NPA members erupted in Barangay Talumpok Silangan, Batangas City.

Arrests: On 25 September 2017, an alleged leader of the outlawed Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) was arrested by police and military troopers at his hideout in Barangay Nabalawag (Midsayap town, North Cotabato, Soccsksargen).
Arrests: On 26 September 2017, a team of police and soldiers arrested an alleged New People's Army (NPA) leader at Barangay Talisay (San Andres town, Quezon province, Calabarzon).

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas attacked a construction site and burnt equipment owned by EM Cuerpo Builders Inc., contractor of the airport in Daraga, Albay on September 28. The NPA was reportedly demanding money, which the construction company could not afford to pay. No injuries reported.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Detonation: A roadside bomb packed with nails prematurely exploded along a stretch of a highway near the Tambunan Bridge in Barangay Tambunan, Guindulungan town area late Friday (Sept 29), causing panic among local residents. BIFF is suspected to have planted the bomb.

Agreement: On 1 October 2017, a senior commander of the New People's Army Guerilla Front 53 surrendered to the Army's 39th Infantry Battalion in a clandestine meeting in Arakan town (North Cotabato, Soccsksargen) that Lumad elders and local officials brokered.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Residents in five Lanao del Sur towns (Kapatagan, Malabang, Picong and Marogong) surrendered 140 assorted firearms on October 2 in support of a disarmament program of the Philippine Army.

Looting: Around 7 October 2017, at least 21 heavily-armed New People's Army rebels conducted house-to-house search and forcibly took cellular phones, personal belongings and personal firearms from villagers in Barangay Tabbac (Buguey town, Cagayan, Cagayan Valley). The rebels reportedly also tied up and threatened to kill a civilian and a militia member who were later released after negotiations initiated by villagers.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: Army ordinance experts defused a roadside bomb along a stretch of a highway that passes through the town of Guindulungan area, presumably planted by BIFF, on October 8.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: Army ordinance experts defused IEDs, presumably planted by BIFF, in Datu Anggal area, Maguindanao on October 8.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Provincial Intelligence Branch; Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group; Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Drug Enforcement Group
NOTES: Arrests: Around 9 October 2017, a combined police force including the Cavite Provincial Intelligence Branch, Cavite CIDG, Cavite Provincial Drug Enforcement Unit and General Trias Component Police Station raided Barangay San Francisco, General Trias (Cavite, Calabarzon) and arrested 30 people involved in the use of illegal drugs and unlicensed firearms.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
NOTES: Other: On 10 October 2017, in Manila (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), the President ordered the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) to lead the conduct of anti-illegal drug operations, suspending the role and involvement of the Philippine National Police (PNP) in the conduct of raids.
Property destruction: Suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels attacked Delta Earthmoving Construction Co. and burnt three heavy construction equipment in Diadi town on Tuesday night (Oct 10).

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) rebels attacked the HEDCOR tapping point at Barangay Otucan Norte, Bauko, Mountain Province on October 10, resulting in power outages in the province and nine municipalities of Benguet province.
Defusal: Government security forces defused a powerful improvised bomb Thursday afternoon (Oct 12) on the roadside at Barangay Lanate Bliss of Isabela City area, Basilan.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: The Army's bomb disposal experts disarmed three improvised explosive devices belonging to the Islamic State-inspired Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Sitio Nangkalan in Barangay Katibpuan in Talayan, Maguindanao on Oct 16.

Property destruction: New People's Army rebels set on fire a ten-wheeler truck owned by a mall operator, destroying around P2 million worth of merchandise, at Barangay Tuyan, Malapatan town in Sarangani province on Oct 16. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group
NOTES: Arrests: On 19 October 2017, two alleged top-ranking officials of the Communist Party of the Philippines - New People's Army (CPP-NPA) were arrested by the Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) and the Philippine Army in Kabankalan City (Negros Occidental, Western Visayas).

Property destruction: Suspected communist New People's Army torched and destroyed around PHP 10 million worth of construction equipment owned by a quarrying company at Bonbon village, Butuan City on Saturday (Oct 21). No injuries reported.

Weapons seizure: On 23 October 2017, in Valenzuela city (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), police recovered a grenade and rifle from an alleged financier of the Maute group. He was also arrested. He allegedly supplied weapons, ammunitions, and food which supported the Maute group during the battle in Marawi city.

Property Destruction: Unidentified persons torched three heavy equipment worth P4.4 million parked along the national highway in Barangay Tangnan area, Carigara town in Leyte province on Thursday morning (Oct 26) No injuries reported.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: Philippines Government troops have recovered more than 2,000 pieces of unexploded bombs and improvised explosive devices (IEDs) in Marawi City while working to restore basic services in the city. The recovered bombs and IEDs were disposed of under military-supervised controlled detonation operations.

Property destruction: Around 20 to 30 members of the New People's Army (NPA) allegedly stormed the compound of the Bluemax Tradelink Inc., located in Barangay Malawaan, Rizal town, Occidental Mindoro on Nov 1 and burnt heavy equipment.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On 1 November 2017, the Barangay Peace Action Team (BPAT) or village watchmen of BARMM, intercepted an Indonesian national member of the Maute Group at Barangay Loksadatu in Marawi city (Lanao del sur, Bangsamoro) and recovered from him a bag containing an improvised explosive device, a pistol, and other types of explosives.

Weapons seizure: On 3 November 2017, in Barangay Kuden (Senator Ninoy Aquino, Sultan Kudarat, Soccsksargen), the army recovered two M16 armalite rifles, two landmines, and ammunitions from eight NPA members who surrendered themselves to the army.

Weapons seizure: On 10 November 2017, in Quezon city (Metro Manila, National Capital Region), three ASG members were intercepted and arrested by joint police forces (PNP, National Intelligence Coordinating Agency, and National Bureau of Investigation Counter Terrorism Division) at Barangay Culiat and foiled their attempt to attack the ASEAN Summit to be held in Manila. Police recovered from them an unknown number of guns, ammunitions, and explosive devices.

Arrests: On 12 November 2017, police intelligence units arrested an alleged leader of the New People's Army at his hideout in Barangay National (Nacional) (Jimenez town area, Misamis Occidental, Northern Mindanao).
Property destruction: Around 30 NPA rebels guerrillas set up a road blockade in Sitio Banga, Barangay Cuyago, Jabonga, Agusan del Norte and burnt two trucks on November 14. No one was injured.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Agreement: Leaders of seven heavily-armed Iranun clans of the Dagalangit, Malambut, Tomawis, Maricor and Aron families and their enemies, the Minis, Bangon, and Baroto families agreed on a settlement to end the decades-long clan feud that took many lives. The settlement was held in Buluan town, Maguindanao on November 15.

Weapons seizure: On 17 November 2017, in Dipolog city (Zamboanga del Norte, Zamboanga Peninsula), police intercepted and arrested two assailants believed to be responsible for the kidnapping of a Labason town mayor's son and recovered two greandes from them.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Non-violent activity: Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) militants attacked the Gani Abpi College in Datu Unsay town, Maguindanao on Nov 17. (It is unclear why the BIFF targeted the college and if civilians were targeted, but soldiers were patrolling the town regularly.)

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Weapons seizure: Around 18 November 2017 (between 12 - 24 November), in Marawi city (Lanao del Sur, Bangsamoro), the military recovered assorted weapons (machine guns, rifles, sniper rifles, rifle grenades, grenade launchers, rocket propelled grenades, and ammunitions) belonging to the Maute group in various locations in the city (Lake Lanao, Barangay Marinaut lakeside, main battle area).

Weapons seizure: Around 21 November 2017, in Pagadian city (Zamboanga del Sur, Zamboanga Peninsula), two NPA officials of the Western Mindanao Regional Party Committee were arrested by joint military and police forces. They also recovered weapons (a hand grenade, a cal 45 gun, and ammunitions) from them.

Defusal: On 22 November 2017, the police, along with civilians, succeeded in defusing an IED left by an unidentified armed group in midst of a festival in Barangay Kalawag (Isulan city, Sultan Kudarat, Soccskargen) (coded as Isulan City).

Troops of the 602nd Infantry Brigade retook territory formerly occupied by the BIFF at a village in Carmen, Cotabato, Soccskargen, on 22 November. The BIFF had abandoned the camp after days of bombing by the military.

Troops of the 602nd Infantry Brigade seized two camps formerly occupied by the BIFF at Barangay Tonganon in Aleosan, Cotabato, Soccskargen on 22 November. The BIFF had abandoned the camp after days of bombing by the military.
Property Destruction: 12 NPA destroyed quarry equipment at Barangay Orong in Kabankalan, Negros Occidental, Negros Island on 26 November. They disarmed but did not harm quarry employees.

Displacement: On 26 November 2017, communities from Barangay Diatagon in Lianga and Barangay Buhisan in San Agustin, mostly Lumads, evacuated from their homes following the build up of government troops in Lianga and San Agustin Towns (Surigao del Sur, Caraga) (coded as Lianga).

Displacement: Around 29 November 2017 (between 28 - 30 November), around 250 Lumad families or 1,100 Lumads evacuated from San Agustin area (Surigao del Sur, Caraga) to Lianga, Surigao del Sur, after fleeing from a firefight by the military and the NPA. During the first week of Dec 2017, military forces allegedly harassed evacuees by blocking their food rations and prohibiting others from entering the evacuation site. The military denied the allegations and termed the evacuation as a leftist ploy.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On 4 December 2017, in Quezon city, Metro Manila, police recovered from two gun runners, including a dismissed police, a collection of assorted weapons (Galil automatic rifle cal. 5.56; Jerico 9mm pistol; Taurus 24/7 cal. 40 pistol; six magazines, and ammunitions). They were also arrested.

NOTES: Agreement: On 4 Dec 2017, the Bayabao and Enterino clans who belong to the same family from the coastal towns of Malabang and Balabagan settled their rido which started during the May 16 elections by signing peace agreement and swearing in the Qur'an.

The Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) remains the lead with the PNP supporting the campaign.

Agreement: Following the firefight incident on 29 Nov 2017 which signalled the severance of their 'bodong,' a bilateral peace system practiced by Kalinga native tribes, the Gaang and Dacalan Tribes in Kalinga exchanged sipat or peace tokens on 6 Dec 2017 which symbolizes the first stage in the restoration of the bodong.

Weapons seizure: Around 6 December 2017, illegal drugs and weapons (M4 Boost Master, M16 rifle, 4 short M16 magazines, bandoler, 2 rifle grenade launchers, hand grenade, live ammunitions) were recovered during a police raid conducted at the residences of relatives and supporters of a former Mayor (Parojinog) in Ozamiz city (Misamis Occidental, Northern Mindanao).

Agreement: Following the shooting incident on 29 Aug 2017 which signalled the severance of their 'bodong,' a bilateral peace system practiced by Kalinga native tribes, the Tulgao and Tinglayan Tribes in Kalinga exchanged sipat or peace tokens on 7 Dec 2017 which symbolizes the first stage in the restoration of the bodong.
