Defusal: Soldiers of the 71st Infantry Battalion defused IEDs allegedly planted by members of the NPA at a road in Nabunturan town, Davao de Oro province on September 22, 2018.
Agreement: 16 members of the NPA surrendered to soldiers from the 53rd Infantry Battalion in Guipos town, Zamboanga del Sur province on September 26, 2018.
Displacement: Hundreds of Lumad and non-Lumad residents of Arakan town, Cotabato province fled their homes on October 1, 2018 in order to escape the armed Matigsalog ethnic militia seeking revenge.

ACTOR1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
NOTES: Agreement: 117 members or supporters of the CPP-NPA-NDF supposedly surrendred to the military at Cabanglasan town, Bukidnon province on October 2, 2018.
Agreement: 18 members of the NPA surrendered to the government at Senator Ninoy Aquino town, Sultan Kudarat province on October 4, 2018.

Around 5 October 2018, during a 24-hour simultaneous anti-drug operation, 152 suspects for involvement in illegal drugs and other crimes were arrested by the police in Pateros, Taguig, Las Pinas, Pasay, Muntinlupa, Paranaque and Makati.

On 7 October 2018, around 50 drug suspects were arrested by the police in simultaneous anti-drug operations in Sitio San Roque, Barangay Bagong Pag-asa, Quezon City, which the police labeled a 'drug den.' Police also reported recovering shabu (crystal meth) and other drug paraphernalia during the operation.

Around 18 October 2018, during an overnight police simultaneous anti-criminality law enforcement operation (SACLEO), 802 individuals were arrested in the neighboring cities of Pasig, San Juan, Mandaluyong and Marikina, due to purported violations of different local ordinances and regulations, such as the ban on roadside alcohol consumption, walking topless in public, and smoking in restricted public spaces, amid a government crackdown on 'tambays' (loiterers) ordered by Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte. The crackdown has sparked widespread concern over police abuse.
Property seizure/destruction: Forty suspected members of the NPA burned down heavy equipment at Barangay Bolisong, Manjuyod town, Negros Oriental province on October 18, 2018.
Agreement: 6 members of the NPA surrendered to soldiers from the 102nd Infantry Battalion at Imelda town, Zamboanga Sibugay province on October 20, 2018.

Around 26 October 2018, during an overnight police simultaneous anti-criminality law enforcement operation (SACLEO), 802 individuals were arrested in the neighboring cities of Pasig, San Juan, Mandaluyong and Marikina, due to purported violations of different local ordinances and regulations, such as the ban on roadside alcohol consumption, walking topless in public, and smoking in restricted public spaces, amid a government crackdown on 'tambays' (loiterers) ordered by Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte. The crackdown has sparked widespread concern over police abuse.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Agreement: 9 BIFF rebels surrendered to the 6th Infantry Battalion at General Salipada K. Pendatun town, Maguindanao province on October 26, 2018.
On 3 November 2018, 231 NPA fighters and alleged supporters reportedly surrendered to the military in Compostela Valley (now Davao de Oro). Location coded to Nabunturan.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: Bomb disposal experts from the 32nd Explosive Ordnance Disposal defused a bomb planted by unidentified assailants at a road in Ampatuan town, Maguindanao province on November 6, 2018.
Agreement: 119 members and supporters of the NPA surrendered to the 44th Infantry Battallion at Bayog town, Zamboanga del Sur province on November 9, 2018.
Weapons seizure: Police officers seized firearms and explosives from the NPA at Barangay Poblacion 1, Sagay City, Negros Occidental province on November 14, 2018.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Defusal: Soldiers from explosive ordnance disposal defused an IED planted along a highway at Barangay Tanuel, Datu Odin Sinsuat town, Maguindanao province on November 24, 2018. The military hinted that BIFF rebels planted the bomb.
Defusal: Military and police bomb disposal experts defused a bomb planted in front of a store in Barangay New Cebu, Lambayong town, Sultan Kudarat province on November 25, 2018.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Agreement: Twelve members of the NPA surrendered to the Army's 82nd Infantry Battalion near Tagoloan II town, Lanao del Sur province on November 26, 2018.

Three police officers were convicted of murdering a teenage drug suspect by a judge in Caloocan City, Metro Manila on November 29, 2018. This is the first conviction involving police officers carrying out the government's War on Drugs. The victim was killed on August 16, 2017.

Around 2 December 2018, during an overnight police simultaneous anti-criminality law enforcement operation (SACLEO), 406 individuals were arrested in the neighboring cities of Pasig, San Juan, Mandaluyong and Marikina, due to purported violations of different local ordinances and regulations, such as the ban on roadside alcohol consumption, walking topless in public, and smoking in restricted public spaces, amid a government crackdown on 'tambays' (loiterers) ordered by Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte. The crackdown has sparked widespread concern over police abuse.
Soldiers from the 7th Infantry Battalion captured an abandoned NPA camp at Barangay Minuli, Caranglan town, Nueva Ecija province on December 7, 2018.
Around 8 December 2018, during a 24-hour simultaneous anti-drug operation, 28 suspects for involvement in illegal drugs were arrested by the police in Quezon City.
On 17 December 2018, 30 drug suspects were arrested by the police during a raid in Barangay Molino 3, Bacoor, Cavite.
Soldiers from the 91st and 703rd Infantry Brigade captured an unguarded NPA camp at Bongabon town area, Nueva Ecija province on December 18, 2018.

Around 24 December 2018 (between 24 - 25 December), during an overnight police simultaneous anti-criminality law enforcement operation (SACLEO), 233 individuals were arrested in the neighboring cities of Caloocan, Malabon and Valenzuela, due to purported violations of different local ordinances and regulations, such as the ban on roadside alcohol consumption, walking topless in public, and smoking in restricted public spaces, amid a government crackdown on 'tambays' (loiterers) ordered by Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte. The crackdown has sparked widespread concern over police abuse.
Agreement: An NPA unit of 19 members surrendered to the 26th and 75th Infantry Battalions in Loreto town, Agusan del Sur province on December 26, 2018.

Members of the NPA burnt down heavy equipment owned by a mining company in Ayungon town area, Negros Oriental province on January 2, 2019. They accused the mining company of destroying the environment.
Property destruction: Suspected members of the NPA torched a bus in Barangay Pucay, Salug town, Zamboanga del Norte province on January 9, 2019.
On 11 Jan 2019, in Cabadbaran City area, Agusan Del Sur, a ranking CPP-NPA commander surrendered himself to the army's 29th Infantry Battalion.
Property destruction: Alleged members of the NPA burned down a truck in Barangay Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon province on January 18, 2019.
Suspected members of the NPA burned down heavy equipment at a construction site in Barangay Maragondon, Real town, Quezon province on January 21, 2019.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Displacement: Four hundred families were displaced by military artillery attacks directed at Abu Sayyaf rebels in Barangays Bungkaung and Upper Latih, Patikul town, Sulu province on January 28, 2019.

Members of the NPA burned down heavy equipment owned by Northern Builders Corporation at Barangay Magsaysay, Infanta town, Quezon province on February 8, 2019. The equipment was being used to construct the controversial Kaliwa Dam.

Property destruction: Members of the NPA burned down heavy equipment being used to construct the Santa Clara Hydro Power Plant at Barangay Malvar, Naujan town, Oriental Mindoro province on February 25, 2019.
Property destruction: Suspected members of the NPA burned down heavy equipment owned by Camia Construction Co. at Barangay Pared, Alcala town, Cagayan province on February 28, 2019.
Suspected members of the NPA burned a backhoe owned by Galicon Construction at Barangay Magballo, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental province on March 1, 2019.
NPA rebels burned harvesting equipment owned by Davao Agriculture Ventures Company in Barangay San Nicolas, Don Carlos town, Bukidnon province on March 14, 2019.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Within the month of Mar 2019, about 6,700 people were displaced following clashes between government forces and armed groups. As of 4-5 September, at least 1,280 households or about 6,400 individuals in barangays in Shariff Saydona Mustapha and Datu Salibo in Maguindanao province are still displaced.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
NOTES: A grenade thrown by an unidentified assailant at two militiamen failed to explode in Barangay Inug-og, Pikit town, Cotabato province on March 15, 2019.
Suspected NPA rebels robbed a family at their house in Barangay Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental province on March 23, 2019.
NPA rebels burned down a truck owned by Bonggo, a construction company, in Barangay Cabangahan, Malaybalay City, Bukidnon province on June 6, 2019.

Assumed on 25 Jul 2019, in Pikit, North Cotabato, at least 1,500 families or some 7,500 individuals from barangays Kabasalan, Paidu Pulangi, and Pnol were displaced due to the continued armed clashes between government troops and the BIFF in the town.

Around 29 July 2019 (between 22 July - 5 August), in Manila, Metro Manila, a total of 35 drug suspects have been arrested by the police during police operations conducted in Baseco Compound and other areas in the city.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 2 Aug 2019, in Barangay Sabala Bantayao, Lumba-Bayabao (Maguing) town, Lanao del Sur, four 'Local Terrorist Group' (LTG) members and 21 NPA supporters surrendered to the military. They also surrendered their weapons. LTG is the government's designation for armed groups, including Maute and Abu Sayyaf, Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and other organizations. However, the specific groups involved in this particular event were not specified.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 3 Aug 2019, in Marawi City, Lanao del Sur, the military detonated unexploded ordnance (260-lb bomb, 110-lb bomb, among others) belonging to both the army the Maute Group during the battle of Marawi in May 2017 and found recently in various parts of Marawi's urban area.
On 6 Aug 2019, in Barangay Antipolo, Bongabon, Nueva Ecija, 19 villagers and supporters of the NPA renounced their support and pledged their allegiance to the government.

On 8 Aug 2019, in Carmen town, Surigao del Sur, the army recovered anti-personnel landmines, bomb-making materials, and other items at Sitio Gacub, Barangay Hinapuyan which are believed to be owned by the NPA.

On 8 Aug 2019, in Zamboanga Sibugay province, a cache of arms and explosives (M-14; AK-47; Carbine rifles; caliber .38 revolver; improvised bombs) were recovered by the military following the surrender of 4 NPAs in the province (coded the capital of Zamboanga Sibugay as location with GP 2).

Around 9 August 2019 (between 8 August - 10 August), in Quezon City, Metro Manila, a total of 55 drug suspects (40 around 8 Aug and 15 on 10 Aug) were arrested by police during simultaneous drug operations conducted in the city.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Macud Clan Militia (Philippines); Rangeris Clan Militia (Philippines); Magandia Clan Militia (Philippines)
ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 14 Aug 2019, in Marawi City, Lanao del Sur, warring families of Baraontong, Macud, Rangeris and Magandia against Ditopor and Faisal Lumamba settled a 40-year clan war or rido which erupted due to political rivalry and land disputes. They also yielded their weapons. The military and the local government facilitated the settlement.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 19 Aug 2019, in Barangay Kiteb, Datu Anggal Midtimbang, Maguindanao, a bomb by an unidentified armed group prematurely exploded in the town. No one was hurt in the incident. Another IED was found by authorities near the site. The BIFF group is suspected to be behind the incident but authorities are still investigating.

On 19 Aug 2019, in Barangay Tinumigues, Lambayong, Sultan Kudarat, the military prevented a bombing attempt by an unidentified armed group after the former recovered a live 81-mm mortar along the national highway. The BIFF group is suspected to be behind the incident but authorities are still investigating.

Assumed on 20 Aug 2019, in Barangay Del Pilar, Cabadbaran City, Agusan Del Sur, a suspected commander of the CPP-NPA (Sandatahang Yunit Pangpropaganda 21-B Guerilla Front Committee 21-C Northeastern Mindanao Regional Committee or SYP 21 B, GFC 21-C, NEMRC) surrendered himself and his weapons to the army's 29th Infantry Battalion.

Around 26 August 2019, in San Mariano town, Isabela, two high ranking officers--a team leader and supply officer; and medical officer--of the NPA Team Uno-Platoon Remo of Reynaldo Pinon Command Central Front surrendered themselves to the police.

Around 30 August 2019 (between 29 August - 30 August), in Caloocan City, Metro Manila, a total of 30 drug suspects were arrested by police during various operations in the city. 19 more were arrested the rest of the week.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Assumed on 30 Aug 2019, in Lanao del Sur province, a logistics provider of Dawlah Islamiyah surrendered himself and his firearms to the military.

On 1 September 2019, a special Joint Task Force was established by the military on the island of Negros (the provinces of Negros Occidental and Negros Oriental), called Joint Task Force (JTF) Negros, with the aim of ending the decades-old communist insurgency by year's end.

On 3 Sept 2019, in Panganuran village, Sibuco, Zamboanga del Norte, a farmer who is a drug and murder suspect was arrested following the recovery of bomb-making materials (1.5 kg of ammonium nitrate; 2.5m detonating cord; 14 pieces blasting caps; a caliber .45 pistol with ammunition; ammunition for M-16 Armalite rifle, caliber .357 revolver, and 9-mm pistol; a two-way radio transceiver), drugs and drug paraphernalia at his place.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency
ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 4 Sept 2019, in Cotabato City, Maguindanao, a drug suspect and leader of the BIFF was arrested by police and PDEA.

On 4 Sept 2019, in Manila, Metro Manila, the President ordered the surrender of 1,914 prisoners released under the Good Conduct Time Allowance (GCTA) law within 15 days. Anyone resisting arrest shall be shot, according to the PNP Chief. This order came following the controversial foiled release of a notorious rape-slay convict under the GCTA. As of 19 Sept 2019, at least 2,009 convicts have surrendered. Due to inconsistent data from the Department of Justice and the police, a temporary suspension of operations against convicts has been enforced until a clean list has been submitted by the DOJ.

Assumed on 6 Sept 2019, in Midsayap, North Cotabato, around 93 to 200 farming families in the town are displaced following an armed clash between two warring clans in the vicinity over a land dispute.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 7 Sept 2019, in Barangay Simuay, Sultan Kudarat, Maguindanao, over 1,060 MILF members turned over more than 920 high-powered firearms, including over 600 rounds of RPG 7 rocket launchers, to the government and the International Decommissioning Body headed by Turkey as part of the decommissioning of firearms of the MILF during the implementation of the second phase of the Normalization of the Comprehensive Agreement on the Bangsamoro (CAB).

ACTOR1: RPA-ABB: Revolutionary Proletarian Army-Alex Boncayao Brigade
NOTES: On 7 Sept 2019, in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental, a total of 36 members of the RPA-ABB Tabulara-Paduano Group surrendered themselves and their weapons to the military.

On 9 Sept 2019, in Barangay San Isidro, Paranaque City, Metro Manila, four armed men stormed a tabloid newspaper plant (Abante News Group), pointed their guns at security guards, and set the plant's printing machines and supplies on fire. It was unclear if there were any injuries during the event. About a week after the incident, three armed men posing as PDEA agents visited the office asking the supervisor to come with them for an interview. PDEA denied the occurrence of such operation.
Assumed on 9 Sept 2019, in Claveria, Misamis Oriental, suspected members of the NPA burned heavy equipment of a construction company. No further information was provided.

On 11 Sept 2019, in Castilla town, Sorsogon, a total of 65 rebels (38 from NPA; 25 from local armed group Sangay ng Partido sa Lokalidad; 2 from the Milisyang Bayan) surrendered themselves and their weapons to the military.
On 11 Sept 2019, in Barangay Igcocolo, Guimbal, Iloilo, about 15 suspected NPA members burned down three pieces of heavy equipment owned by Wilkinson Construction.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 15 Sept 2019, in Buluan, Maguindanao, the army and police disarmed about 50 to 200 MNLF members during a peace rally. The source mentioned that tensions rose during the rally but no one was arrested or investigated.

On 17 Sept 2019, in San Pedro City, Laguna, police and the military arrested an alleged high ranking officer of the NPA (female). Weapons (caliber .380 pistol, 48 live ammunitions, 12 blasting caps and wires) were also recovered from her residence. The labor rights group Confederation for Unity, Recognition, and Advancement of Government Employees (Courage) and Karapatan, however, claimed that she was illegally arrested and red-tagged by the government.

On 18 Sept 2019, in Barangay Jonob-Jonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental, police and the army recovered firearms and explosives from eight NPA members they arrested during a checkpoint operation in the village. Human rights group Northern Negros Alliance of Human Rights Advocates (NNAHRA), however, claimed that the evidence was planted and that the arrested members were cultural workers and activists preparing for the commemoration of the 1985 Escalante Massacre.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 19 Sept 2019, in Barangay Sambulawan, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao, the army recovered and disposed an improvised explosive device by an unidentified armed group which was planted near Butalo Patrol Base.

On 19 September 2019, 69 NPA members and supporter surrendered to the military in Barangay Kibalabag, Malaybalay, Bukidnon and publicly disavowed their membership in the National Democratic Front. They also turned over a number of weapons.
Around 20 September 2019 (between 19 - 20 September), at least 100 drug suspects were arrested by the police during their 'One-Time, Big-Time' 24-hour operation in the city.

On 20 Sept 2019, in Escalante City, Negros Occidental, NPA surrenderers yielded a total of 41 firearms to the military following the processing of former NPA members and mass supporters of the NPA during the northern Negros peace summit and commemoration of the 1985 Escalante Massacre in the city.

As of the morning of 21 September 2019, 2,139 formerly imprisoned convicts had voluntarily surrendered to the Philippine National Police nationwide, exceeding the official count of 'prematurely released prisoners' whom the government had asked to return to prison after previously being freed under the Good Conduct Time Allowance (GCTA) law. The law has proven to be controversial.
38 drug suspects were arrested during police operations in Quezon province between 21 to 23 September 2019.
40 drug suspects were arrested during police operations in Bulacan between 22 to 24 September 2019.

On 23 September 2019, a ranking member of the MNLF and his companion who were bringing explosives were intercepted by military at a routine checkpoint in Barangay Sinawal, General Santos City. A fragmentation grenade and a blasting cap for an improvised explosive device (IED) were retrieved from them.

On 23 September 2019, the Philippine Secretary of Justice ordered the re-release of more than 300 convicts, who were part of the over-2,000 who had voluntarily surrendered to the Philippine National Police nationwide after being asked to return to prison after previously being freed under the Good Conduct Time Allowance (GCTA) law. The law has proven to be controversial.
On 25 September 2019, a ranking member of the Abu Sayyaf, who has been involved in high-profile abductions in the past, was arrested by the military in Naga, Zamboanga Sibugay.
On 26 September 2019, the province of Antique established a Provincial Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (PTF-ELCAC).

On 27 September 2019, an alleged intelligence officer of the Maute Group was arrested by the police at the Batangas City Public Market. Police also seized half a pound of TNT high explosives, an M67 and a fragmentation hand grenade

On 27 September 2019, about 120 individuals claiming to be former members or supporters of the NPA publicly disavowed the group and burned its flags during their signing of a document called 'Panunumpa sa Pagsalikway sa CPP-NPA-NDF' ('An Oath to Part Ways with the NPA') in Arakan, North Cotabato. The signing of the document and the flag-burning took place in the presence of the military.

In a surprise gesture celebrated by the media as a hopeful sign of long-term peace in Mindanao, Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF) founding chairman Nur Misuari and Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) Chairman and Bangsamoro Autonomous Region of Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) Interim Chair Murad Ebrahim - famously at odds with each other due to the decades-long dispute between the MNLF and the breakaway MILF - shook hands and embraced during the conclusion of the National Peace Month celebration hosted by the Office of the Presidential Adviser on the Peace Process (OPAPP) in Pasay City on 30 September 2019.
241 individuals, including up to 92 drug suspects, were arrested during a 'one-time big-time' police operation by the Metro Manila Northern Police District (NPD) in Caloocan on 1 October 2019.
25 drug suspects were arrested during a 'one-time big-time' police operation in Paranaque City on 1-3 October 2019. The police also confiscated drugs.

SOURCE: Philippine Daily Inquirer; CNN; ABS CBN; Cebu Daily News
NOTES: On 14 October 2019, Philippine National Police chief Oscar Albayalde stepped down from his post, following weeks of Senate investigations into his involvement in the practice of 'drug recycling,' i.e., the selling of confiscated drugs back in the black market by police officers (often called 'ninja cops'). On 16 January 2020, the Department of Justice in Manila announced that it had found probable cause to indict Albayalde and 12 others on charges of graft.

On 14 October 2019, suspected NPA militants fired upon and burned equipment belonging a construction firm in Barangay Campo, Bacuag, Surigao del Norte. The company is a contractor for a government road-widening project.

SOURCE: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Star; Abante
NOTES: On 16 October 2019, controversial police officer Jovie Espenido was named the new Bacolod City Police Deputy Director for Operations and will be tasked to lead the drug war in that city. It was under Espenido, during his two previous assignments, that two mayors suspected to have drug links were killed in high-profile police operations. Commenting on Espenido's new assignment, President Rodrigo Duterte said the next day that Espenido was 'free to kill everybody,' although the Philippine National Police later said that Espenido would be expected to act 'with utmost respect for human rights' and that Duterte's statement was just 'putting emphasis on his campaign promise to eradicate illegal drugs.'

On 17 October 2019, 29 drug suspects were arrested in simultaneous police operations across the province of Bulacan, particularly the towns of San Jose del Monte, Malolos, Bustos, Hagonoy, Marilao, Bocaue and San Ildefonso.
On 16-17 October 2019, 26 NPA members belonging to the Dumagat tribe surrendered to joint operatives of the military and the police in Quezon province.
On 21 October 2019, 164 NPA militants and supporters surrendered to the military in an official ceremony in San Fernando, Bukidnon. They also burned rebel flags and turned over their weapons.

On 26-27 October 2019, 29 drug suspects were arrested in simultaneous police operations across the province of Quezon as part of its 'Simultaneous Anti-Criminality and Law Enforcement Operations (SACLEO).' The 29 arrests were part of the 297 total arrests that included other crimes, such as illegal gambling, illegal possession of firearms, violations of local ordinances, etc.
On 30 October 2019, suspected NPA militants burned a three-classroom building at a school in Barangay Sapu Masla, Malapatan, Sarangani, according to the military.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Bayan Muna; GABRIELA: General Assembly Binding Women for Reforms, Integrity, Equality, Leadership, and Action; KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights; KMU: May First Labor Movement; Makabayan: Patriotic Coalition of the People; NFSW: National Federation of Sugar Workers; Civilians (United States)
SOURCE: CNN; Bulatlat; Rappler; Amnesty International; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Bulletin
NOTES: On 31 October 2019, 56 individuals belonging to different organizations - Bayan Muna, GABRIELA, KARAPATAN, Kilusang Mayo Uno, Makabayan, and the National Federation of Sugar Workers - were arrested in simultaneous operations in Barangays Bata, Taculing, and 33 in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. The arrests were carried out by the Philippine National Police's Criminal Investigation and Detection Group in coordination with the army, Joint Task Force Negros, and the provincial police. The arrested individuals belonged to organizations that have often been red-tagged by the military. The arrests were carried out on charges of illegal possession of firearms and explosives, though the organizations concerned said that the evidence was planted. The arrests, while defended by authorities as a legitimate operation with the necessary arrest warrants, were described as a crackdown on leftist groups and were condemned by various national and international organizations, such as the organizations' umbrella alliance BAYAN and independent organizations like Amnesty International. A US citizen was also one of the arrested, leading the US labor union she is part of to call for her release.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 5 November 2019, 16 pipe bombs suspected of being prepared for suicide bombers were retrieved by government troops when they arrested an Abu Sayyaf militant in Paligue, Indanan, Sulu. The arrest of the Abu Sayyaf militant and the recovery of the bombs came a few hours after an encounter between the military and would-be Abu Sayyaf suicide bombers in the same town.
On 6 November 2019, 24 NPA rebels and members of NPA-affiliated groups surrendered to the military in San Luis, Aurora.
On 6 November 2019, 53 NPA rebels and members of NPA-affiliated groups surrendered to the military in Carranglan, Nueva Ecija.

SOURCE: Manila Times; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Amnesty International; Sunstar (Philippines); Rappler; AFP; ABS CBN; CNN
NOTES: On 6 November 2019, top drug war critic Vice President Leni Robredo, during a press conference at her office in Quezon City, formally accepted President Rodrigo Duterte's appointment of her as co-chair of the Inter-Agency Committee on Anti-Illegal Drugs (ICAD), a position she would share with the director-general of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA). The development came a day after the president's appointment of Robredo was officially announced in Manila, following days of heated exchanges between their two camps, where the president dared the vice president to do better than the administration in the implementation of the drug war. In their preceding tit-for-tat, Duterte had said he would give the 'drug czar' position to Robredo for a couple of months, in which time she would have 'full powers' over the drug war. Robredo's allies in the opposition cautioned her against taking the post, saying she was being set up for failure and that she would be made a scapegoat, but she ultimately took the post, saying she would use the opportunity to put an end to the 'senseless' drug war killings. Robredo's appointment papers set 30 June 2022 as the end of her new post's term.

On 6 November 2019, the Bacolod City Prosecutor's Office ordered the release of 31 of the 42 adults who were part of the 56 arrested by the police in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental on 31 October. The 56 individuals were affiliated with different red-tagged organizations and were arrested in simultaneous police operations across Bacolod City on the said date. The Prosecutor's Office found no sufficient basis for the arrest of the 31, who were reportedly merely present at the raided offices when the police operations took place.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency; Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: On 11 November 2019, 35 wanted persons, including an unspecified number of drug suspects, were arrested in 'one-time big-time' police operations coordinated with the military and the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) in different parts of Region 12 (SOCCSKSARGEN).
On 15 November 2019, suspected NPA militants set fire to privately-owned heavy equipment used for road construction in Barangay Luyang, Sibalom, Antique.

On the weekend of 16-17 November 2019, 189 drug suspects were arrested by the police in its Simultaneous Anti-Criminality Law Enforcement Operations (SACLEO) across Central Luzon. Across the country, there were 594 arrests on different charges.
On the weekend of 16-17 November 2019, a total of 71 NPA rebels surrendered to the military across Central Luzon.
On 19 November 2019, over 40 drug suspects were arrested in simultaneous law enforcement operations in Quezon City.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 23 November 2019, government troops seized two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and other bomb-making materials at a Dawlah Islamiyah hideout in Barangay Inaladan, Shariff Saydona Mustapha, Maguindanao. The military said the explosives were intended for an attack on a festival in Midsayap, Cotabato the next day.

SOURCE: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Rappler; Amnesty International; Manila Bulletin
NOTES: On 24 November 2019, President Rodrigo Roa Duterte fired Vice President Leni Robredo from her position as co-chair of the Inter-Agency Committee on Anti-Illegal Drugs (ICAD), less than three weeks after he appointed her to the position. The development came after continuing heated exchanges between the president's and the vice president's camps after the appointment. Prior to Robredo's appointment, Duterte had said he would give the so-called drug czar position to Robredo for a couple of months, in which time she would have full powers over the drug war. Robredo's allies in the opposition cautioned her against taking the post, saying she was being set up for failure and that she would be made a scapegoat, but she ultimately took the post, saying she would use the opportunity to put an end to what she called senseless drug war killings.

On 28 November 2019, unidentified assailants set fire to the Regional Trial Court Branch 29 building in San Miguel, Zamboanga del Sur. The part of the building set on fire reportedly housed ballot boxes containing votes that are being contested in an electoral protest.
On 29 November 2019, 183 NPA militants and affiliates surrendered to village officials in Barangays San Isidro, Tudela, and Manat in Trento, Agusan del Sur.
On 28-29 November 2019, 84 drug suspects were arrested by the police across Cavite in simultaneous anti-drug operations.

ACTOR2: CPP: Communist Party of the Philippines
NOTES: On 5 December 2019, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte announced during a press conference in Legazpi, Albay that he has instructed the secretary of labor to meet with leaders of the Communist Party of the Philippines in the Netherlands, where the latter have been living in exile, in a bid to restart peace talks with the rebels. The previous peace talks between the government and the Communist rebels were scrapped last November 2017.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
SOURCE: Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer
NOTES: As of 5 December 2019, the military reported that they had so far retrieved 20 high-powered improvised explosive devices (IEDs) from different camps of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters in Shariff Saydona Mustapha, Maguindanao, since launching pursuit operations against the group anew on 24 November. The military said that these IEDs were intended for planned attacks in Maguindanao and nearby provinces.

On 10 December 2019, the office of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte announced in Manila that he will not seek another extension of martial law in the Mindanao region beyond its current effectivity until 31 December 2019. Martial law had been in force in Mindanao since May 2017, after different Islamist groups laid siege to the city of Marawi, triggering months of fighting with the government.
On 11 December 2019, a transmitter site of a radio station was burned down in a suspected arson attack by unidentified assailants in Mawab, Davao de Oro (formerly Davao de Oro).

Around 14 December 2019 (between 13 December - 15 December), 88 drug suspects were arrested by the police in its Simultaneous Anti-Criminality Law Enforcement Operations (SACLEO) in Cavite. 30 others were also arrested for other crimes.

Around 14 December 2019 (between 13 December - 16 December), 151 drug suspects were arrested by the police in its Simultaneous Anti-Criminality Law Enforcement Operations (SACLEO) across the Central Luzon region. 159 others were also arrested for other crimes.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: NTF-ELCAC: National Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict
NOTES: In December 2019, up to 33 NPA rebels and affiliates surrendered to authorities across Central Luzon thanks to the efforts of the Regional Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (RTF-ELCAC), regional police said during a press briefing on 6 January 2020 as some of the so-called rebel returnees were presented to the public. Five former rebels surrendered five M-16 rifles, according to the police.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 18 December 2019, government troops defused a homemade bomb left by unidentified assailants outside a mansion belonging to the Ampatuan family in Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao. The incident took place ahead of a court ruling on the Ampatuan Massacre, which happened in Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 23 November 2009 and which the court later ruled to have been masterminded by key members of the Ampatuan family. That massacre saw 58 fatalities, including 32 media workers.

ACTOR1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
NOTES: On 22 December 2019, upon confirmation from the Office of President Rodrigo Duterte in Manila, the government of the Philippines agreed to a reciprocal Christmas season ceasefire with Communist rebels. The Communist Party of the Philippines had earlier announced the ceasefire through its political wing, the National Democratic Front, in a directive to the New People's Army, and this was to take effect upon a reciprocal announcement from the government. The ceasefire is in effect from 23 December 2019 to 7 January 2020. The president's office also announced that it had ordered the reconstitution of the government peace panel to negotiate with the Communist rebels, in a bid to restart the peace talks. The previous peace talks between the government and the Communist rebels were scrapped last November 2017.
On 26 December 2019, 306 NPA militants, affiliates and supporters surrendered to local authorities across Masbate, according to the military.

On 10 January 2020, government troops seized several weapons in an NPA hideout in Barangay Buhisan, San Agustin, Surigao del Sur. The seized weapons included two calibre-30 rifles, two M1 Garand rifles, 47 rounds of caliber 30 ammunition, 131 rounds of 7.62mm linked ammunition, and 12 rounds of 40mm high explosive ammunition.
On 11 January 2020, 56 drug suspects were arrested by the police in simultaneous operations across Metro Cebu.

On 14 January 2020, a combined police and military team retrieved two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and other bomb-making materials buried in a shallow pit near a tomb in Barangay Latagan, Matalam, Cotabato. Residents earlier reportedly saw an unidentified armed group massing in the area and alerted the authorities, though the armed group had left by the time the police and military arrived.

On 15 January 2020, improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and other bomb-making materials were retrieved from two suspected Abu Sayyaf militants, who were then also arrested, by a joint police and military team in Barangay Menzi, Isabela City, Basilan.

On 25 January 2020, members of Alamara tore down the walls surrounding a Lumad evacuation center in the United Church of Christ in the Philippines (UCCP) compound in Haran, Davao City, Davao del Sur. The evacuation center was housing Lumad evacuees displaced by supposed harassment from the military and paramilitary groups since 2015. The evacuation center, operated by the UCCP - which has been red-tagged by the military in the past - was ordered closed by the Regional Peace and Order Council - Davao Region on January 15 for supposed illegal activities.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights
NOTES: On 5 February 2020, a member of human rights group KARAPATAN was arrested by a joint police and military team at her residence in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. The military claimed that the KARAPATAN member was part of the NPA and arrested her on charges of murder. The government has previously red-tagged KARAPATAN.
On 5 February 2020, 33 drug suspects were arrested by the police in simultaneous operations in Bulacan.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: BAYAN: New Patriotic Alliance; KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights; RMP: Rural Missionaries of the Philippines; Christian Group (Philippines); Journalists (Philippines)
NOTES: On 7 February 2020, a journalist as well as members of BAYAN, KARAPATAN and Rural Missionaries of the Philippines were arrested by the police in a raid at a BAYAN office in Tacloban. The arrested were charged with the illegal possession of firearms, though BAYAN and other allied groups condemned the police for supposedly planting the evidence. The high-profile arrests were also condemned by journalist groups and other human rights and activist organizations as a continuation of the State's persecution of red-tagged groups.

SOURCE: ABS CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Rappler
NOTES: On 8 February 2020, controversial police official Jovie Espenido was relieved from his post as Bacolod City Police Deputy Director for Operations, through which he led the anti-drug operations in Bacolod, Negros Occidental. Espenido was appointed to the position in October 2019. It was later revealed that Espenido was included in the Office of the President's new list of 357 police officers suspected of having ties with the illegal drug trade, for which reason he was relieved and subjected to the police's adjudication process.

SOURCE: Rappler; HRW; Manila Bulletin; Amnesty International
NOTES: On 10 February 2020, the government moved to shut down ABS CBN, the Philippines' largest broadcaster, by filing a petition at the Supreme Court in Manila challenging the validity of the media company's operating franchise. Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has often been critical of what it perceived as biased journalism from ABS CBN and other media outlets. The Solicitor General's move came even as ABS CBN's operating franchise was set to expire on 30 March 2020, with Duterte threatening to direct his allies in Congress to block the franchise's renewal. This new development attracted widespread condemnation from journalist and left-wing groups and brought about a number of demonstrations. The office of the president denied that it had a hand in the Solicitor General's actions.

SOURCE: Bulatlat; AP; Manila Bulletin; Sunstar (Philippines); Rappler
NOTES: Agreement: On 11 February 2020, the Philippine government formally served the United States a notice of termination of the Visiting Forces Agreement, starting a 180-day transition period after which time the agreement will cease to be in force. Location coded to Manila (Metro Manila, National Capital Region). The agreement, signed in 1999, is the legal basis for joint military exercises between the Philippines and the United States. On 2 June 2020, the Philippine government suspended for six months the VFA termination process. The Philippine military and the US welcomed the move, though the president's spokesperson clarified that the suspension does not mean the termination is being reversed. On 11 November 2020 and 14 June 2021, the Philippine government again suspended for yet another six months, respectively, the VFA termination process. On 30 July 2021,the Philippine government announced that it was fully retracting the termination of the VFA, a day after talks between President Rodrigo Duterte and the US defense secretary in Manila.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Bureau of Fire Protection
NOTES: On 12 February 2020, the secretary of the Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) announced in a statement from the DILG office in Quezon City that the country's nearly 30,000 firefighters serving under the Bureau of Fire Protection (BFP) of the DILG would be armed with guns before the year ends. Firefighters have heretofore not carried guns. The DILG explained that firefighters are allowed by law to carry guns in times of national emergency. The DILG said that arming firefighters is in line with Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's directive to engage the help of the BFP in maintaining law and order.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
NOTES: On 18 February 2020, a well-known former chairman of the Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP) and former commander of the New People's Army in the 1980s, Rodolfo Salas alias Kumander Bilog - who has been leading a civilian life as a farmer's cooperative organizer since the 1990s after a few years in prison - was arrested by the police in Mountainview, Balibago, Angeles City, Pampanga on 29 charges of murder. The police reported retrieving weapons and ammunition from Salas, who did not resist arrest.
Around 19 February 2020 (from 18 February - 20 February), 280 drug suspects were arrested by the police in Cebu during its Synchronized Enhancement Managing and Police Operations (SEMPO).

On 24 February 2020, 40 members of the MILF were arrested by the police in a so-called Simultaneous Aggressive Police Operation (SAPO) on charges of illegal possession of firearms in Barangay Tikalaan, Talakag, Bukidnon. Several weapons and other items were seized from the MILF members. The MILF recently began decommissioning its weapons as part of the 2014 peace plan. In recent years, they have assisted the military in fighting Islamist groups in the region.
On 25 February 2020, 26 drug suspects were arrested by the police across Bulacan.
On 11 March 2020, 30 Indian nationals with undocumented status in the Philippines were arrested by agents of the Bureau of Immigration in Diliman, Quezon City.
In March 2020, about 2000 individuals were arrested by the police across Cebu, for purportedly violating measures put in place amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
SOURCE: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Cebu Daily News; ABS CBN; Rappler; Manila Bulletin
NOTES: Security measures: On 15 March 2020, a month-long lockdown of Metro Manila in response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak, previously announced on 12 March by Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte, took effect. Duterte ordered the military and police to implement to lockdown by setting up checkpoints at entry points to Metro Manila, with entry and exit being tightly regulated and most forms of domestic land, sea and air travel to the National Capital Region banned. Authorities would later also announce an 8 PM-5 AM curfew. Classes and most government work were also suspended and social distancing measures implemented. On 16 March, Duterte announced the lockdown was to be made stricter and also extended to the entire island of Luzon, the country's largest island. On 1 April 2020, Duterte announced that the military and police are authorized to shoot those who violate lockdown measures and challenge law enforcement officials. The Philippine National Police later downplayed the president's remarks and said they would not immediately shoot quarantine violators. On 7 April 2020, the national government announced that the Enhanced Community Quarantine over Luzon would be extended to 30 April 2020. On 24 April 2020, the president announced that the Luzon-wide Enhanced Community Quarantine would be partially lifted by 30 April, but would be extended to 15 May in the following areas in Luzon (subject to possible changes): Metro Manila, Benguet, Pangasinan, Bataan, Bulacan, Nueva Ecija, Pampanga, Tarlac, Zambales, Batangas, Laguna, Cavite, Rizal, Quezon, Albay, Oriental Mindoro, Occidental Mindoro, and Catanduanes.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: Starting 16 March 2020, local authorities implemented a month-long quarantine over Cotabato province, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement a modified, less strict quarantine across the province, but stricter controls were put in place in the capital Kidapawan, which was put in lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine).

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: As of 16 March 2020, local authorities have imposed a month-long quarantine over Borongan, Eastern Samar; Ormoc, Leyte; following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law. On 18 March 2020, local authorities announced a quarantine over Samar and Northern Samar province, effective from 19 March to 15 April 2020.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: As of 16 March 2020, local authorities have imposed a month-long quarantine over Oriental Mindoro province and Puerto Princesa, Palawan, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law.

NOTES: As of 16 March 2020, local authorities have imposed a month-long quarantine over Bohol and Cebu province, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law. On 24 April 2020, the national government announced that the Enhanced Community Quarantine would be extended to 15 May in Cebu, confirming an earlier similar announcement from the local government.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: As of 16 March 2020, local authorities have imposed a month-long quarantine over Davao City, Davao del Sur, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law. On 24 April 2020, the national government announced that the Enhanced Community Quarantine would be extended to 15 May in the following areas in the Davao Region (subject to possible changes): Davao City, Davao del Norte, and Davao de Oro.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: As of 16 March 2020, local authorities have imposed a month-long quarantine over Batanes province, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: As of 16 March 2020, local authorities have imposed a month-long quarantine over Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: On 16 March 2020, local authorities started imposing a month long quarantine over Antique and Capiz province, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law. On 20 March 2020, local authorities announced a quarantine over Iloilo province, effective from 20 March to 14 April 2020. Similar measures were implemented in Negros Occidental on 30 March, and on Negros Oriental on 3 April. On 24 April 2020, the national government announced that the Enhanced Community Quarantine would be extended to 15 May in the following areas in Western Visayas (subject to possible changes): Antique and Iloilo. On 30 April 2020, the Negros Occidental provincial government downgraded the quarantine measures, while the Bacolod City government extended the Enhanced Community Quarantine in the city to 15 May.

On 17 March 2020, the National Capital Region Police Office (NCRPO), the Philippine National Police (PNP) division with jurisdiction over Metro Manila, announced that it was temporarily suspending its anti-drug operations (the so-called Oplan Tokhang) during the month long Enhanced Community Quarantine over Metro Manila, so that it may focus on its implementation of the quarantine measures as part of the government response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. Location coded at the NCRPO headquarters in Taguig.

On 19 March 2020, the military recovered two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) planted by suspected NPA rebels in Barangay New Salem, Bayugan, Agusan del Sur, on the first day of the government's unilaterally-declared ceasefire with Communist rebels amid its response to the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
SOURCE: ABS CBN; CNN; Bulatlat; Manila Bulletin; Manila Times
NOTES: On 19 March 2020, a unilateral ceasefire with the CPP-NPA-NDF announced the day before by Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte from Manila took effect until 15 April 2020, to allow the military and police to focus its efforts on the government response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak, including the implementation of the month long lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) on the entire island of Luzon. The rebels had a lukewarm response to the declaration and asserted that there was no basis to reciprocate, saying that the government declaration was premature and probably insincere and false, but said it would consider the government's appeal to make a similar move. On 17 April 2020, the military announced that it has resumed combat operations and that the government ceasefire will not be extended absent another proclamation from the president, even though the Enhanced Community Quarantine was extended to 30 April 2020 and the Communist Party of the Philippines extended its own unilateral ceasefire to the same date.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
NOTES: Security measures: On 20 March 2020, local authorities announced a quarantine over Iligan, Lanao del Norte, effective from 20 March to 10 April 2020, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved checkpoints, a prohibition on most forms of domestic land, sea and air travel, and the suspension of classes and most government and private work. Social distancing measures were implemented and most people were instructed to stay in their houses under penalty of law.

Around 23 March 2020, (from 17 March - 29 March), 2,521 individuals were arrested across Metro Manila for violations of measures that have been put in place by the government in response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. 7,627 others were also arrested in other regions of Luzon, while 6,891 in other parts of the country. A Luzon-wide lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) in response to the pandemic has been in effect for at least a month since 16 March 2020. Several other regions followed suit and implemented similar measures.

On 25 March 2020, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte signed in Manila a bill declaring a state of national emergency and granting him emergency powers, in response to the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic. The signed bill - a watered down version of what was originally proposed by the government prior to lengthy Congressional and Senate debates - gave the president the authority to disburse emergency monetary assistance to families hardest-hit by the pandemic as well as health workers, to reallocate government savings, and to temporarily take over the operation of private medical facilities and transportation. The emergency powers are valid for three months.

ACTOR1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
SOURCE: Bulatlat; Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Philippine Daily Inquirer
NOTES: On 26 March 2020, the Communist Party of the Philippines' unilaterally-declared ceasefire with the government took effect after being announced the previous day, and is to be in force until 15 April 2020. The CPP directed the NPA to cease all operations against the military. The CPP said that the ceasefire declaration was a direct response to United Nations Secretary General's call for a global ceasefire between warring parties amid the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic, and that it is meant to allow unhampered medical and economic assistance efforts. The CPP had earlier refused to reciprocate the government's own unilateral ceasefire declaration, already in effect from 19 March to 15 April 2020. On 15 April 2020, the CPP extended the ceasefire to 30 April 2020.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 31 March 2020, 29 BIFF militants surrendered to the military at the army camp in Barangay Sapakan, Rajah Buayan, Maguindanao, after intensive military operations against the rebels in the province the previous month. The military said the surrendering rebels wanted to avail of government assistance programs offered to rebels who give up arms.

Around 1 April 2020 (from 29 March - 4 April), more than 1,000 individuals were arrested by the police in Bacolod, Negros Occidental, for purportedly violating measures put in place amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. Some of the arrested were charged with disobedience to persons in authority.

On 5 April 2020, 41 individuals were arrested by the police in Bacolod, Negros Occidental, for purportedly violating curfews put in place amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. The arrested were given a warning then released.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: KADAMAY: Alliance of Urban Poor Organizations
SOURCE: Bulatlat; Kodao Productions; Philippine Star; Rappler
NOTES: On 6 April 2020, a community kitchen organized and ran by a local chapter of KADAMAY, as a relief effort for poor residents hit hard by COVID-19 (coronavirus) quarantine measures, was harassed by the police in Sitio San Roque, Barangay Bagong Pag-asa, Quezon City, taking down and destroying protest signs demanding a better government response to the pandemic and threatening to shutter the kitchen. Police said the community kitchen was in violation of Enhanced Community Quarantine measures in effect across Luzon amid the pandemic. The government arrested 21 San Roque residents the previous week for a coronavirus-related demonstration. KADAMAY had been previously red-tagged by the government.

On 6 April 2020, four improvised explosive devices (IEDs) were defused by the military after these were recently placed by suspected NPA militants along a trail connecting the villages of Hubasan and Binanggaran in Calbiga, Samar. The military said that civilians tipped them off about a suspected NPA plan to use the explosives against soldiers active in the area conducting COVID-19 (coronavirus)-related work.

Around 11 April 2020 (from 10 April - 11 April), 135 individuals were arrested by the police across Cagayan Valley, for purportedly violating measures put in place amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 13 April 2020, a joint military and MILF team retrieved two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) during a clearing operation in Barangay Kalumamis, Guindulungan, Maguindanao. It was unclear who planted the IEDs, though a report said that the explosives were similar in style to those used by the BIFF. The MILF recently began decommissioning its weapons as part of the 2014 peace plan. In recent years, they have assisted the military in fighting Islamist groups in the region.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Anakpawis; KMP: Peasant Movement of the Philippines; Pamalakaya: National Federation of Small Fisherfolk Organization in the Philippines; Farmers (Philippines); Fishermen (Philippines); Former Government of the Philippines (2016-)
SOURCE: Manila Bulletin; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Bulatlat; HRW
NOTES: On 19 April 2020, seven volunteers from Sagip Kanayunan and Tulong Anakpawis, affiliated with Pamalakaya, KMP and Anakpawis party-list - including a former lawmaker who represented Anakpawis Party-list in Congress - were arrested at a checkpoint in Barangay Bigte, Norzagaray, Bulacan, for supposedly violating Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) measures in place amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. The volunteers were reportedly carrying out an independent COVID-19 relief mission. The government asserted the supposed relief mission was a propaganda stunt and that the group was going to distribute anti-government material. Anakpawis, Pamalakaya and KMP are groups that are consistently red-tagged by the government.

On 24 April 2020, 44 Chinese nationals and 9 Filipinos were arrested by the police in Paranaque for operating offshore gaming in violation of quarantine measures implemented by the government amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. These quarantine measures include the suspension of non-essential work.

On 24 April 2020, 65 individuals were arrested by the police in Sampaloc, Manila, after reportedly violating a 48-hour so-called hard lockdown implemented in the area on top of standard government quarantine measures in response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of the Philippines (2016-); MNLF: Moro National Liberation Front
NOTES: On 30 April 2020, in Barangay Marbel, Matalam, Cotabato, suspected militiamen linked to a clan associated with the MILF torched a pickup truck that the group of people they ambushed the previous day - including a Barangay councilor from a rival clan associated with the MNLF - were in during the ambush. Authorities said that the torching of the vehicle was part of ongoing hostilities between the two clans and was not an organizational conflict between the MILF and MNLF.

Around 3 May 2020 (as reported), around 200 to 400 families from Barangays Kilada and Marbel (coded as two separate events) and another unidentified Barangay in Matalam, Cotabato, evacuated following the eruption of hostilities between two rival clans respectively associated with the MILF and the MNLF in the preceding days.

Around 3 May 2020 (as reported), around 200 to 400 families from Barangays Kilada and Marbel (coded as two separate events) and another unidentified Barangay in Matalam, Cotabato, evacuated following the eruption of hostilities between two rival clans respectively associated with the MILF and the MNLF in the preceding days.

Around 3 May 2020 (as reported), a joint military and police team recovered four improvised explosive devices (IEDs) planted by suspected NPA militants at the boundary of Barangays Pahug and Madalunot, Pinabacdao, Samar. Authorities said that the explosives were going to be used by the NPA in an imminent ambush attempt.

NOTES: On 5 May 2020, during two days of displacement and evacuation, 840 families from Barangays Tuka and Tukanalipao (coded separately across two days for both Barangays) in Mamasapano, Maguindanao, evacuated following the eruption of hostilities between two warring clans affiliated with the MILF.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 5 May 2020, during two days of displacement and evacuation, 840 families from Barangays Tuka and Tukanalipao (coded separately across two days for both Barangays) in Mamasapano, Maguindanao, evacuated following the eruption of hostilities between two warring clans affiliated with the MILF.
On 10 May 2020, some 1,500 families from Pikit, Cotabato, evacuated following the eruption of hostilities between two rival clans respectively associated with the MILF and the MNLF.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 14 May 2020, the rival Alulong and Bantuas clans, which have been engaged in rido (clan feud), agreed to reconcile and to no longer commit violent acts against each other during a settlement facilitated by the military in Bacolod-Kalawi, Lanao del Sur.

Around 15 May 2020 (month of), the military recovered four IEDs planted by suspected NPA militants along the national highway in Jiabong (Samar, Eastern Visayas). The military said that this thwarted a planned ambush by the NPA.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Around 24 May 2020 (as reported), an unexploded IED planted by unidentified assailants was found at a police station in Datu Salibo, Maguindanao.

Around 26 May 2020 (as reported), about 210 families from San Fernando, Bukidnon evacuated from highland villages to the town proper after an NPA attack on a resident of Barangay Kawayan on 22 May. The military said that the NPA was harassing residents in the highland villages in the preceding days.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: Around 27 May 2020 (as reported), 6,410 residents of Dapiawan, Elian, and Kitango in Datu Saudi-Ampatuan, Maguindanao, evacuated from the said villages following clashes between the BIFF and the military in the preceding days.
On 28 May 2020, suspected NPA militants allegedly set an evangelical church and four houses on fire in Barangay Limonda, Opol, Misamis Oriental.
On 1 June 2020, police caught three suspected NPA rebels in the act of planting improvised explosive devices (IEDs) in Barangay Epaw, Las Navas, Northern Samar. The rebels were arrested.

Around 14 June 2020 (from 13-15 June), during a three-day Simultaneous Anti-Criminality and Law Enforcement Operation (SACLEO) by the police, 405 individuals, including 35 drug suspects, were arrested by the police across Quezon, for purported violations of numerous laws and local ordinances.

ADMIN1: Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao
NOTES: On 19 June 2020, the military recovered and defused an improvised bomb planted by suspected Abu Sayyaf militants in Barangay Bohe-Pahuh, Ungkaya Pukan, Basilan.
