NOTES: On 16 February 2020, three IEDs were found left on a roadside in Moo 8, tambon Om Yai, Samphran district of Nakhon Pathom, Thailand. EOD team safely defused the explosives.
Reported on 17 February 2020, the National Security Council approved of a resolution to extend, for the 59th time, the application of the Emergency Decree in the Deep South region for 3 more months.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: On 25 February 2020, a motorcycle bomb made by Malay Muslim Separatists was found parked in Khlong Loei village, Moo 7, tambon Sala Mai, Tak Bai district of Narathiwat, Thailand. The EOD team safely defused the bomb.
On 2 March 2020, a bomb was found in tambon Bang Sare, Sattahip district of Chon Buri, Thailand. It was taken for further investigation by the EOD police.

On 6 March 2020, the police raided a residence of suspects presumed to be Malay Muslim Separatists in Hua Din village, Moo 9, tambon Pa Ching, Chana district of Songkhla, Thailand, and seized a large amount of explosive components.

On 26 March 2020, an emergency decree was imposed nationwide for around one month in Thailand in an attempt to counter the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Public gatherings are banned and foreigners will not be allowed entry. A curfew between 10PM and 4AM was imposed on April 3.

ACTOR1: BRN: Barisan Revolusi Nasional Melayu Patani
NOTES: On 3 April 2020, the BRN issued a statement announcing a unilateral ceasefire due to the coronavirus pandemic, effective on the same day. Location coded at Pattani.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: On 27 April 2020, a timed IED was found on a roadside in tambon Tha Phon, Mueang Phetchabun district of Phetchabun, Thailand. The explosive was later safely defused by the EOD team. It is unknown to whom the explosive belonged. No injuries reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Border Patrol Police
NOTES: On 3 June 2020, the police and border patrol police confiscated 27 gas cylinders found on the premise of a pondok school in Daru village, Moo 3, tambon Thankhiri, Saba Yoi district of Songkhla, Thailand. The authorities suspect the cylinders were to be used to assemble IEDs.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: On 4 June 2020, a large explosive was found in a fruit plantation in Phlap Phla village, Moo 8 tambon Phlap Phla, Mueang Chanthaburi district of Chanthaburi, Thailand. It is unknown to whom the explosive belonged. It was safely removed by the EOD team.

On 20 June 2020, three Thais smuggled 31 illegal Cambodian migrants into Thailand and were arrested by the police, local officials and defense volunteers in Khok Sung district of Sa Kaeo, Thailand. Location coded at tambon Khok Sung, the district's seat.

On 23 June 2020, the police raided a residence in Moo 2, tambon Mae Sot, Mae Sot district of Tak, Thailand, near the border with Myanmar, and discovered at least 33 machine guns and a number of explosives. Two Thai men were arrested.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Border Patrol Police
NOTES: On 9 July 2020, border patrol police and the military arrested around 100 illegal immigrants, mostly of Cambodian nationality, in Sa Kaeo province of Thailand. Thailand's border with Cambodia remains closed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

On 16 July 2020, two activists from the Eastern Youth for Democracy were briefly forced into a police car after holding up anti-govenrment placard in Rayong province, Thailand, before the Prime Minister's motorcade arrived. They were protesting against the government's mishandling of the quarantine of a Egyptian military delegation in Rayong. The harassment of the two activists reinvigorated the student-led anti-government movement in Thailand--which had been building up earlier in the year but came to a pause when the pandemic hit--and triggered protests across the country. .

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Border Patrol Police
NOTES: On 9 August 2020, in an attempt to block the organizing of an anti-government protest in Phitsanulok, three student leaders were taken from their residences and detained at Chao Phraya Chakkri Border Patrol Police Base in tambon Tha Thong, Mueang Phitsanulok district of Phitsanulok, Thailand. No arrest warrant was issued. The students were later released on the same evening.

On 14 August 2020, the police, soldiers and local authority tightened security measures in Yala province of Thailand, increasing security check points to prevent retaliation attacks, following the battle between Malay Muslim Separatists and security personnel that had started on the same day in Pattani province.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Students (Thailand); Student Union of Thailand; United Front of Thammasat and Demonstration
NOTES: On 15 August 2020, the police arrested the leader of the United Front of Thammasat and Demonstration and the Student Union of Thailand in Pak Kret district (Nonthaburi). He was later granted bail.

On 16 August 2020, an explosion wounded a villager after he had stepped on a mine while foraging in the forest near Don Tual Castle in tambon Sao Thong Chai, Kantharalak district of Sisaket, Thailand, near the border with Cambodia. The mine is believed to be a remnant of the Cambodian war.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Thailand (2019-); Military Forces of Thailand (2019-) Volunteer Defense Corps
NOTES: Around 17 August 2020 (as reported), the police, soldiers and defense volunteers tightened security measures and set up additional security check points around Mueang Yala district, Yala, Thailand, following the 3-day shootout that had taken place in Pattani, to prevent retaliation attacks. Location coded at the seat of the district, tambon Sateng.

On 18 August 2020, Thai police arrested 36 Vietnamese fishermen and confiscated their 4 boats, at 92 nautical miles off Cape Tachi of Yaring district, Pattani province. The fishermen were charged with fishing without a permit and illegal entry.

On 19 August 2020, following a three-day clash between Malay Muslim Separatists and the security personnel, a large number of grenades and a large quantity of explosive components enough for the assembling of up to 20 IEDs were found in Buenae Chuelae village, Moo 2, tambon Kolam, Yarang district of Pattani, Thailand. They were confiscated by the security personnel, presumably the military.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Students (Thailand); Free YOUTH; Assembly of the Poor; June 24 Democracy Group; DRG: Democracy Restauration Group
NOTES: On 20 August 2020, the police arrested 9 protest leaders of the Free YOUTH, Assembly of the Poor, June 24 Democracy Group and the Democracy Restoration Group, who participated in the Free YOUTH mass demonstration on July 18, in Bangkok. They were later granted bail.

On 24 August 2020, the leader of the Eastern Youth for Democracy was arrested by policemen while protesting. He was raising a 3-finger salute and holding a sign criticizing one of the government's project in tambon Phe (Mueang Rayong district, Rayong) before the motorcade of the Prime Minister arrived. He was later transported to be detained at Khlong Luang police station in Pathum Thani province.

On 26 August 2020, the police arrested the secretary-general of the Free People and Free YOUTH and another activist in Bangkok. They were charged with sedition, unauthorized gathering, unauthorized use of loudspeakers, for the protest on 18 July. They were released on bail later on the same day.

On 27 August 2020, a villager was killed in an explosion after having stepped on a landmine near the Thai-Cambodian border in Traweng village, Moo 2, tambon Charat (Bua Chet district, Surin), while foraging. The explosive is believed to be a remnant of the Cambodian war.

On 31 August 2020, Malay Muslim Separatists looted and destroyed surveillance cameras across Panare and Thung Yang Daeng districts in Pattani province (coded for Thung Yang Daeng district). In Bo It village, Moo 6 (tambon Ban Klang, Panare), they looted 2 surveillance cameras installed at an electricity pole. Surveillance cameras were looted and set fire to in Bo It village, Moo 6 (tambon Ban Klang, Panare), in Nam Bo village, Moo 2 (tambon Ban Nam Bo, Panare), in tambon Nam Dam (Thung Yang Daeng district), in Bakhae village, Moo 5 (tambon Phithen, Thung Yang Daeng), and in Talo Nibong village, Moo 4 (tambon Talo Maena, Thung Yang Daeng).

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Students (Thailand); Student Union of Thailand; Women (Thailand)
NOTES: On 1 September 2020, policemen arrested the president of the Student Union of Thailand, one of the student-led, anti-government protest leaders, while on her way to Thammasat University in Bangkok. She was charged with sedition, violation of the Emergency Decree, violation of the Communicable Disease Act, for her participation in the July 18 mass demonstration. The Criminal Court later granted bail with the condition that she does not repeat the same actions she was charged for.

On 10 October 2020, Malay Muslim Separatists burned 2 surveillance cameras in Talo Maena village, Moo 1, tambon Lubo Sawo (Bacho district, Narathiwat) and 4 others at Kuyi village, Moo 5, tambon Tapoyo (Yi Ngo district Narathiwat). No injuries reported.

On 15 October 2020, in an attempt to suppress the widespread pro-democracy mass demonstrations, the government declared the severe emergency decree in Bangkok. The decree bans gathering of more than 5 people, as well as publishing and broadcasting news that may affect national security or peace and order. The decree also authorizes arrests of any person connected with the cause of the emergency as well as those supporting or aiding them, in any way. On the same day, the police and military set up several security check points around Bangkok to ensure compliance with the recently declared emergency decree with the purpose of suppressing the student-led pro-democracy demonstrations.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: United Front of Thammasat and Demonstration; People's Party
NOTES: On 15 October 2020, the leader of the United Front of Thammasat and Demonstration who is also a leader of the People's Party, along with another friend, were arrested in a hotel room near the Government House in Dusit district (Bangkok), after the crackdown of the mob at the Government House.

On 16 October 2020, two pro-democracy activists, including a student, were arrested by the police in Bangkok for their participation in the October 14 mass rally, during which protesters crowded around the royal motorcade carrying Queen Suthida. The two were charged with the rare charge of attempting violence against the Queen, which could result in a possible life sentence.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Eastern Youth for Democracy; DRG: Democracy Restoration Group; Students (Thailand)
NOTES: On 17 October 2020, plain clothed policemen on 5-6 motorcycles followed a car carrying the leader of the Eastern Youth for Democracy near Ramkhamhaeng 53 alley in kwaeng Phlap Phla, Wang Thong Lang district (Bangkok). The activist refused to be apprehended in the absence of his lawyer, hence the police broke the car window and forcefully dragged him down. Angry people who witnessed the incident surrounded the police van not letting them pass until the activist told them to go home. Six other protesters, including students and a member of the DRG were also arrested on the same day.

On 27 October 2020, two villagers drove their tractor over a landmine near the Thai-Cambodian border in Nong Ya Kaeo village, Moo 9, tambon Khok Sung (Khok Sung district, Sa Kaeo). The explosion killed both of them. The explosive is believed to be the remnant of the Cambodian civil war.

Security measures: Around 10 November 2020 (as reported), additional security check points have been set up by the police and military in Yala City (Mueang Yala district, Yala), in prevention of separatist attacks as the local election draws near.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Thailand (2019-) Thai Rangers
NOTES: Defusal: On 12 November 2020, three IEDs were found in the forest in Sakupa village, Moo 8, tambon Si Sakhon (Si Sakhon district, Narathiwat). They were safely defused by the rangers.

Property destruction: On 14 November 2020, assailants, presumably Malay Muslim Separatists, set fire to a backhoe hired by a mosque, in Balatae village, Moo 4, tambon La Nga (Mayo district, Pattani). No injuries reported.

Defusal: On 25 November 2020, the police found a motorbike bomb belonging to Malay Muslim Separatists parked in Pulai village, Moo 7, tambon Balo (Raman district, Yala). It was safely defused by the EOD team.

Property destruction: On 10 December 2020, two men on a motorcycle threw a giant firecracker stuffed with nails at the 14 October Memorial in kwaeng Wat Bawon Niwet, Phra Nakhon district (Bangkok) (coded as Bangkok-Phra Nakhon), where the People's Party planned to organize an event in the following afternoon. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: Defusal: On 18 December 2020, an IED along with a banner with writing translated to ''freedom for Patani'' believed to be planted by Malay Muslim Separatists was found on a bridge in Long Khuan village, Moo 6, tambon Khuha (Saba Yoi district, Songkhla). It was safely defused by the EOD team. No injuries reported.

Property destruction: On 25 December 2020, Malay Muslim Separatists carried out arson attacks in 5 locations in Sai Buri district, Pattani province. Two militants set fire to two trucks transporting straw parked in a gas station in Lubo Sulong village, Moo 10, tambon Trobon (Sai Buri district). It is assumed that the assailants intended the fire to cause an explosion. The truck drivers successfully removed the vehicles. Surveillance cameras were destroyed in Chobo village, Moo 1, tambon Paen (Sai Buri district) and in Chamo Sam Ton village of Moo 5 and Kue Bong village of Moo 3, tambon Trobon (Sai Buri district). Assailants also set fire to Buere Tambon Administrative Office in Moo 4, tambon Buere (Sai Buri district). No injuries reported.

Arrests: On 31 December 2020, the police arrested 16 People's Party volunteer guards (from the We Volunteer group) who gathered at Sanam Luang Field and the 14 October Memorial in kwaeng Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Phra Nakhon district (Bangkok) (coded as Bangkok-Phra Nakhon), to sell shrimps to ease the impact of the second outbreak of coronavirus on shrimp farmers. Another People's Party member who is the administrator of the People's Party Facebook page was also arrested in Bangkok.

Property destruction: On 31 January 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to two mobile phone towers -- belonging to private telco companies True and Dtac -- in Ai Ka Sae village, Moo 6, tambon Si Sakhon (Si Sakhon district, Narathiwat). No injuries reported. A banner saying 'Buddhist Thais are not allowed to hunt in this area for Muslims to make their living' was seen in the same village the same day, while the words 'Soldiers get out' were spray painted in another village in the same tambon.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: Defusal: On 31 January 2021, an unexploded grenade and an IED were found in Ai Ka Sae village, Moo 6, tambon Si Sakhon (Si Sakhon district, Narathiwat), at the scene where Malay Muslim Separatists had detonated a bomb targeting policemen earlier on the same day. They were safely defused by the EOD team.

Property destruction: On 31 January 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists cut down trees to block a road and set fire to surveillance cameras in Ri Ngae village, Moo 3, tambon Phadung Mat (Chanae district, Narathiwat). No injuries reported. In another incident, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to a police surveillance camera in Motako Market in Motako village, Moo 4 of the same tambon. No injuries reported.
Property destruction: On 1 February 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to and destroyed 10 surveillance cameras in Khlong Khut village, tambon Pak Bang (Thepha, Songkhla). No injuries reported.

Property destruction: On 1 February 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to and destroyed two surveillance cameras in Chamao village, Moo 2, tambon Na Ket (Khok Pho, Pattani). No injuries reported.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Thailand (2019-) Village Security Team
NOTES: Property destruction: On 1 February 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to a village security outpost in Tha Lo village, Moo 3, tambon Saphan Mai Kaen (Chana district, Songkhla). No injuries reported.

Arrests: On 9 February 2021, Bangkok Criminal Court re-arrested and denied bail for 4 People's Party leaders who were brought in by public prosecutors under the charges of sedition and lese majeste. They were taken from the court in Kwaeng Chom Phon, Chatuchak district (Bangkok) (coded as Bangkok-Chatuchak) to be detained at Bangkok Remand Prison. The incident has sparked a resurgence in anti-government demonstrations in the country.

Security measures: On 21 February 2021, Thai immigration police stepped up their border watch duty in Mae Sai district (Chiang Rai), amid concerns over a possible influx of Myanmar protesters fleeing a crackdown by the authorities in Tachilek province.

Property destruction: On 5 March 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists stole 2 surveillance cameras installed by the government in Chong Mu village, Moo 7, tambon Paen (Sai Buri district, Pattani) and set fire to two others in Hutae Kolae village, Moo 3, tambon Trobon of the same district. No injuries reported.

Weapons seizure: On 5 March 2021, the police arrested a man and confiscated 18 pipe bombs, a number of pistols and explosive substances in Pathum Wan district (Bangkok) (coded as Bangkok-Pathum Wan). It has not been concluded whether this is politically linked, but this comes in the context of an increasing use of explosives by unidentified parties during anti-government demonstrations.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Forestry Officials
NOTES: On 5 March 2021, forestry officials and local authorities arrested at least 80 Karen villagers from the Bang Kloi settlement area in Kaeng Krachan National Park and detained them at the Park Office in tambon Song Phi Nong (Kaeng Krachan district, Phetchaburi). The villagers were transported down the mountain in a helicopter. Twenty-two villagers were transferred to Khao Kling Police Station and charged with encroachment while the rest were released.

On 6 March 2021, around 20 to 30 armed plainclothes police officers arrested at least 48 members of We Volunteer, a group of People's Party's volunteer guards while they were eating in the parking lot of Major Ratchayothin Mall in kwaeng Lat Yao, Chatuchak district (Bangkok) (coded as Bangkok-Chatuchak).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: Defusal: On 12 March 2021, the police intercepted and safely defused 2 unexploded IEDs planted in a car parked near the police flat in Raman village, Moo 1, tambon Kayuboko (Raman district, Yala). The car had been reported stolen on the previous day. No injuries reported.

Property destruction: On 12 March 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists, presumably RKK militants burned tires in 4 locations in Sakho village, Moo 4, tambon Tha Sap (Mueang Yala district, Yala). No injuries reported. The police believed these incidents were carried out because of the anniversary of the establishment of the BRN on March 12.

Security measures: On 13 March 2021, the district head of Betong district ordered more strict searches of incoming vehicles and motorcycles at security check-points of Betong district (Yala), amidst sporadic Malay Muslim Separatists related incidents around the anniversary of the establishment of the BRN.

Property destruction: On 13 March 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists, presumed to be the RKK set fire to a tire on a high way in Na Kaset village, Moo 2, tambon Than To and stole 4 surveillance cameras installed by the authorities on the same high way in Rae village, Moo 4, tambon Ban Rae, both locations in Than To district (Yala). No injuries reported. The police believed these incidents were carried out to commemorate the 61st anniversary of the establishment of the BRN.

Property destruction: On 19 March 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to a tire on 410 Highway in Palo Bata village, Moo 13, tambon Taling Chan (Bannang Sata district, Yala). No injuries reported.

Looting: On 19 March 2021, seven to eight assailants, presumably Malay Muslim Separatists, broke into a house in Budi village, Moo 9, tambon Sateng Nok (Mueang Yala district, Yala) and stole a pick-up truck. The authorities believed the truck will be used to assemble a car bomb.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: Defusal: On 21 March 2021, a booby trap planted by Malay Muslim Separatists on a roadside in tambon Balo (Raman district, Yala) was discovered and safely defused by the EOD. No injuries reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Thailand (2019-) Village Security Team
NOTES: Property destruction: On 12 April 2021, six armed men, presumably Malay Muslim Separatists, tied up 2 village chief security assistants before setting fire to 3 vehicles belonging to a construction company in Balu Kaluwa village, Moo 1, tambon Nam Dam (Thung Yang Daeng district, Pattani). The vehicles were destroyed but the village assistants were unharmed. The police did not rule out personal conflicts as the motivation of the attack. This is a common surge in violent incidents occurring annually around the start of the Ramadan month.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Thailand (2019-) Village Security Team
NOTES: Property destruction: On 12 April 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to a security outpost belonging to the village security team in Thung Phra Yot village, Moo 10, tambon Lam Phlai (Thepha district, Songkhla). This is a common surge in violent incidents occurring annually around the start of the Ramadan month.

Property destruction: On 12 April 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to 2 telephone signal towers in Chalo Bo-ngo village, Moo 5 and Ba-ngo Yaha village, Moo 6, and 2 surveillance cameras installed by the government in Sarong village, Moo 3 of tambon Khao Tum (Yarang district, Pattani). No injuries reported. This is a common surge in violent incidents occurring annually around the start of the Ramadan month.

Property destruction: On 12 April 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to tires and tied a fake bomb on electricity poles in Khuan Pra village, Moo 7, and Salalak village, of tambon Na Pradu (Khok Pho district, Pattani). No injuries reported.

Non-violent activity: On 19 April 2021, a joint force of police, military and local authorities raided a house in Upe village, Moo 9, tambon Krong Pinang (Krong Pinang district, Yala). The Malay Muslim Separatists suspects escaped. No violence occurred.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Border Patrol Police
NOTES: Other: On 22 April 2021, on Thanlwin river located at the Thai-Myanmar border, near Tha Fa Fang village (Mae Yuam, Mae Sariang district, Mae Hong Song province), the Myanmar military LIB 340 warning shots above a civilian boat carrying Thai border patrol personnel. No injuries reported.

Weapons seizure: On 28 April 2021, arrested Malay Muslim Separatist suspect brought the military to the site where pipe bombs and explosive components were hidden in Yuelapae village, Moo 3, tambon Suwari (Rueso district, Narathiwat).

Displacement: On 28 April 2021, following air raids by the Myanmar military over an IDP camp in Mutro district of Kayin state, Myanmar, around 200-300 villagers crossed the Salaween river to seek refuge in Thai territory near Tha Ta Fang village, tambon Mae Yuam (Mae Sariang district, Mae Hong Son).
Property destruction: On 29 April 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to a public gazebo (pavilion) in Ba-ngo Mulong village, tambon Trobon (Sai Buri district, Pattani). No injuries reported.

Property destruction: On 29 April 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists set fire to Bang Kao Tambon Administrative Office and one truck belonging to the office in tambon Bang Kao (Sai Buri district, Pattani). No injuries reported.

Security measures: On 6 May 2021, the police and military in Yala announced an increase in security surveillance leading up to the Eid al Fitri holiday on which Malay Muslim Separatists would usually carry out attacks. Additional checkpoints were set up and additional security officers were deployed for patrols.

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Thailand (2019-) Volunteer Defense Corps
NOTES: Looting: On 18 May 2021, unknown assailants broke into the Volunteer Defense Corps base in Mueang Narathiwat district (Narathiwat) and stole 26 assault rifles. Some 6 rifles were found in the hands of Malay Muslim Separatists.

Movement of forces: On 20 May 2021, heavy artilleries and additionalThai military troops were mobilized to the military outpost in Tha Ta Fang village, tambon Mae Yuam (Mae Sariang district, Mae Hong Son). This followed the Myanmar military's firing of shells at the village and their intimidation to open fire at the village for allegedly sheltering KNU fighters.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: Defusal: On 24 May 2021, EOD police found and defused an IED planted by Malay Muslim Separatists on a roadside in Puyu village, Moo 1, tambon Ko Sathon (Tak Bai district, Yala). No injuries reported.

Property destruction: On 2 June 2021, Malay Muslim Separatists destroyed 11 surveillance cameras in 7 locations in Thung Yang Daeng district (Pattani). Flyers were left at the scene with threat of further destruction of property if civilians continue to allow the authorities to install surveillance cameras on their property. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: Defusal: On 26 June 2021, EOD police defused an IED believed to be planted by Malay Muslim Separatists found in the field in Bue Re village, Moo 7, tambon Bare Tai (Bacho district, Narathiwat). No injuries reported.

Property destruction: On 9 July 2021, an unidentified armed group set fire to an Isuzu pick-up truck which was parked inside the Chief Executive office of Bang Kro in tambon Bang Kro, Khok Pho district (Pattani). The truck was a government-issued vehicle belonging to the chief executive. The motive behind the arson attack was yet to be determined. No fatalities nor injuries reported.

On 18 July 2021, police arrested 14 student demonstrators from the People's Party near Laksi Monument Roundabout in kwaeng Tha Raeng, Bang Khen district (Bangkok) (coded as Bangkok - Bang Khen) for their participation in a violent demonstration on July 16 in front of the Ministry of Public Health in Talat Kwan, tambon Talat Khwan, Mueang Nonthaburi district (Nonthaburi). Police seized their two pickup trucks, two one foot-long machetes, a baton and 14 slingshots. They were brought to the police station for a formal acknowledgement of charges and remained in detention.

Defusal: On 4 August 2021, Thai police successfully defused two explosives that were found at a local gas station in Moo 2, tambon Bannang Sata, Bannang Sata district (Yala). No fatalities nor injuries reported. Investigations were still ongoing on the identities of the person who planted the bombs.

Defusal: On 19 August 2021, Thai police successfully defused a time bomb weighing over 20 kilograms hidden inside a fire distinguisher, which had been planted presumably by Malay Muslim separatists, at a local utility pole in Bue Ra Ngae village, tambon To Deng, Su-Ngai Padi district (Narathiwat). No injuries or fatalities reported.

Property destruction: On 20 August 2021, an unknown number of assailants, presumably Malay Muslim Separatists, set on fire three trucks of Bannang Sata Sub district Administrative Office that were parked at a garage in Ngo Kapo village, tambon Bannang Sata, Bannang Sata district (Yala). The vehicles were severely damaged. No injuries or fatalities reported.

Property destruction: On 6 September 2021, a group of assailants whom authorities suspected were Malay Muslim separatists burnt down a telephone tower in Ko Ba To village, tambon Mo Mawi, Yarang district (Pattani). No injuries nor fatalities reported.

Property destruction: On 6 September 2021, a group of assailants whom authorities suspected were Malay Muslim separatists set three public CCTV cameras on fire in tambon Khuean Bang Lang, Bannang Sata district (Yala). No injuries nor fatalities reported.

Property destruction: On 7 September 2021, assailants, presumably Malay Muslim separatists, carried out an arson attack against the Sub-district Administrative Office of Sakho Bon in Mayo district (Pattani). No injuries nor fatalities reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Thailand (2019-) Explosive Ordinance Disposal
NOTES: Defusal: On 9 September 2021, Thai police successfully defused a motion-triggered explosive which police suspected had been planted by Malay Muslim separatists inside a rubber farm of a Buddhist resident in Moo 6 village, tambon Su-Ngai Padi, Su-Ngai Padi district (Narathiwat).

Looting: On 12 October 2021, 12 Myanmar army officers from Jok Ya army base by the Salween river looted a cargo vessel of Thai villagers near tambon Mae Sam Laep, Sop Moei district (Mae Hong Son). The vessel were transporting goods to Ban Mae Nuta in Myanmar's Karen State. Several shots were heard. The officers took food supplies, such as instant noodles and canned fish, while the captain and the vessel were allowed to travel on.
